Name: College Avalon - Quebec City
Overview: College Avalon, recognized by the Ministry of Education and Higher Education, is an accredited educational institution established in 1995 in Quebec. The city has a vibrant education system, with an annual enrollment of 50000 students. Along with its Quebec City campus, the institute also has a branch in Montreal. With a student-centric and supportive environment, College Avalon offers flexible schedules and financial assistance to eligible residents of Quebec. The curriculum has been enhanced to cover a wide range of business programs. The institute offers two types of courses - Ministerial Courses and Language Courses - approved by the Ministry of Education and Higher Education. The English as a Second Language (ESL) and French as a Second Language (FSL) courses are available at both the Quebec City and Montreal campuses. The fee structure for Ministerial Courses ranges from $11,500 to $17,000 for domestic students, depending on the program. For international students, the fees are between $17,000 to $24,000. Moreover, all international students are also eligible for a $1000 scholarship from the institute. The Language Course fees for Beginners, Elementary, and Pre-intermediate levels are approximately $5300, while for Intermediate, High Intermediate, and Advanced levels, it is around $3400. College Avalon offers three Ministerial Courses, including the 15-month Executive Assistant (AEC-LCE.00) program, which is offered in both Quebec City and Montreal campuses. The 24-month International Business Management (AEC-LCA.FM) and Computerized Accounting & Financial Management (AEC-LCA.FN) courses are only available at the Montreal campus. The intakes for all these programs take place in January, May, and September. International students at College Avalon are eligible for Post-Graduation Work Permit (PSWP) opportunities.
Eligibility Overview: The minimum English language requirement for this university is an overall score of 6.0 in the IELTS exam, with acceptance of a band score of 5.5. Another accepted language test is the PTE, with a minimum score of 54 in total and no module scoring less than 50 points. The Duolingo test is also an accepted option, with a minimum score of 110. All applicants who meet these qualifications will receive an offer letter within two business days. Upon graduation, students are eligible for a Post Graduate Work Permit.

Name: Fanshawe College - London
Overview: Fanshawe College of Applied Arts and Technology is widely recognized as one of Ontario's premier universities. As Canada's largest university, its London campus has even been dubbed "A city within a city." The college's main objective is to impart practical knowledge and skills that are relevant in today's ever-evolving world. It offers a diverse range of programs in applied arts, business, healthcare, human services, hospitality, and technology, among others. With a wide selection of over 200 degrees, diplomas, apprenticeships, and certification courses, the college strives to cater to the unique career aspirations of its students. Its approach to education is tailored to meet the demands of the corporate world, making it a top choice for future professionals. Students are given hands-on experience through the college's on-site restaurant, making it the ultimate destination for those interested in the hospitality industry. Each year, the college succeeds in providing quality education to a total of 43,000 students. Of these, an impressive number of 7,700 come from diverse international backgrounds, including China, India, Korea, Vietnam, Africa, Turkey, Russia, and Ukraine. Employers have a high regard for Fanshawe's graduates, knowing they possess the necessary skills and expertise to excel in their respective fields. The faculty at Fanshawe bring years of practical experience to their teachings, ensuring that students receive the most relevant and up-to-date knowledge. Furthermore, the college also offers over 650 scholarships and bursaries, further solidifying its commitment to its students' success.
Eligibility Overview: As part of the admission process at Fanshawe College, the minimum requirements may vary depending on the chosen program. For post-secondary programs, a high school diploma and specific subject scores are mandatory. Post-graduate programs require applicants to have a college diploma, university degree, or equivalent, along with two years of practical experience in certain courses. For international students seeking a bachelor's degree, a final grade point average of 65% in their top six Grade 12 courses is necessary. It is necessary for applicants from non-English speaking countries to take an English proficiency exam, such as IELTS Academic, TOEFL, Pearson Test of English (Academic), or Duolingo English Test (DET), as all courses are conducted in English. The length of the exam will depend on the program level, with different specifications for post-secondary diploma, advanced diploma, or certificate programs, and graduate certificate and degree programs.

Placement: Fanshawe, similar to all Canadian institutes, does not provide direct placements. However, it excels in providing thorough preparation for the job market. Courses are meticulously designed to align with real-world demands. Moreover, a wide range of Co-op courses are offered, allowing students to work while studying. Such experience holds immense value for one's curriculum vitae. Gaining relevant experience prior to graduation instills confidence in the corporate world. The placement records at Fanshawe are outstanding, with 90.3% of graduates securing employment within 6 months of graduation. The 2018-2019 graduate report reveals that Fanshawe boasts a KPI graduate employment rate of 85.8%, exceeding the provincial average of 85.5%. A significant contribution to this success can be attributed to the college's career services department, offering assistance in job hunting. Their services encompass resume and cover letter writing, interview preparation, and upskilling. The department conducts workshops on resume writing, job seeking, and demo interviews regularly. Fanshawe organizes job fairs providing opportunities to network with prominent employers. Companies also utilize the college portal to advertise job openings. Hard-working students receive commendable recommendations or even referrals from their professors. On average, a Fanshawe graduate earns a salary between $35,000 to $45,000. As per the 2018-2019 graduate report, the average salary for Advanced Communication for Professionals is $35,806, Applied Mechanical Design graduates earn $37,073, and Applied Technology graduates earn an average salary of $43,032.
Accommodation:
Fanshawe College has a beautiful campus in London, which aims to create a home-like environment for its students. The university's name is derived from the words "fane" and "shaw," which translate to a "temple in the woods." This name is apt for the campus, which is situated in a lush green area. The institution takes great care in providing safe and comfortable accommodation options for students, which includes on-campus and off-campus facilities.

Students can choose from various accommodation alternatives offered by Fanshawe, including on-campus residences and off-campus options. On-campus residences consist of apartment-style buildings, namely Falcon, Peregrine, and Merlin, which collectively house 1220 students. These buildings provide 415 fully furnished units, equipped with amenities like air conditioning, heating, high-speed internet, and free laundry services. The residence also has resident advisors present on each floor at all times, ensuring the safety and well-being of the students. Additionally, there is a townhouse-style residence called Kestrel Court, which offers 66 units to accommodate 396 students. These units, located directly across from the college entrance, can house up to six students and come fully-furnished. The townhouse also has a 24/7 accessible residence office, and parking facilities are available at an extra cost. Similar to the apartment-style residence, the townhouse also offers high-speed internet and free laundry services, with no additional bills to pay. However, students residing in traditional apartment-style residences must opt for a meal plan, which costs $1,200 per term.

While the university does not provide off-campus housing directly, it assists students in finding suitable options. Fanshawe has an online inventory of available rental properties that students can browse through. Moreover, the college has a partnership with the Canada Homestay network, which helps students adjust to homestay experiences. This partnership provides students with the assurance that the university will support them in finding suitable accommodation. 

Overall, Fanshawe College ensures that students have access to safe, comfortable, and convenient housing options during their academic journey. The institution takes pride in creating a home away from home for its students, making their experience at the university memorable and enjoyable.

Name: Cornerstone International Community College of Canada - West Hastings
Overview: Cornerstone International Community College of Canada is a prominent public university situated in Vancouver, British Columbia. It has earned a reputation for offering highly recognized diploma and certificate programs with Co-op components in Web & Mobile App Development, Network & System Solutions Specialist, Digital Marketing Specialist, Hospitality Management, and English Language Training. The college boasts two convenient campuses in close proximity to each other, West Hastings and Cornerstone Tech. All diploma programs come with an attached co-operative work experience to ensure students are well-equipped for the workforce. In addition, specialized programs are designed in collaboration with professionals from diverse industries to provide students with the most relevant and up-to-date education. The college offers flexible intakes for its programs, catering to the needs of both local and international students. Cornerstone International Community College of Canada also provides an opportunity for its international student body of over 72 nationalities to gain paid work experience during their academic term. This creates a culturally diverse environment on campus. To accommodate its growing student population, the college offers both on-campus and off-campus residential facilities. The college stands out by offering its students a choice between online and in-class learning, allowing them to specialize in their desired fields with practical hands-on experience. With a 96% job placement rate in the first month of Co-op, the college is committed to preparing students for success in the competitive industry. The financial needs of international students are also taken into consideration, and the college offers scholarships to cover tuition and accommodation costs. With a focus on providing high-quality education and practical experience, Cornerstone International Community College of Canada aims to produce skilled and experienced professionals who can meet the demands of the ever-evolving industry.

University Admission Requirements for English Courses

The English Placement Test conducted by CICCC is mandatory for all students enrolling in English courses. The purpose of this test is to determine their English proficiency level and assign them to the appropriate class.

Admission Requirements for Diploma Programs
In order to be placed in the suitable class, diploma applicants will be required to take the CICCC English Placement Test, unless they can provide their previous English proficiency results. Meeting all the prerequisites is essential to begin diploma programs.

Name: Trinity Western University
Overview: Trinity Western University, located in British Columbia, Canada, is a leading private Christian university known for its liberal arts programs. Founded in 1962, it has emerged as one of the largest privately-funded Christian institutions in the country. The university boasts eight faculties and offers 48 graduate degrees and 19 undergraduate degrees in various fields. Among its best programs are the Master of Business Administration (MBA), Master of Science in Nursing (MSN), and Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA). Spanning over 157 acres, the main campus in Langley, BC houses modern facilities such as the Norma Marion Alloway Library, Stanley Nelson Student Centre, and Learning Commons to cater to the diverse academic needs of its students. Additionally, Trinity Western University has satellite campuses in Bellingham, Richmond, and Ottawa, providing select programs in these areas. With over 100 student organizations and clubs, the university offers a vibrant student life outside of academics. Notable alumni include Member of Parliament Mark Strahl, Olympian and volleyball player Chaim Schalk, and ice hockey player Ryan Walter. The average annual cost of attendance at the university ranges from CAD 22,000 to CAD 25,000 and is dedicated to shaping students into leaders grounded by Christian values. As a Christian institution, Trinity Western University strives to develop well-rounded individuals and future leaders.
Eligibility Overview:
International students seeking admission to Trinity Western University must fulfill the given eligibility criteria as well as meet the English language requirements. These criteria and requirements are different for undergraduate and graduate programs offered by the university. Here are the specifics:

                                Requirements for Undergraduates:
- Applicants must have at least two passes on their Higher School Certificate at the principal level.
- International Baccalaureate (IB) students must have two subjects at the higher level.
- Matriculation certification is mandatory for admission.
- Non-native English speakers must provide a score demonstrating language proficiency.

Requirements for Graduates:
- An undergraduate degree from a recognized university or college is necessary.
- A minimum GPA of 3.0 is required for the undergraduate degree.
- Some graduate courses may require a GRE or GMAT score.
- Applicants from non-English-speaking countries must provide a language proficiency score.

Language Proficiency Scores:
- TOEFL: A minimum score of 80 on the internet-based test or 550 on the paper-based test is required.
- IELTS: A minimum score of 6.5 is required.
- CAEL: A minimum score of 70 is required.
- MELAB: A minimum score of 75 is required.
- PTE: A minimum score of 58 is required.

Name: Sheridan College
Overview:
Sheridan College was established in 1967 and has 400 students enrolled. Over the years, it has grown to become one of the most prominent postsecondary institutions in Ontario. Every year, around 22,500 full-time and 18,500 continuing and part-time students from different parts of Canada and the world choose to study at Sheridan College, which has three campuses located in Oakville, Brampton, and Mississauga.

With its award-winning curriculum, Sheridan College boasts a diverse range of programs in the fields of arts, business, community service, health, technology, and skilled professions. Its graduate number has surpassed 200,000, with each individual playing a significant role in shaping the future of our society.

At Sheridan College, students have access to world-class facilities and exceptional professors who conduct groundbreaking research in various fields, including creative studies and digital innovation. The college currently has 1908 students and employs around 150 faculty members and staff who actively engage in over 234 ongoing research projects. Additionally, Sheridan has five research centers specializing in music theatre, elder research, advanced manufacturing and design technologies, mobile innovation, and screen industries research, along with an entrepreneurship hub that collaborates with over 400 business partners to promote extraordinary research activities.

For students looking for off-campus accommodation, Sheridan offers furnished apartments with shared kitchen and laundry facilities, ensuring modern, clean and secure living spaces that are smoke-free. The college has partnered with Places4Students, Canada Homestay Network, and Canada Homeshare to offer cost-effective and safe living options for international students. The tuition fees at Sheridan University range from C$1,038 to C$3,800.

Contact our advisors today to get started on your language learning journey.

Name: SELC Career College Vancouver
Overview:
This data pertains to a prominent university that was founded in 1985 in the bustling city of Sydney, Australia. It started as a school that solely focused on vocational training and language studies for students in Vancouver. In 2012, the university expanded its presence by establishing a campus in Vancouver, Canada, with the primary aim of providing quality education for students to help them pave a successful career path.

The SELC Career College Vancouver is situated on Water Street in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. It offers a wide array of programs, including a career college program, ESL program, and BCIT Pathway. The BCIT Pathway is specifically designed for individuals who wish to pursue a career in business, become entrepreneurs, or excel as managers in their preferred industry. SELC College, in partnership with British Columbia Institute of Technology (BCIT), has created the SELC College-BCIT Pathway. This partnership allows graduates of SELC College to transfer to BCIT's School of Business, providing them with an opportunity to advance their careers.

SELC College also offers an FDU Pathway, along with a 4-week ESL program that includes various electives and workshops, allowing students from different regions to enhance their language skills. Additionally, the college offers a Hospitality Management Diploma Program and a Business Foundation Certificate Program, providing students with insight into service and operational issues, a competitive edge in the hospitality industry, and essential business management skills.

Apart from its specialized programs, SELC Career College Vancouver provides updated classroom facilities and co-op placement opportunities that prepare students for the workforce in today's competitive environment. The college also offers academic counseling sessions and a variety of accommodation options for a well-rounded learning experience.

In summary, SELC Career College Vancouver offers exceptional vocational training and academic support to students while providing them with a suitable environment for their overall development. Its commitment to preparing job-ready graduates has made it a top choice for students seeking quality education.

Name: University of Fredericton
Overview: The University of Fredericton, established in 2005, is a publicly owned institution spanning over 142 acres in Fredericton, New Brunswick, Canada. Its two main campuses in Saint John and Fredericton, as well as its satellite campuses in Bathurst and Moncton, boast advanced facilities such as state-of-the-art laboratories, extensive libraries, top-of-the-line computer centers, and modern art studios. The university is composed of various faculties including Arts, Science, Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Kinesiology, Law, Nursing & Health Sciences, Leadership Studies, and Forestry & Environmental Management. Students can choose from a diverse range of courses, consisting of 75 undergraduate and 28 graduate programs in fields such as Anthropology, Arts, Mathematics, and Business Administration. The university has a population of over 7,300 students, and a acceptance rate of 75%. Prospective students can apply for admission in any of the three intakes - Summer, Winter, and Fall-, provided they meet the eligibility criteria of an IELTS score of 6.5 and above or TOEFL score of 85 and above. The tuition fees for undergraduate and postgraduate courses are currently set at 16,900 CAD per year on average, with an additional admission fee of 55 CAD. The university also offers various financial aid options for international students ranging from 500 CAD to 52,000 CAD, including Entrance Scholarships, Schulich Leaders Scholarship, Beaverbrook Scholars Award, and more. The university also has on-campus residence halls like Aitken House, Bridges House, Joy Kidd House, Magee House, Lady Dunn Hall, Harrison House, and Tibbite Hall, all of which offer different types of accommodation options such as single, double, suite, and shared rooms. The residence fees range from 4,500 CAD to 5,400 CAD, covering heating, high-speed internet, and dining facilities. With an impressive graduation rate of 78%, students from the University of Fredericton have access to a wide range of placement and internship opportunities, thanks to various fairs and seminars organized by the university.
Eligibility Overview: For Indian students, the minimum grade requirement for admission into this university is a 60% or higher on recognized certification exams such as the All India Senior School Certificate, Intermediate Certificate, Higher Secondary School Certificate, Indian School Certificate Examination, or General Certificate of Education (GCE). Additionally, students must also display proficiency in the English language with a minimum score of 75% on the CBSE & CISCE English Year 12 examinations. This specific criteria is applicable only to students from India, and is aimed at ensuring a high level of academic achievement and language proficiency within the student body. By maintaining these standards, we can guarantee a diverse yet qualified student population that will excel in our rigorous academic programs and contribute positively to the university community.

Name: Dalhousie University
Overview: Nova Scotia's Dalhousie University, a public research institution established in 1818, has campuses in various cities. Its wide range of offerings includes over 4,000 courses and about 180 academic programs at the undergraduate, graduate, and professional levels. Popular majors at DU include Biology and Biochemistry, Engineering, Business and Management, Computer Sciences, Material Sciences, Psychology/ Psychiatry, and Public, Environmental, and Occupational Health. Dalhousie's primary campus, Studley Campus, is located in Halifax, Nova Scotia, with two additional campuses – Carleton and Sexton – nearby. The university also has a campus in Bible Hill, Truro, and medical teaching facilities in Saint John, New Brunswick. The student-faculty ratio at DU is favorable, standing at 20:1. On-campus housing options are available for students at Halifax and Truro campuses, with eight resident halls and apartments accommodating around 2,600 students. Students can explore various employment options, including part-time on-campus jobs, summer employment, co-op education, internships, and post-graduation placements, at the Bissett Student Success Centre. The university's estimated cost of attendance for international undergraduate students is 22671 CAD, and for graduate students, it is 38366 CAD, exclusive of additional expenses. International and domestic students can also apply for scholarships ranging from 460 to 36808 CAD. Other financial aids, such as bursaries, loans, and credit lines, are also available at Dalhousie University.
Eligibility Overview: Admission to courses at Dalhousie University is solely based on merit, with candidates needing to fulfill both the university's admission and programme requirements. It should be noted that meeting these requirements is essential for prospective students. In order to gain admission, international students must maintain a minimum overall average of 70% or a GPA of 3.0. However, it is worth noting that in the most recent academic year, the minimum average grade for first-year students was 87.6%. One of the primary conditions for admission is a demonstration of English proficiency, and this can be achieved by providing the results of any of the recognized English proficiency tests listed below. For those whose first language is not English, it is mandatory to submit these test scores to assess their level of English proficiency.

Accommodation:
The information provided pertains to living arrangements for students attending this university. Options include on-campus living in residences and off-campus housing. Both options provide benefits and resources to support students in their academic journey. 

On-campus living allows for complete immersion in the campus community with easy access to classes, friends, gathering spots, and sports facilities. Assistance is readily available for academic success and adjusting to university life. Meals are provided, and amenities such as internet, cable, and local phone services are included. Residences offer a social environment with potential long-lasting friendships. There are two types of on-campus living options: traditional dorm-style residences with single rooms and non-traditional apartment-style residences with the choice to purchase a meal plan. 

For those who prefer a more private and independent lifestyle, off-campus housing is available. Finding an apartment can be challenging, but the university's Off-Campus Living office provides resources and online services to assist students in their search. In addition, information on tenancy, relocation planning, and finding roommates is also available. Meal plans are an option for off-campus students, providing access to various dining options. For more details, visit the Off-Campus Living website and explore the meal plan alternatives for students in Halifax and Truro.

Name: Tamwood
Overview: Tamwood International College, established in 1992, is a privately owned career college and language school situated in British Columbia, Canada. Every year, more than 3,000 students enroll at Tamwood, and the college has produced 72,354 successful graduates to date. Tamwood offers a diverse range of 43 programs in four key areas - Business, Digital Skills, Hospitality and Tourism, focusing on equipping students with industry-relevant and professional skills. With three campuses located in British Columbia and Ontario - Vancouver, Whistler, and Toronto, as well as several camps across North America, such as Vancouver, Los Angeles, Boston, and Montreal, Tamwood provides an array of options for its students. The hallmark of Tamwood is its innovative Work and Study programs, which allow students to gain practical experience while pursuing industry-designed courses taught by experienced professionals. The programs offered include Digital Marketing, UX Design Professional, and Web Development Professional. Moreover, Tamwood also offers International Camps for 7-17-year-olds, providing them with a platform to improve language, communication, leadership, and creative thinking skills. These camps include programs like Global Learner, Outdoor Leadership, Robotics, and English+ Activity. Tamwood Language Centers offer an array of English language programs, such as ESL Pathway, General English, International Business English, and IELTS, to prepare students for academic and professional purposes. A renowned program at Tamwood is the Tamwood Pathway Program that prepares students for further education by offering certificate/diploma courses and ESL Pathways to improve academic and English skills. The tuition fees for Work + Study programs start at CAD 6,595, making Tamwood an affordable choice for quality education. The college also provides various student housing options, including homestay with both single and shared rooms, along with shared bathroom facilities. Students can also choose to stay at hostels such as Alpine Lodge, Whistler Lodge Hostel, and Hostelling International Whistler, or live with a host family. To add to the overall experience, Tamwood offers a variety of recreational activities and tours for its students to participate in, and also has programs like the Tamwood Ranger Program or Ambassador Program for students to join and enhance their learning experience.

Accommodation:
Experience a true Canadian lifestyle with our homestay program! Immerse yourself in a multicultural environment by staying with carefully selected families from various backgrounds. Many students prefer this option for its convenience, affordability, and safety, especially if it's their first time travelling to a foreign country.

Our Accommodation Manager carefully vets and chooses friendly hosts who provide a warm and secure atmosphere. By staying with a host family, you'll have the opportunity to engage in multicultural conversations and learn about Canadian customs and traditions.

When selecting homestays, cleanliness and safety are our top priorities. All of our homestays are located in safe areas. Our families are required to provide a private, furnished room with:

- A window
- A comfortable bed with fresh linens, pillows, and a pillowcase
- A dresser, desk, chair, lamp, and closet
- Access to a bathroom and its amenities
- Laundry facilities, detergent, and instructions for use
- Meals as requested by your meal plan (full board or half board)
- A key to the residence and instructions for using any security systems, if applicable.

Eager to learn more about our homestay program? Visit our website for further details and frequently asked questions.

Name: St Clair College - Downtown Campus
Overview: St. Clair College - Downtown Campus, founded in 1966, is situated in Windsor, Ontario. It is a renowned public college and the first post-secondary institution to be established downtown. As of November 20, 2021, St. Clair College has been accredited by the Higher Learning Commission. The Downtown Campus offers a diverse selection of 18 programs, including Journalism, Data Analytics for Business, Graphic Design, Border Services, Paralegal, Community and Justice Services, Human Resource Management, Public Relations, Event Management, and more. The campus boasts a state-of-the-art Mediaplex, one of only three in the world, where students can gain hands-on experience in Journalism, Media Convergence, and Public Relations. It also houses three computer labs, an open lab, and a learning lab for radio, television, print, and online news filing. Recently, the campus has expanded its facilities, adding the Zekelman School of Business near the St. Clair College Centre of the Arts at One Riverside Drive. The new addition provides specialized data analytics labs for programs such as International Business Management and Business. St. Clair College also offers a variety of online courses, including Fire Protection, Business Communication, Accounting, Statistical Concepts, and Management Principles. Students enrolled at St. Clair College can avail of financial aid in the form of Awards, Scholarships, and Bursaries. The college offers numerous scholarships, worth a total value of over $535,000.00 in February or March. The tuition fees vary per course, with programs like Media Films (2-3 years duration) costing CAD 8,167 and Management (1-3 years duration) costing CAD 7,917. This college boasts an impressive employability rate, with notable alumni, such as renowned art director Matt Boismier.

Academic Criteria: 
You must meet the following academic requirements: 
 
Course-Specific 
To apply for the Nursing BSc program, you must have completed NOSSD with at least six grade 12 (U/M) courses, where you must have secured a minimum of 65% in English, and 70% overall in Chemistry and Biology. Additionly, you are also expected to have studied Mathematics. Alternatively, you can also apply through the pre-health sciences pathway to advance diploma and degree certificate. 

For the Social Justice and Legal Studies (Honors Bachelors in Applied Arts), you must have completed OSSD or its equivalent. Furthermore, you should have secure at least a 65% in six university courses at grade 12 levels. Additionally, a minimum of 65% in English is required, along with a minimum of 60% in the remaining courses. It is also recommended to have studied Mathematics in grade 12. 

For admission to the Business Administration (Information Communication Technology) program, you can either have completed OSSD or its equivalent, or have obtained a minimum of 65% in six university courses at grade 12 level. Additionally, you must have studied English with a minimum of 65% overall, along with Advanced Functions or Calculus and Vectors in Mathematics. Finally, you must have successfully completed four other grade 12 courses. 

For admission to Graphic Design, you must have completed OSSD or its equivalent. Additionally, it is preferable to have completed at least one arts or media class. Finally, a strong portfolio will also be considered as part of the admission process

Off-Campus Accommodation: Students can choose from studio, three-bedroom, four-bedroom, or shared apartments with a typical monthly rent between 550 and 600 CAD. Name: Western Town College
Overview: Western Town College is a language institute located in Toronto, Canada that has been operating for over 20 years and prides itself on providing top-notch ESL education programs. The campus is situated at 150 Eglinton Ave E #7F, just a short distance from the bustling intersection of Yonge and Eglinton. With a focus on English language development, the college offers a wide range of courses including "General English," "Let's Talk," "Power Talk Master," "IELTS Preparation Program," "English Enhancement Training," and "Camp Program." The campus is equipped with 20 classrooms, student computers, free Wi-Fi, and a student lounge. Its prime location is in close proximity to shopping centers, restaurants, library, subway, and movie theatres, making it a convenient and easily accessible learning hub. The College also has an extensive calendar of activities, which are organized for students on a weekly basis. Students from all over the world choose Western Town College, with representation from countries such as Brazil, South Korea, Japan, Latin America, and China, among others. In addition, the college offers a pathway program that prepares students for admission to universities and colleges in Canada and the United States. This program focuses on essential skills such as summarizing articles, writing university-level essays, conducting academic research, and presentations. Students who successfully complete the program can gain admission to affiliated colleges such as Lakehead University, Acadia University, Algoma University, Confederation College, Cambrian College, Niagara College Canada, University of Prince Edward Island, University of Regina, and St. Lawrence College. At Western Town College, students experience a unique and enjoyable learning environment, thanks to the interactive and creative teaching methods employed by the highly qualified faculty.

Name: Saint Mary's University
Overview:
Saint Mary's University, founded in 1802, is a public institution situated in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada, spanning over 80 acres of land. The university offers a diverse range of courses, including 44 undergraduate programs, 27 postgraduate programs, 9 certificates and diplomas, and 5 continuing education courses in disciplines such as Business and Accounting, Liberal Arts, Engineering, Science, Health, Psychology, and Environmental Studies. Prominent programs offered here include M.B.A., M.Sc. in Computing and Data Analytics, M.Tech., M.I.M., and B.Com. The tuition fee for international students typically ranges from CAD 1906 to 2,115, which makes it a cost-effective option for students seeking quality education in Canada. The university provides generous financial aid worth CAD 7.9 million annually to international students, including scholarships such as the Academic Achievement Scholarship valued at CAD 1000 to 3500, the Accounting Achievement Award of CAD 1000, Presidential International Baccalaureate Scholarships, and need-based bursaries.

Saint Mary’s University offers excellent support services to students, including a dedicated career centre that offers career guidance, resume writing assistance, job placement services, co-curricular record, cooperative education, and service-learning opportunities. With its affordable tuition fees, wide range of courses, and strong support services, Saint Mary’s University is a perfect choice for international students looking to pursue higher education in Canada.
Eligibility Overview: At St. Mary's University, students are required to demonstrate competency in the English language for admission. Proof of English proficiency is an important requirement for all applicants. If you have studied in the United States, you may already meet the criteria for English proficiency. There are various options available to submit proof of proficiency to St. Mary's University. These include taking an English as a Foreign Language Exam such as the TOEFL, where a minimum score of 80 on the Internet-based test (87 for MBA programs/certificate) is required for full admission. Another option is the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), where a minimum band score of 6.0 is needed for admission (6.5 for MBA programs/certificate). For the Duolingo English Test (DET), a score of at least 105 is required for full admission. It is important to note that some graduate programs may have different requirements for English proficiency. We recommend checking with the graduate admission department for specific details. Our commitment to providing quality education includes ensuring that all students have a strong command of the English language.
Placement:
St. Mary’s College is dedicated to the growth and success of its students. Our facility offers state-of-the-art infrastructure with modern amenities and academic programs that focus on nurturing young minds. The college also strives to provide a safe and secure environment for our students. Apart from academics, we also emphasize extra-curricular activities to promote overall development and cultivate diverse talents.

St. Mary’s College has a strong Corporate Relationship Cell that plays a crucial role in placing our students in top companies. This cell proactively strives to find ideal opportunities for internships and job placements. Our strong rapport with recruiting firms and corporations helps us in finding the best matches for our students. The cell also organizes Management Development Programs and student training initiatives to enhance their skill set. At the same time, our individual counseling sessions prepare our students for campus placements.

Please visit our website for more information on our exceptional placement opportunities and other campus activities.

There are multiple housing options available, allowing students to tailor their living arrangements according to their specific needs and preferences. It is the ideal way to immerse yourself in the heart of the campus and connect with people from various backgrounds. Name: University of Northern British Columbia
Overview: Columbia College, situated in the picturesque city of Vancouver, in the province of British Columbia, Canada, came into existence in 1936 as a privately owned institution. With a high acceptance rate of 90% and a low student-faculty ratio of 6:1, the college offers a variety of programs including University Transfer Program, Associate Degree Program, High School Program and Academic ESC. Through its Associate Degree programs, which are equivalent to the first and second year of a 4-year undergraduate degree, the college offers subjects like Business Administration, Computer Science, Economics, Psychology, Mathematics and many more. Set in an urban location, the college boasts of two campuses - the Main Campus and the North Campus, equipped with modern facilities such as laboratories, libraries, student lounges and more, fostering a dynamic learning environment. With a track record of about 300 companies hiring its students annually, the college aims to provide ample opportunities for its students to jumpstart their careers. It must be noted that as the college does not provide on-campus accommodation, students, particularly international ones, are required to make appropriate arrangements for their stay. The tuition fee for the University Transfer Program, with a duration of one year and 30 credits, is 16,050 CAD, while for 60 credits, it is 32,100 CAD. To further ease the financial burden on students, the college offers various scholarships such as Columbia College Entrance Scholarships, Outstanding Student Scholarships, Gary Swanson English Preparation Scholarships, John Idelm Memorial Scholarships and others.
Eligibility Overview:
UNBC is proud to have a diverse and dynamic community, with a total of 396 international students hailing from over 40 countries. Our university is open to considering applications from students who have completed their education from a suitable high school or a recognized post-secondary institution. Each application from international students is reviewed individually based on their own merits. To prove proficiency in English language, any of the below mentioned examinations may be used (UNBC's TOEFL code is 0320):

- A high school diploma from a suitable educational institution
- Score from a standardized test, like TOEFL, IELTS, or CAEL
- Transcripts from English as a First Language schooling
- Proof of completion of a post-secondary English language program

It is to be noted that the proof of proficiency in English language is a mandatory requirement for consideration of admission for international students. Each applicant will be assessed on their own merits and admission is not guaranteed solely based on the

Placement: The Student Career Center (SCC) at UNBC is dedicated to helping students build their careers by offering services such as organizing co-operative work term placements, posting part-time and full-time jobs, hosting career-building workshops, and facilitating employer recruiting sessions. As per statistical data, 16% of UNBC graduates earn more than $100,000 per year, while 50% earn more than $60,000 per year. In addition, the university's career services include job search preparation, arranging employer recruitment and information sessions, organizing yearly on-campus career fairs, providing part-time and full-time student job opportunities, and assisting with work term placements for co-operative education. Graduates have access to the career and employability team for 12 months, where they can receive support in finding jobs in Canada, writing job applications, career planning, and interview preparation. The university also offers diverse internship opportunities ranging from one to five months, both paid and unpaid, through third-party entities or host organizations, including the private sector, state, or federal government.
Accommodation:
The university boasts of two residential structures, conveniently located just a short 5-minute walk from the vibrant campus. They can accommodate more than 500 residents and come fully furnished. The well-equipped apartment suites feature a kitchen, living area, private bedrooms with a bed and desk, and shared bathrooms. Students residing in these buildings have access to Wi-Fi, laundry facilities on each floor, as well as spacious common areas and study spaces. Each resident is assigned a helpful Resident Assistant, who offers various social and educational resources. To complete the application process, a non-refundable Housing Application Fee of $25.50 is applicable. 
 
The facilities in each suite include: 
• Bedrooms with a bed and desk 
• A fully-equipped kitchen 
• A large living area 
• Shared bathroom 
 
Each of the buildings offers the following amenities: 
• Wi-Fi access 
• Laundry facilities on each floor 
• Large common areas for hosting events, social gatherings, and study sessions.

The University of Northern British Columbia, a small public research university in British Columbia, Canada, was established in 1990. It offers a range of undergraduate, graduate, and doctorate programs in various fields.

Course Description:
University of Northern British Columbia is a well-renowned educational institution, globally recognized for its high-quality education and research. Founded in 1990 in Prince George, Canada, it has become a popular choice among students from around the world, with about 396 international students currently enrolled. What sets this university apart is its commitment to inclusivity and diversity.

At University of Northern British Columbia, students can choose from a variety of courses, including bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees in disciplines such as Business, Humanities, and Engineering. These programs have a duration of 3 years for undergraduate and 1 year for postgraduate studies. The university offers 6 intakes in January, September, and May, allowing students to start their studies at the most convenient time for them.

To support students financially, the university offers numerous scholarships and grants, including the prestigious Ontario Graduate Scholarship and Doris Dixon Scholarship. These opportunities help students cover their tuition fees, which average around 32100 CAD per year.

Moreover, the post-study work opportunities in Canada make University of Northern British Columbia a popular choice among international students. In conclusion, University of Northern British Columbia is a top-ranked university offering quality education, research opportunities, and post-study work opportunities for international students. With its diverse and inclusive environment, state-of-the-art facilities, and financial support, it has become a preferred choice for students seeking higher education.

Name: Mohawk College - Fennell
Overview: Mohawk College, founded in 1966 as a government-funded institution in Canada, is renowned for its Fennell Campus in Hamilton, Ontario. It is a proud member of the Association of Community Colleges of Canada and receives full funding from the Ministry of Training Colleges and Universities. The Mohawk College faculty comprises skilled professionals who offer 160 programs, specializing in various fields such as technology, healthcare, skill trades, and business. In addition to undergraduate degrees, the college also offers graduate programs like Autism and Behavioral Science, Business Analysis, Cyber Security Analytics, Global Business Management, Public Relations, Supply Chain Management, and Creative Arts Business. For students looking for continuous learning opportunities, Mohawk College also offers Continuing Education on Parental Support Worker and Cyber Security Analytics. Currently, the college has over 4,000 international students from 90 countries, making it a diverse and multicultural hub for higher education. Moreover, students can avail themselves of Mohawk College financial aid options, including scholarships, awards, and bursaries. One such notable financial aid program is the Ontario Student Assistance Program, which provides a mix of grants and loans to eligible students. There are also External Donor Awards available, such as The Stantec Equity and Diversity Scholarship, S.M.A.R.T. Scholarship, Pink Pearl Foundation, Pain Care Clinics Medical Scholarship, and more. Along with traditional on-campus courses, Mohawk College also offers online courses for both domestic and international students. These programs include Advanced Diplomas, Diplomas, Certificates, Graduate Certificates, and Nursing courses. Among them, some full-time programs offered are Diploma in Business, Diploma in Computer System Technician – Software Support, and Advanced Diploma in Civil Engineering Technology – Transportation. Mohawk College Fennell has continuously bagged the number one spot for its high graduate employability rate for five consecutive times in the Greater Toronto Area and Hamilton. Notable alumni of the college include Gary Nelson, Ted Rakoczy, Joal Roshko, and Luke Johns, who have achieved significant success in their respective careers.
Eligibility Overview: Mohawk College requires candidates to be at least 18 years of age in order to apply for admission. International students are required to submit official scores for either the IELTS or TOEFL exams. The Bachelor of Science in Nursing program requires applicants to have taken biology and chemistry courses, while the Bachelor of Technology program requires a mathematics course. A resume is also necessary for admission. Students must submit recent work to demonstrate their proficiency in English. To meet the admissions requirements, candidates must take an English proficiency test such as IELTS or TOEFL within the last two years.

Accommodation:
The Mohawk Residence is exclusively available to students of Fennell Campus and can accommodate up to 340 students. It consists of 170 fully furnished two-bedroom units with included amenities such as a TV and Wifi. Our dedicated staff are available 24/7 to cater to the needs of our students and the residence is equipped with 24-hour video surveillance for added security. 

Placement in the residence is on a first-come, first-served basis, making it imperative for students to apply through our MyHousingPortal at the earliest. A meal plan purchase is mandatory for Mohawk Residence students. In case of any medical requirements, students can reach out to our Accessible Learning Services office for specific accommodations. Housekeeping is typically provided every two weeks, however, due to the current COVID-19 situation, this service is temporarily unavailable. 

In addition to cozy and comfortable living spaces, our residence offers several common areas such as a kitchen, laundry room, games room, study lounge, and movie lounge for students to socialize and relax. We also have a Homestay Program for international students who wish to live with a Canadian family. Our aim is to provide our students with a safe and convenient living space that promotes learning and growth.

University Ranking: Centennial College is a highly-regarded and esteemed institution in Canada. Name: IBT College
Overview: Located in Toronto, Ontario, IBT is a private career college that is registered with the Ministry of Colleges and Universities under the Private Career Colleges Act, 2005 and affiliated with Career Colleges Ontario (CCO) and National Association of Career Colleges (NACC). IBT College is designated as a Learning Institution (DLI) and has affiliation with EduCanada, with support from over 270 international education partners globally. Established in 2001, the college has become a premier educational institution for students seeking short-term certificates and diplomas in areas such as Flight Attendant, Information Technology, Business, Travel & Tourism, and Health Care. In fact, IBT was the first college in Ontario to offer a fully Ministry-approved Flight Attendant Program. The Travel & Tourism Diploma Program is recognized by CITC (Canadian Institute of Travel Counselors). The college also offers various diploma programs, including Business Administration, Programmer Analyst, Network Engineering, Health Office Administrator, and Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer. In addition to these, IBT offers English language programs like Advanced Business English, General English, and Pathway programs, along with specific electives. The Community Health Worker Certificate is a specialized employer-sponsored training program. As a Career College, IBT is committed to supporting its graduates in their career development. The college's Career Services office offers personalized sessions to students for resume review, workshops, and job search guidance. Recently, IBT College has partnered with Places4Students Inc., giving students access to a wide range of housing options through an online platform.
Eligibility Overview: Please note that the minimum age requirement for applying to any programme at IBT College is 18 years old. A photocopy of your passport with the page showing your photo and date of birth is required as part of the application process. You must also demonstrate proficiency in English, although certain exemptions may apply based on your country of origin. Applicants who have successfully completed the IBT College Admission Test will be exempt from taking an English proficiency test. Upon review of all required documents, a pre-acceptance letter (PAL) will be issued within 2 business days. The PAL will include instructions on finalizing your registration and obtaining an acceptance packet. This packet will be sent within 2 working days after payment of the registration fee and following the directions provided in the PAL. The acceptance packet will contain all necessary documents for your study permit application to Immigration Canada, including a written acceptance letter, letter of cooperation (if applicable), payment receipt, and acceptance letter for the ESL Pathway (if applicable). Once your study permit has been approved, you will be required to meet with our Student Services Coordinator to sign your enrollment contract. During this meeting, you will need to provide your valid VISA for students and workers as well as proof of valid medical insurance. This information is crucial for the success of your studies at IBT College.

The information provided below pertains to the admission requirements for the courses offered at this university:

To be eligible to enroll in your desired programs, you must fulfill the academic and English language proficiency criteria specified below: All applicants must possess a high school diploma or be at least 19 years of age. For students who are applying using one of the following examinations - IELTS, TOEFL, or TOEIC - the minimum scores accepted are as follows:  To be accepted into Makeup + Co-Op programs, a minimum of IELTS 4.5, TOEFL 61, or TOEIC 555-600 is required. Name: Canadian Institute of Management and Technology College - Brampton
Overview: Canadian Institute of Management and Technology (CIMT) College, previously known as the Canadian Institute of Telecommunications (CIT), is a highly reputed private career college registered in Ontario since 1998. The college is a proud member of the National Association of Career Colleges and the Ontario Association of Career Colleges. With multiple campuses across renowned locations like Toronto, Mississauga, Brampton, Scarborough, and Hamilton, CIMT College offers an array of programs and courses for bachelor's, master's, diploma, and associate degrees. The fee structure at CIMT College is affordable, with an average tuition fee ranging from $12,000 to $12,200 per year. The cost of living per annum is also low, between $12,900 to $13,000, making CIMT College an attractive option for aspirants. Accommodation for students is available on campus, with facilities like housing, library, cafeteria, kitchen, laundry, television and 24x7 internet connectivity. The college is dedicated to honing students' professional skills and preparing them for successful careers. Accredited programs and courses, such as business, trade, law, computer networking, telecommunications, and healthcare, are designed to meet global standards and benchmarks. CIMT College takes pride in its experienced faculty and supportive staff, whose practical and theoretical training ensures students are equipped with the necessary skills and knowledge. With a track record of guiding and educating regional and international students, CIMT College continues to excel and provide opportunities for students to achieve their desired career goals.
Eligibility Overview:
REQUIREMENTS FOR ENTRANCE:To be eligible for admission to our diploma programs, applicants must possess either an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or its equivalent, or qualify as a mature student by meeting the age requirement of 18 years and passing a superintendent-approved test. Interested individuals may contact our Admin office at 905-671-9999 for further assistance. Basic computer knowledge is preferred, and a proficient command over the English language is a must.

DIPLOMA PROGRAMS FOR POST-GRADUATE STUDENTS:An undergraduate degree or diploma, or an equivalent, is mandatory for post-graduate diploma programs. A fundamental understanding of computers is desirable, and fluency in English is essential.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS FOR PSW DIPLOMA STUDENTS:Within 30 days of program commencement, candidates must submit a fully completed medical form. Before commencing the practicum segment of the program, a valid Standard First Aid and CPR Level C certification is necessary. Additionally, possession of a police check (Vulnerable Sector Search) report within the first 30 days of the program is also required.

PROFICIENCY IN THE ENGLISH LANGUAGE:CIMT College conducts all its courses in English, and thus, students must possess a strong command over the language. Those whose first language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency by submitting their IELTS Academic Module score with an overall band of 5.5 or higher, TOEFL scores with a minimum of 80 (online) or 550 (paper-based), MELAB scores with a minimum of 80 out of 100, PTE (Academic) scores with an aggregate of at least 50, or a certificate attesting three years of full-time education in an English-medium educational institution. Authentic documentation, such as a transcript or a letter from the said institution, must be furnished during the examination process.
Placement: Canadian Institute of Management and Technology's Career Services is dedicated to aiding students in securing employment opportunities. The placement cell actively organizes career/recruitment fairs, where participating companies offer suitable job positions. Regular workshops are also conducted to enhance essential skills essential for employability. Stay updated on the success of our career fairs and seminars by visiting the news section on our website.

Name: Assiniboine Community College
Overview:
Assiniboine Community College, commonly known as ACC, is a renowned public college located in Manitoba, Canada. It was established in 1961 under the name of Brandon Vocational Training Centre and has since become one of the most distinguished colleges accredited by the Manitoba Council for Post-Secondary Education. With five campuses, the college comprises of seven schools offering more than 50 certification, diploma, and advanced diploma courses. ACC also has a unique "2+2" program, enabling students to complete two years of their education at the college and the remaining two years at any of the partner universities of Assiniboine.

As an accredited institution since 1969, Assiniboine Community College has been recognized as a designated learning institution by the Refugee, Immigration, and Citizenship Canada. This prestigious college takes immense pride in its Students' Association Council, which stands as the voice of the students. It works tirelessly to address the specific needs of the students and represents them on college committees, promoting a welcoming and stress-free atmosphere.

One of the key aspects that sets Assiniboine Community College apart is its excellent placement options, which have resulted in a remarkable graduate employment rate of 91%. This encourages students to strive for excellence and honing their skills to perfection, making them highly sought after by employers. Whether it's pursuing a specific career or exploring various opportunities, ACC provides its students with the necessary resources and support to achieve their goals successfully.
Eligibility Overview:
As part of our university's admission requirements, applicants must provide evidence of meeting the following academic and English language standards:

1. Candidates must meet the minimum education requirement, which includes obtaining a high school diploma or a diploma from any recognized program.

2. To demonstrate proficiency in English, students must obtain a certain score on one of the following exams: TOEFL (79), CAEL (60), IELTS (6.5), PTE (58), or Can TEST (4.5).

These standards are mandatory for all applicants seeking admission to our university. We consider English proficiency to be of utmost importance for academic success, and as such, we expect students to meet these requirements in order to achieve their full potential.
Placement: The university offers valuable opportunities for its students to gain practical experience through co-operative work placements and practicums, which are an essential part of the curriculum. Through these programs, over 200 graduate students are able to secure internships and employment prospects in various industries. The annual Employer Day event also serves as a platform for students to secure jobs in different departments. Upon completion of their studies, more than 91% of students find employment in reputed organizations, with an average gross salary of $49,000.
Accommodation: Assiniboine University does not have on-campus housing options available specifically for international students. Therefore, these students must make their own arrangements for housing. Luckily, there are private landlords who offer suites and rooms for students, and they can be found in modern residences near the Victoria Avenue East campus. The estimated monthly expenses for living in this area range from $800 to $1000. This cost includes accommodation, food, and other necessities.

Name: Queens University - School of English
Overview: Queen's University - School of English, which was established in 1841, is among Canada's oldest universities. Located in Kingston, Ontario, the university offers students a unique campus experience, access to state-of-the-art facilities, and a variety of programs to choose from. These include the Canadian Academic English Experience Program, Academic English Foundations, Canadian English Experience Program, and English for Academic Purposes. With a weekly in-class time of 18-23 hours, the duration of these programs can range from 3 to 12 weeks. In addition to its various programs, Queen's University - School of English also offers a Queen's University Bridging Pathway (QBridge) program to help students transition smoothly to university level studies. Qualified students can apply for scholarships such as the Golden Source International Award (CAD 1,700) and the Marion Edith Dubin Memorial Scholarship in English (CAD 750), provided they are returning students or have paid their tuition in full for the EAP program, and are at least 18 years of age. The university's commitment to sustainability has been recognized globally, with a first place ranking in Canada and fifth place globally in the Times Higher Education (THE) Impact Rankings in April 2021, which assess the contribution of universities towards the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Queen's University - School of English also encourages students to get involved in the community through the QSoE Volunteer Club, which allows them to share their time, skills, and knowledge with the people of Kingston. The university also offers a QSoE Student Life Program, where students can organize and plan events and serve as representatives for the student body. Students have various housing options to choose from, including the Canada Homestay Network (CHN), university residences, and a list of university and non-university-owned houses and other resources.
Eligibility Overview:
For undergrad applicants, Queen's University has specific entrance requirements based on the country of origin. For students from India, a valid All India Senior School Certificate (CBSE) or Indian School Certificate (CISCE) is necessary. The academic average needed for admission may vary based on the program. Generally, a minimum of 75% is required according to the Indian grading system. Exceptional candidates with exceptional results from state boards may also be considered. Applicants in their final year of secondary school will be evaluated based on their interim Class XII grades or pre-board exam scores. For those who have completed their secondary education, final board exam scores from Class XII will be taken into account.

In addition to the above, international students are also required to demonstrate proficiency in English. Acceptable English proficiency exam results include a minimum overall score of 88 on TOEFL iBT, with at least 24 points in Writing, 22 points in Speaking and Reading, and 20 points in Listening. An overall score of 6.5 with no band lower than 6.0 on IELTS is also acceptable. Students may also submit a minimum score of 110 on Duolingo (DET), 60 on PTE, or an overall score of 175 on C1: Advanced/C2: Proficiency.

To be eligible for a master's degree program, applicants must have completed their undergraduate studies from an accredited institution with a second-class standing. Alternatively, individuals with a general bachelor's degree and at least one year of full-time study as a qualifying student with a minimum of a B grade average may also be considered equivalent.

For those interested in pursuing a doctoral degree, there are three possible minimum requirements for admission. This includes having a master's level qualification, being promoted to a PhD program after completing a master's degree, or being admitted directly based on exceptional academic performance in a bachelor's degree or equivalent.
Placement:
At Queen's University, placements for graduates are highly sought after. The customary compensation package offered to Queen's alumni is quite advantageous, with a potential earning of up to $52,500 USD after a span of five years. This figure surpasses the nation's average income.

 
To clarify, Queen's University provides excellent opportunities for its graduates. Upon completion of their studies, Queen's alumni have the potential to earn a competitive salary of $52,500 USD after five years, which is significantly higher than the national average.
Accommodation:
Information about housing for students attending Queen's University is available for both on-campus and off-campus accommodations. On-campus housing is offered on two separate campuses - Main Campus and West Campus, and a majority of first-year students, around 90%, choose to live in residence halls. These halls include a variety of options such as Harkness Hall, Leggett Hall, Waldron Tower, Watts Hall, Victoria Hall, Morris Hall, Adelaide Hall (for women), and Leonard Hall (for males). Each room in the residence halls is equipped with basic items like a bed, dresser, desk, bulletin board, bookshelf, chair, mirror, telephone, and data connection. This offers students a convenient and inclusive living experience, allowing them to interact and connect with students from diverse backgrounds.

For those who prefer to live off-campus, there is a wide range of options available. The average monthly rent for off-campus housing is around 1050 CAD and includes all necessary utilities such as electricity, water, and high-speed internet. Students can choose from studio apartments, three-bedroom, four-bedroom apartments, or shared apartments based on their preferences. Furthermore, there are laundry facilities available on-site for convenience.

To find off-campus housing, students can check out websites like Housing Anywhere, Rentboard, and Kijiji, which offer a variety of listings in Kingston. We encourage students to explore the options available and make the best choice that suits their needs and budget.

Name: Georgian College - Orangeville
Overview: Orangeville Campus of Georgian College, established in 1967, is renowned for its graduate-level education. The college has gained national recognition and is accredited by the Canadian Association for Co-operative Education (CAFCE). The campus is spread over 21,000 square kilometers, covering seven locations. Georgian College ranks third globally for its academic assistance, indicating its success.
Eligibility Overview: The following is information regarding admission requirements for degree programs at this institution. Meeting these requirements is crucial for being accepted into your desired courses. To be eligible, you must meet the following academic criteria: You must be at least 21 years old on the first day of classes, have a clean academic record, and exhibit potential for success through previous achievements. For degree programs, a high school diploma with 30 credits or equivalent is necessary, along with six 4U or 4M level courses. Some programs may also have additional prerequisite course requirements. To meet our language competency standards, you must fulfill at least one of these criteria: Have completed three full years of secondary school English in a country where English is the primary language (four years for BScN, Pharmacy Technician, and Addictions: Treatment and Prevention, if studying in Canada). OR completed a full year of postsecondary English study in a country where English is the primary language (not applicable to BScN, Pharmacy Technician, and Addictions: Treatment and Prevention). OR received an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or Canadian provincial equivalent from a public or Catholic school board, including an English credit (not applicable to BScN, Pharmacy Technician, and Addictions: Treatment and Prevention). OR provide evidence of completing one of our approved partner school route programs (not applicable to BScN or Pharmacy Technician). OR have completed at least three years of secondary schooling in an Ontario private school and earned an Ontario Secondary School Diploma and English credit (Grade 12 U, M, or C). Please note that "C" stands for College level, "M" stands for College/University level, and "U" stands for University level.
Placement:
Georgian University offers various programmes in Health, Wellness and Sciences, Human Services, and Community Safety. These programmes require students to complete practical courses and gain valuable experience in real-life settings. To ensure students meet their learning outcomes, our placement offices are responsible for organizing placement opportunities and managing the pre-placement requirements. 
Health, Wellness and Sciences students will work with our partner, Synergy Gateway, to undergo a thorough pre-placement process. Synergy Gateway will grant students access to "Verified," a secure software platform, through which they can schedule a permit check, upload necessary documents and track their clinical placement eligibility status. 
Here are the steps that students must follow: 
Step 1: Complete the required pre-placement paperwork 
The Clinical Preparedness Permit Information Package contains detailed information on each requirement, including any exceptions specific to your programme. 
Step 2: Schedule a permit check appointment with Synergy Gateway 
During this appointment, all medical and non-medical needs will be reviewed and verified. Students must upload all necessary documents to their Synergy Gateway profile before the appointment. It is their responsibility to regularly update this information and ensure its security. 
Forms and placement requirements must be completed and submitted by the student to the respective programme. All documents must be submitted before registration to guarantee placement and participation in field and clinical placements. Please note that the college is not liable for any issues that may arise and students will not be refunded if they are unable to gain placement due to incomplete or incorrect documentation.
Accommodation:
Georgian College offers both on-campus and off-campus housing options for students. Living on campus provides various opportunities to engage in the college community, while also ensuring convenient and safe living arrangements. The three on-campus residence options in Barrie, Orillia, and Owen Sound are designed to provide students with a comfortable college experience. With everything you need in close proximity, you can take advantage of residence life programs and cultivate long-lasting friendships with your roommates. You can also actively participate in various activities, such as being a resident advisor, serving on the residence student council, joining clubs, playing intramural sports, and organizing outings.

Alternatively, the university offers assistance to students looking for off-campus housing. This can be a daunting task and thus requires careful consideration of factors such as housing rules, rental scams, roommates, insurance, transportation, and health, safety, and security. There are different off-campus housing options, including room rentals, apartment rentals, house rentals, basement apartments, and homestay. Each option comes with its own set of benefits and requirements, providing students with variety and flexibility in choosing their ideal living space.

Room rental typically refers to a private room within a shared unit, though students must confirm if this includes access to other areas of the unit, such as the kitchen and bathroom. Bachelor apartments offer a combination of living room, bedroom, and kitchen, while separate bathrooms are a standard requirement. House rentals provide independent units with multiple bedrooms, ideal for living with roommates. Basement apartments, though partially underground, are fully equipped and offer similar facilities found in above-ground units. Lastly, students can consider the homestay option, living with a local Canadian family, to immerse themselves in the culture and practice their English while receiving three meals a day and internet access.

Whether living on or off-campus, Georgian College ensures exceptional support and resources for all its students. For any inquiries, visit the Residence and Housing Services, where you can find comprehensive information on both on and off-campus housing options.

Placement:
As an international student at Northern College, certain procedures and guidelines must be followed in order to obtain authorization to work in Canada. Here, we provide you with all the information you need to know for obtaining the necessary permits and authorizations for on-campus, off-campus, co-op/internship, and post-graduation employment.

First and foremost, a valid Study Permit is required for international students wishing to work in Canada. To obtain a Study Permit, applicants must have proof of acceptance to a designated learning institution in Canada, sufficient funds to support themselves, and be in good health. Once a Study Permit is secured, students must then obtain the appropriate permits for their desired employment.

For students enrolled in a program that requires a mandatory co-op or internship term, an Internship Work Permit must be obtained in addition to the Study Permit. This application should be submitted at the same time as the Study Permit, and at least three months before the internship begins to avoid any potential delays. This permit is free of charge and is only required if the employment is a part of the student's program, represents less than 50% of the program, and/or begins in the first term of classes.

On-campus work does not require a separate work permit, as long as the student has a valid Study Permit and is enrolled full-time. This excludes scheduled breaks and the last term before graduation. Off-campus work is limited to 20 hours per week during the academic year and full-time during specified breaks. However, if a Study Permit is granted, no separate work permit is necessary.

Upon completion of a Northern College diploma, international students may apply for a Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP) to obtain an Open Work Permit. Unlike the previously mentioned permits, there are no restrictions on the type of employment and no job offer requirement for this permit. The application for the PGWP must be submitted within 90 days of receiving final grades or proof of graduation, while the Study Permit is still valid.

Finally, spouses or partners of full-time Northern College students with a valid Study Permit may also apply for an Open Work Permit. Similar to the PGWP, no job offer is necessary and the permit duration will match the student's own permit.

In summary, international students must have a valid Study Permit and adhere to the specific requirements outlined for each type of employment. Whether it be on-campus, off-campus, co-op/internship, or post-graduation, following these guidelines will ensure a smooth and successful work experience in Canada.

Name: University of Montreal
Overview: The University of Montreal, established in 1878, is a renowned French-language public research institution located in Quebec, Canada. With a total of 8 campuses, including the main campus spread over 65 hectares of land, the university offers 600 programs through its 13 faculties, such as Law, Dentistry, Medicine, Nursing, Arts and Science, Music, Optometry, and more. Each campus has its specialized areas of study, with the HEC Montreal providing programs in business administration, management, and finance, and Polytechnique Montreal offering civil, chemical, electrical, computer, mechanical, and other engineering programs. The school of Public Health is recognized as the largest provider of public health education in Canada, while the School of Optometry is the only French-language school in the country to offer a doctoral degree in Optometry. Apart from the above, the university offers other specialized programs like Library and Information Management, Veterinary Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Pharmacy, and more. Additionally, the University Language Centre provides courses in over 15 languages. With an annual fee ranging between CAD 9,893 and 23,083, the university offers on-campus accommodation at a cost of CAD 380 per month or CAD 4,560 per year for a single room. Those who prefer to live off-campus can find affordable options around the university, with costs ranging between CAD 4,800 and 6,000 per year. Moreover, the university offers various scholarships to its international students and part-time job opportunities on campus for postgraduate students, such as lecturing, teaching assistantships, and research assistantships. With a focus on developing career skills, employability, and job search process, the university provides online resources, materials, workshops, career quizzes, and networking events for its students.

It is important to present proof of full-time enrollment at UdeM and sufficient financial means to cover the expenses. Additionally, it is necessary to obtain a visitor visa and study permit before arriving in Canada.
