Name: Parkland College
Overview:
Located in the province of Saskatchewan, in the town of Yorkton, Parkland College was established in 1973. Originally known as Parkland Regional College, it was later renamed to Parkland College in 2008. The college has been dedicated to providing quality education to students, with over 600 full-time students and 1,650 enrollments annually. Offering a range of programs including diplomas, bachelor's degrees, certificates, and adult education, Parkland College is a renowned institute with accreditation from the government. In addition to academic courses, the college also offers a variety of cultural, artistic, and recreational programs for students to engage in.

With its main campus located in Yorkton, Parkland College has additional campuses in Melville, Esterhazy, Fort Qu'Appelle, Canora, and Kamsack. The college also has a training center in Yorkton, catering to the needs of students in Eastern Saskatchewan. Providing flexibility in education, the college also offers evening, part-time, and online courses for students to choose from.

Parkland College is recognized for its excellence in business, agriculture, arts, early childhood education, dentistry, kinesiology, global trade, nursing, and law. It also offers specialized courses in pharmacy, power engineering, veterinary medicine, and Microsoft project training. In addition to providing quality education, the college also assists international students in acquiring the necessary skills for employment in Canada.

One of the highlights of Parkland College is its reputation for producing well-trained graduates who are highly sought after by renowned companies. The average annual salary for college graduates is $45,135, which is a testament to the quality of education provided by the college.

Parkland College also offers affordable housing options for students, with rental costs covering food expenses. On average, students can expect to spend around $40,000 on living expenses, tuition fees, and placement fees. With its dedication to academic excellence and supportive services for students, Parkland College is an excellent choice for those seeking a well-rounded and fulfilling education.

Name: University of Toronto
Overview:
UToronto, also known as the University of Toronto, is a well-known public research university located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Founded in 1827, this university has established its reputation as a leading institution for learning and research in Canada. With more than 700 undergraduate courses, 200 postgraduate courses, and a range of research-driven programs, UToronto offers a diverse range of programs in fields including business, engineering, humanities, arts, medicine, and education. UToronto's excellence in research and innovation has earned it a top spot in the QS World Rankings, currently sitting at number 26.

The university operates through three campuses – Downtown Toronto (St. George), Mississauga, and Scarborough. Its impressive research efforts in areas such as stem cells, electron microscopy, and the discovery of insulin have cemented its place among the world's best universities.

The University of Toronto is a powerhouse for sports as well, boasting one of the largest and most successful intercollegiate sports programs in North America. With 900 Varsity players across 44 teams and 26 sports, UToronto provides a thriving platform for athletic pursuits.

University Ranking:
Founded in 1827 as the King's College, the University of Toronto has been known by its current name since 1850. It is a renowned collegiate institution with eleven colleges and is the oldest university in the province of Ontario. Over the years, U of T has consistently ranked among the top universities globally, with its position on the list only getting better.

According to the US News & World Report, the University of Toronto has risen to the 17th spot in their 2021 rankings, a significant improvement from its previous rankings of 20 in 2017 and 18 in 2019 and 2020. In addition to considering other factors, such as number of cited publications, global research reputation, and regional research reputation, each of these holds a weightage of 12.5% in determining the university's ranking.

QS World University Ranking has placed the university at the 25th spot for 2021, which is a notable jump from its 2020 ranking at 29. In Times Higher Education's (THE) University Ranking, U of T holds the 18th position for both 2020 and 2021, an improvement from its previous rank of 21. While THE puts equal emphasis on teaching, research, and citations, with each category holding a weightage of 30%, QS places the highest importance on academic reputation at 40%, followed by faculty-student ratio and citations per faculty, both holding a weightage of 20%.

Unlike other university rankings, the Shanghai Ranking (ARWU) does not take into account a university's reputation among academics or employers. Hence, for 2020, the university holds the 23rd position. Instead, ARWU focuses on a university's research caliber and the number of Nobel Prizes won by its faculty.

Name: New York Tech - Vancouver (NYIT)
Overview:
New York Institute of Technology, also known as New York Tech, was founded in 1955. The institute has been accredited by MSCHE (Middle States Commission on Higher Education) and is a member of the NAICU (National Association of Independent Colleges and Universities). The School of Management at New York Tech is recognized by AACSB International (Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business).

The institute has a global presence with five campuses located in New York, Jonesboro, Long Island, Vancouver, and China. Vancouver, where the institute's campus is located, is considered one of the top three cities to live in globally. The campus provides students with easy access to essential amenities and renowned cultural, dining, and shopping destinations.

Among the various New York Institute of Technology Vancouver courses offered, the most sought after ones include M.B.A, Master of Science in Cybersecurity and Energy Management, M.S in Instructional Technology, and M.B.A in Finance. The institute has over 2,100 international students enrolled, providing a diverse and enriching learning environment.

To support the students' needs, the institute has a well-organized Graduate Student Association that addresses their concerns and fosters a sense of community. This association also encourages students to engage in volunteering activities and participate in educational and networking events. The institute also offers distance learning options for students to connect with their peers and professors at other global campuses in Abu Dhabi, China, and New York. It also hosts regular campus events to help students explore and experience the diverse culture of Vancouver.

Students have the option of living in off-campus housing provided by GEC (Global Education City) near the campus. The New York Institute of Technology Vancouver M.B.A fees, like in any other university, vary based on the number of credits required to complete the degree. For instance, students requiring 30 credits may expect to pay around $31,920, while those requiring 48 credits may have to pay $52,185. Other fees may vary depending on the course of study.

According to the Cyber Degree EDU 2021 ranking, New York Tech is placed at 33rd position and is considered one of the best universities to receive a degree in cybersecurity. The institute boasts an impressive placement record, with 94% of its graduates securing employment within a year of their graduation. Some students also choose to pursue higher education.

To aid students in their job search, the university provides access to CareerShift, an online career portal where students can browse and apply for
Eligibility Overview:
Revised data for university eligibility criteria: 

To be considered eligible for admission, applicants must meet the following requirements: 
- A bachelor's degree or equivalent in computer science, engineering, management, mathematics, information technology, liberal arts, or a related field from an approved institution or university. 
- The degree must be from an accredited program, recognized by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) for engineering degrees or by a regional accrediting agency (such as the Middle States Association of Colleges and Schools) for computer science or closely related degrees.
- Applicants with an international baccalaureate degree or diploma in a relevant field may be eligible for a bridge option in their desired graduate program, equivalent to three years of undergraduate study in the United States.
- A minimum undergraduate GPA of 2.85 is required for full matriculation. However, applicants may be considered at the discretion of the dean if they do not meet this requirement. Other factors such as GRE scores and relevant employment history will also be taken into account during the evaluation process.
- All applicants are required to submit GRE scores. Foreign university graduates must also take the GRE and include their scores with their application.
- Applicants with a GPA lower than 2.85 may be requested to take the GRE or other diagnostic tests, at the discretion of the dean.
- Official transcripts will only be required after the completion of nine graduate credits and all pre-curriculum prerequisites have been met.

Placement: This course aims to adequately prepare students for a 150-hour practicum at a company specializing in immigration and settlement policy, programmes, or services. During the Winter semester, students will have the opportunity to apply and test their classroom learnings in practical settings, such as immigrant-serving organizations, newcomer community groups, schools, and government agencies. In addition, students will attend presentations by industry professionals to gain insights into policy-making, service delivery, and advocacy. The practicum will typically take place in the Spring/Summer semester, with some flexibility to accommodate individual needs and goals. The main purpose of the practicum is to bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and real-world experiences, enabling students to develop the necessary skills for success in the field, such as a deep understanding of organizational culture, policies, practices, and interpersonal dynamics. Additionally, students will gain knowledge of current challenges facing immigrant-serving organizations, as well as key concepts such as diversity, power, privilege, and injustice. The practicum also offers students the chance to explore their personal identity, values, and self-directed learning opportunities. Finally, students will also develop essential skills like time management, prioritization, and building professional connections.

Name: FH International High School
Overview:
Located in Scarborough, Canada, FH International High School provides a curriculum for grades 9 to 12, offering a warm and inviting 25,000 square foot campus to aid in student development. Our goal is to empower students with active learning and independent thinking, encouraging their creative potential in addition to academic success. With a focus on science, technology, engineering, mathematics, and arts (STEM-A), we strive for excellence while also fostering individual growth through non-standardized pacing and experimental teaching methods.

At FH International, diversity and multiculturalism are embraced, as we welcome international students who enrich our learning environment. Our teachers are equipped to cater to varying English levels and cultural backgrounds, providing customized lesson plans and one-on-one IELTS courses when needed. With a student-faculty ratio of 5:1, we prioritize critical thinking over rote memorization in the classroom. Our location at the borders of Victoria Park Avenue in Scarborough makes it easily accessible for students.

In addition to our academic offerings, we also offer summer and winter camps and language programs to help international students improve their English language skills. FH International High School strives to create a well-rounded educational experience, providing a nurturing environment for students to reach their full potential.

Name: Simon Fraser University
Overview: Simon Fraser University, situated in British Columbia, Canada, is a research-focused institution founded in 1965. It offers a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs, diplomas, and certificates in over 150 fields of study. The university is organized into eight faculties, including the Faculty of Applied Sciences, Faculty of Communication, Arts, and Technology, Faculty of Health Sciences, Faculty of Sciences, Faculty of Arts & Social Sciences, Faculty of Education, Beedie School of Business, and Faculty of Environment. It boasts four research centers that specialize in Health Technology, Health Solution, Big Data, and New Materials and Technology for Sustainability. Among the top programs offered by Simon Fraser University are Bachelor's degrees in Business Administration, Software Systems, Mathematics, Chemistry, and Computer Engineering, and Master's degrees in Economics, Health Sciences, Psychology, Computing Science, and Business Administration. The cost of attending the university ranges from CAD 4,940 to 49,435 per year for courses, with an additional CAD 16,626 per year for food and housing. Simon Fraser University offers scholarships and financial aid to both Canadian and international students, including merit-based awards, government grants, and more. The institution also boasts a strong campus placement program, providing excellent employment opportunities to its students.
Eligibility Overview:
Academic Criteria

Undergraduate:

Higher Secondary School Certificate (HSSC)/ India School Certificate/All India Senior School Certificate are accepted with an average score of 50-60%.

Graduate:

For Graduate diploma/certificate courses, a Bachelor’s degree with a minimum overall grade of B completed in four years is required.

Masters:

A four-year Bachelor's degree with a specific minimum total grade is needed for admission. The required grade could be first class or a CGPA of 8 out of 10.

Doctoral:

For Doctoral programs, a Master's degree or equivalent in fields like Engineering, Forestry, or Medicine is accepted. The minimum required grade is first class or a CGPA of 8 out of 10.

English Language Requirements:

For all academic courses, candidates must demonstrate their proficiency in English. This can be fulfilled by providing a certificate of proficiency from a recognized authority or by obtaining a score of at least 6.5 in IELTS (International English Language Testing System) or 79 in TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language). Those whose first language is English or who have completed their studies in English are exempt from this requirement.

Name: St Clair College - Chatham Campus
Overview:
Established in the year 1966, St. Clair College of Applied Arts and Technology is located in Windsor, Ontario, serving the South-western Ontario Counties of Essex and Chatham-Kent. The college originated as a part of the Western Ontario Institute of Technology and merged with the colleges of applied arts and technology to form St. Clair College. The main campus and central administration are situated in Windsor, while the other two campuses are in Chatham and Wallaceburg. This college prides itself on providing high-quality education with a wide range of courses, including diplomas, degrees, and graduate courses. With over 100 courses in various fields like business, health, media arts, IT, social services, trades, technology, and more, St. Clair College has a lot to offer to its students.

With around 14,000 students, there is a diverse community of learners at this college who gain practical, employable skills and make connections for their future. The college emphasizes on research and has 13 faculty members dedicated to research projects. St. Clair College boasts of advanced facilities and various support services to aid students in their academic journey. The graduates of this college have a high employment rate of 87.5%, wherein they secure jobs within six months of their graduation.

As one of the top 50 research colleges in Canada, St. Clair College offers a wide range of bursaries and scholarships to its international students, with an average of 10,000 CAD per student. The college has a moderately selective application process, with an acceptance rate of 44%. Currently, the college serves over 8,500 full-time students and 20,000 part-time students on its three campuses. Not only that, but the college also offers apprenticeship and placement programs, along with professional and corporate training programs to equip its students with the necessary skills for their career growth. St. Clair College is dedicated to providing quality education and preparing students to compete in the job market, making it a top choice for higher education.

Name: Northern College - Timmins
Overview: Located in Ontario, Canada, the Northern College was established in 1967 and is renowned for its applied arts and technology programs. Its development was part of a provincial initiative to provide career-oriented diploma and certificate programs. The college is affiliated with esteemed organizations such as CCAA, ACCC, and AUCC. It has four campuses that offer educational services to students. To be admitted, a minimum IELTS score of 6.0 or TOEFL score of 79 is required, although certain programs may have specific requirements. Eligible international students can also take advantage of available scholarship programs. Eligibility Overview:
The minimum educational qualification needed for admission to an UNDERGRADUATE DIPLOMA at Northern College is a high school diploma with a minimum Grade Point Average of 50.0 percent. For admission to a PG programme, it is mandatory to have at least a two-year UG diploma or a bachelor's degree with a Grade Point Average of 50% or above.
For both Undergraduate and Graduate Programs, an overall IELTS score of 6 is required, with a minimum of 6.0 in Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing. Only UG programmes may consider a minimum of 5.5 in any one band. Applicants should score a minimum of 105 on the Duolingo English Test or have a PTE Overall score of 58 points for UG programmes and 60 points for PG programmes. A minimum score of 79 is required on the TOEFL iBT.

Name: Douglas College - Coquitlam

Douglas College, founded in 1970, holds a prestigious position as one of the leading colleges in British Columbia, Canada offering degrees. Smaller training centers are also present in Maple Ridge, Surrey and Burnaby. Douglas College awards $100,000 in scholarships to international students each year, with individual awards ranging from $500 to $2,500, giving them a head start in their academic pursuits.

The college prides itself on offering students confidential, accessible and top-notch assistance at every step. Join Douglas College today and broaden your academic horizon through its diverse and dynamic programs. Remember, it's not just about education, it's about a wholesome learning experience.

Name: Mount Saint Vincent University
Overview:
Mount Saint Vincent University, located in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada, is a public institution founded in 1873 and currently offering over 190 courses. The university provides a wide range of undergraduate programs in fields such as arts, education, science, and professional studies. Additionally, Mount Saint Vincent University has 13 graduate degrees available, including a joint doctorate program in partnership with St. Francis Xavier University and Acadia University. Some of the most sought-after programs at the university include B.S. in Computer Science, Ph.D. in Educational Studies, M.A. in Public Relations, and M.S. in Applied Human Nutrition. The university's prime location minutes away from downtown Halifax, coupled with its diverse student body of more than 4,000 individuals from over 70 countries, makes it an attractive choice for students seeking higher education. 

Mount Saint Vincent University has a strong focus on building a sense of community among its students through specialized programs, small class sizes, and opportunities for distance learning. The university is home to 16 research institutes and centers, offering students numerous opportunities for hands-on research experience through its Internship Program. Notably, Mount Saint Vincent University is the only university in Canada to offer a Master of Public Relations (MPR) program. 

The university acknowledges the importance of student well-being and prioritizes it above all else, along with the safety of its staff and faculty. The institution has a dedicated Student Union and a team of professionals available to assist students at all times. To encourage student participation and create a vibrant campus life, there are various social clubs, societies, and fraternities for students to join. In terms of accommodation, Mount Saint Vincent University offers three fully furnished residential complexes on campus - The Birches, Assisi Hall, and Westwood. Moreover, the university has an on-campus cafeteria, libraries, and fitness centers. Mount Saint Vincent University provides a holistic and enriching college experience for its students.

Please ensure that there is no plagiarism in the Rephrased output

To be eligible for admission to the Master of Public Relations program, students must provide proof of the following criteria:

- A four-year undergraduate degree in a field such as business administration, commerce, public relations, communication, or a related discipline. 
- A cumulative GPA of 3.0 (equivalent to a B grade) in the last two years of undergraduate studies.
- Two letters of recommendation, one from an academic source and one from a professional reference.

If an applicant has not attended a post-secondary institution for three or more years, a second professional reference can be provided in place of the academic letter of recommendation. Alternatively, if an applicant has not worked in a relevant field but has recently been enrolled in a post-secondary program, a second academic letter can be submitted in lieu of a professional reference.

Students must have completed the following courses to be considered for admission to the Master of Arts in Communication program:

- A four-year undergraduate degree in a communication-related discipline such as public relations, communication studies, journalism, or marketing communication.
- A minimum B average (equivalent to a GPA of 3.0) in the final two years of undergraduate studies.

Additionally, our college will ask you to submit a few other documents as part of the application process. These include:

1. A certified copy of your birth certificate - This is an official document that proves your identity and date of birth.

3. A copy of your high school diploma or equivalent - This document verifies your completion of secondary education and can also be in either English or French.

Data for a university indicates that international students with a valid study permit are allowed to both work and study in Canada if they have a Social Insurance Number (SIN). This can be obtained by visiting a Canada Access Center office and presenting a valid passport and study permit.

Opportunities for internships, summer employment, on-campus positions, and online and on-campus job postings are also available to students. The university's employment department also offers workshops on resume and cover letter writing, interview skills, job searching, networking, and individual job counselling.

Name: The University of British Columbia
Overview: The University of British Columbia is a renowned public research university situated in British Columbia, Canada, that was founded in 1908. The institution has two campuses - Vancouver and Okanagan. UBC offers a diverse range of over 200 undergraduate and postgraduate degree programs, as well as joint academic programs, distance learning options, and student exchange programs. It boasts of top-notch programs in Law, Applied Science, Medicine, Dentistry, Architecture, Anthropology, Philosophy, Ancient Culture, and Religious Studies, to name a few. Some sought-after courses at UBC include MBA, Master's in Computer Science, Data Science, Architecture, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, and Computer Engineering, as well as Bachelor's degrees in Nursing, Commerce, and Science. The annual tuition fees for different programs vary from CAD 8,238 to 57,625. In terms of accommodation and meals, students need to budget around CAD 13,510 per year. Finding affordable off-campus accommodation in Vancouver can be challenging as the city is known for its high cost of living. However, UBC offers scholarships and financial aid opportunities to both international and domestic students who have displayed exceptional academic and extracurricular achievements. Students can also avail grants and awards from the university.
Eligibility Overview:
This is information regarding admission eligibility for various programs at our university. It is important to note the specific requirements for each program, as well as the English proficiency criteria that must be met.

Undergraduate level:
Students must have completed 12th grade in a relevant field with a minimum overall score of 85 percent in English. This can be demonstrated through one of the following standardized tests:
- IELTS: An overall score of 6.5 is required, with a minimum of 6 bands in each component.
- PTE Academic: A minimum total score of 65 is necessary, with at least 60 in each section.
- TOEFL: A total score of 90 is required, with 22 in each section.

Graduate level:
Students must hold a bachelor's degree with a first-class or division, 65 percent aggregate, or a CGPA of 8 on a 10-point scale. Alternatively, a master's degree with the same criteria can also be accepted. Additionally, candidates must demonstrate proficiency in the English language with one of the following tests:
- IELTS: A minimum overall score of 6.5 is required, with at least 6 bands in each component.
- PTE Academic: A minimum total score of 65, with at least 60 in each part.
- TOEFL: A minimum total score of 90 is necessary, with specific section requirements of 22 for reading, listening, and writing, and 21 for speaking.

MBA program:
Applicants must have completed a bachelor's degree with a CGPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale, equivalent to a 75 percent aggregate. In addition, a standardized test must be taken to assess aptitude, such as:
- GMAT: A score of 550 is required, with at least 50th percentile in both quantitative and verbal sections.
- GRE: A score of 155 in both verbal and quantitative sections is mandatory. 
Furthermore, candidates must meet one of the following English proficiency criteria:
- TOEFL: A minimum score of 100 for the internet-based test, 600 for the paper-based test, or 250 for the computer-based test.
- IELTS: An overall band of 7.0 is necessary.
- PTE Academic: A total of 70 points is required, with at least 60 in each section.
- CAEL: An overall band score of 70 is mandatory.
- CAEL online: A minimum overall score of 70 is required.

Eligibility Overview:
For applicants to graduate programmes at the Silberman College of Business, the following criteria will be taken into consideration during the admission evaluation process:
- Completion of an undergraduate degree from an AACSB accredited institution with a minimum cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 3.0.
OR
- Completion of a graduate degree from an accredited institution with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0.
OR
- Completion of an undergraduate degree from an accredited institution with a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 and possession of a recognized professional license or certification such as Chartered Financial Analyst, Certified Management Accountant, Certified Financial Planner, Associate or Fellow of the Society of Actuaries, Associate or Fellow of the Casualty Actuarial Society, or Professional Engineer License.
OR
- Attainment of a minimum score of 1050, calculated by multiplying the undergraduate GPA by 200 and adding it to the GMAT (or GMAT equivalent) score.

Note: In order to be considered for admission, applicants must meet at least one of the above mentioned conditions.

Name: Ecole nationale daerotechnique, affiliated with Cegep Edouard-Montpetit

Ecole Nationale daerotechnique, affiliated with Cegep Edouard-Montpetit, is a premier technical college in the field of aeronautics, and is globally renowned. Located in Longueuil, Quebec, it is only a 20-minute drive from Montreal. This top educational institution offers three highly sought after programs: Aircraft Maintenance, Avionics, and Aerospace Engineering, all of which are taught in French and are duly recognized by Transport Canada. All three programs are completed in three years or six semesters. Ecole Nationale daerotechnique welcomes approximately 1300 students annually in its regular education program, which makes it one of the largest technical colleges in the world.

It boasts an impressive collection of 37 aircraft, including certified airplanes and helicopters, along with various other aircraft used for training purposes. Additionally, the college has a remarkable 38 specialized laboratories and workshops, equipped with test benches and wind tunnels. Ecole Nationale daerotechnique places great importance on a balanced approach towards education, and therefore, emphasizes on the integration of theoretical concepts with practical applications. This fosters a dynamic learning environment for the students. 

Apart from academics, the college also offers a vibrant student life with various events and activities being organized round the year. These events range from music to sports, providing ample opportunities for networking among students. The college also awards academic credits for participation in these events, further encouraging a stimulating atmosphere.

Name: Trent University - Peterborough
Overview:
Founded in 1964, Trent University is a publicly funded liberal arts university located in Peterborough, Ontario, with a secondary campus in Oshawa. The university is renowned for its unique college system inspired by Oxbridge and its small class sizes. Its diverse academic offerings include undergraduate and graduate degrees at the master's and doctoral levels. With a student body of approximately 9,000 undergraduates and close to 7,000 graduate students at the Peterborough campus, Trent University ranks among the top 6.1% of universities worldwide. Students from over 79 countries enroll in the university's diverse range of undergraduate, postgraduate, certificate, and diploma programs.

Trent University prides itself on its wide variety of academic programs, offering close to 60 undergraduate and nearly 20 graduate opportunities in fields such as biology, accounting, anthropology, archaeology, and African studies. The university also offers both course-based and thesis-based master's degrees, providing students with ample opportunities to pursue postgraduate studies on their own terms. Additionally, students can specialize in interdisciplinary fields such as feminist and gender studies and aging studies.

International students at Trent University receive excellent support, including financial aid, health insurance coverage, housing assistance, and academic guidance. The university hosts workshops to help students navigate their academic journey and provide necessary guidance and advice. A wide range of career opportunities is also available for Trent University graduates in fields like part-time employment, non-academic jobs, and full-time careers. For students who do not meet the university's admission requirements, pathway programs are available to help them achieve their academic goals.

The Peterborough campus is the primary location for most major courses, including biology, economics, modern languages, political studies, cultural studies, geography, philosophy, and more. Over 70% of courses at Trent University incorporate web-based components, providing students with a modern and comprehensive learning experience. With employment rates of up to 90% for graduates and 96% employed within two years of graduation, Trent University is highly regarded by organizations worldwide. According to the U.S. News & World Report, the university was ranked 35th among the Best Global Universities in Canada, solidifying its place as a top institution for higher education.
Eligibility Overview:
To be eligible for enrollment in your desired courses, you must fulfill the following academic criteria: A minimum of 70% average in the best four academic subjects, including English, in Standard XII, along with scores from the Standard X certificate. You will also be required to take an English proficiency test, unless you have completed the CBSE curriculum, which exempts you from this requirement. 
Commerce students from Indian Senior High Schools are exempted from having Mathematics as a mandatory subject for admission into the Bachelor of Business Administration program. For the Bachelor of Science in Nursing program, you must have completed English, Chemistry, Biology, and Mathematics as your four core subjects. Similarly, for the Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Science program, you must have completed English, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, and either Physics or Earth and Space Science. You must also have a minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher.

The university offers a range of residences, including Champlain College, Crawford House, Gzowski College, Lady Eaton College, Otonabee College, and Wallis Hall at Traill College. Each residence provides essential amenities, including a twin bed, desk, desk lamp, desk chair, two-drawer storage unit, closet, Wi-Fi, living room, kitchen, bathroom, laundry facilities, dishwasher, air conditioner, and dining area. The fees for on-campus accommodation vary based on the type of room and meal plan selected, and include both the residence fee and dining fee. The fees for a premium suite single room are $8,918 for the residence fee and an additional $3,000 for the dining fee, equaling a total of $11,918. For a premium suite double room, the residence fee is $7,712 and the dining fee is $3,000, resulting in a total of $10,712. For further information on on-campus residences at Trent University, please visit https://www.trentu.ca/housing/peterborough-residences.

Name: University of Waterloo
Overview:
Founded in 1957, the University of Waterloo is a renowned public research university located in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada. A leader in cooperative education, the university has three satellite campuses in Canada and four affiliated university colleges, including St. Jerome's University, St. Paul's University College, Renison University College, and Conrad Grebel University College. Its primary campus spans across 1000 acres and offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs in fields such as engineering, business, health, environment, math, science, and arts. With over 100 undergraduate and 190 postgraduate courses, the university caters to diverse academic interests. Top courses include Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Materials and Nanoscience, and Masters in Architecture, Taxation, Management, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Economics. The tuition fees for these courses range between CAD 11,525 to 54,334 per year. 

The university boasts an excellent infrastructure, including the Earth Sciences Museum and the largest Centre for Quantum Research. It also boasts a vibrant student life with over 200 student-run clubs, offering academic, social, political, charitable, sports, and cultural activities. Students can also participate in over 100 volunteer services offered by the university. Accommodation is available both on-campus and off-campus, with a variety of options to choose from based on preferences and budgets. On-campus housing options include single-sharing and double-sharing rooms, suites, apartments, and traditional dorm-style rooms. International students can also opt for homestays, which provide a home-like atmosphere while studying in Canada. The annual cost of accommodation and meals is approximately CAD 14,828. 

The university offers various financial aid options to students who require assistance based on merit. International students can also avail of scholarships and bursaries to support their education at the university. With a strong focus on academic excellence and thriving student life, the University of Waterloo provides a fantastic learning experience for students from all over the world.

Students can take advantage of various facilities and resources, including a Student Lounge, Library, Study Center, Wi-Fi, and Interactive whiteboards. Upon completion of their training, students can participate in on-campus training facilities followed by an internship to gain practical experience. Students choose Collège St-Michel for its flexibility in scheduling, job placement assistance, personalized services, use of advanced technology, guaranteed internships, additional support for international students, and an enriching learning environment.

Name: University of Guelph
Overview:
The Guelph Institution is an esteemed public research university, situated in Guelph, Ontario. It prides itself on offering 48 graduate and 94 undergraduate programs, as well as six associate degrees, covering a diverse range of disciplines across its seven distinguished colleges. Agricultural Sciences, Physics, Biotechnology & Applied Microbiology, Engineering, Ecology, Social Sciences & Public Health, and Plant & Animal Science are among the most sought-after courses at this university. Additionally, the university also provides English language courses at its Guelph, Ridgetown, and Kemptville Campuses, while French courses are offered at the Alfred Campus near Ottawa. Notably, the university also has a Satellite Campus in Toronto, known as the University of Guelph-Humber, which offers students the opportunity to earn honours degrees and college diplomas. 

For international students, the estimated average tuition & fees for full-time undergraduate programs at the university ranges between 24,300 CAD - 33,551 CAD, while the average cost for graduate programs is 6,837 CAD (excluding additional expenses). Being cognizant of the financial implications of studying abroad, the university provides various scholarships and financial aid options such as International Scholarships, International In-course Scholarships, and International Registrar Entrance Bursaries. 

At the University of Guelph, professional growth and development are of utmost importance, and the Placement Cell is dedicated to providing students with practical exposure and financial independence. The university offers a wide range of career opportunities, including on-campus part-time work, seasonal employment during summer and winter breaks, internships, volunteering opportunities, and post-graduation jobs. This strategic focus on career development ensures that students are well-equipped to embark on their professional journeys upon completing their degree.
Eligibility Overview:
The following information pertains to the academic requirements for undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs at the University of Guelph. These guidelines are subject to variations depending on the specific program or major being pursued.
 
Undergraduate
To be considered for admission, you must have a GPA of 3.0 - 3.9 out of 4.0 from a high school accredited by the designated regional accreditation body. Please note that for the Fall 2022 intake, the University has made the SAT/ACT optional in light of the ongoing pandemic.

Postgraduate - Masters
Typically, completion of an undergraduate degree, with a focus on honours, or its equivalent from an accredited institution is required for entry into a master's program. It is mandatory to maintain a minimum average of B (based on the last two years of full-time equivalent study) to be considered for admission.

Doctoral
In order to be eligible for a doctoral program, you must hold a graduate degree or its equivalent from an accredited institution. A minimum B average is mandatory for a master's program (with the possibility of the department requiring a higher standing). Additionally, you must demonstrate a strong potential for research.

Name: MacEwan University
Overview:
Established in 1971, MacEwan University, previously known as Grant MacEwan Community College, was an accredited higher educational institution. In 1988, it obtained the authorization to expand its academic offerings to university programs. Eventually, in 2009, it became Alberta's sixth university and was renamed MacEwan University for all public communication and marketing purposes. The campus embraces a range of modern facilities and fosters a diverse range of programs, such as a clinical simulation center, professional nursing education, and a social innovation institute. In Canada, MacEwan University has a stance as the fourth most sustainable university.

Every year, the university welcomes over 900 students from more than 70 countries globally. Enrollments in different credit programs at MacEwan University are over 12,300 students annually. The institution prides on small class sizes, interactive learning sessions with the professors, and well-equipped technological and library resources. The university takes an innovative approach to research, where its faculties, students, and the community work jointly to foster creativity. MacEwan University stands out as a distinguished institution for offering the largest transfer-in higher education programs in Alberta. The undergrad academic offerings consist of 8 baccalaureates, 43 diploma and certificate programs, and 2 applied degrees. MacEwan University sustains 2 schools and 4 faculties that specialize in a variety of academic fields, namely fine arts and communication, liberal arts and sciences, business, engineering, physical education, nursing, health, and community studies. The university boasts a student population of more than 19,000, comprising both full-time and part-time students.

MacEwan University takes its dedication to education further by providing numerous scholarships, grants, and awards to assist its students. Culture and diversity are celebrated and embraced by the university, as evidenced by its participation in numerous international partnerships with universities and colleges worldwide. MacEwan University provides students with a transformative academic experience, catering to their personal and professional growth. The university is equipped to provide the best educational services possible thanks to its association with other renowned educational institutions globally

Overall, MacEwan University has clear and specific admission requirements for international students, ensuring a fair and comprehensive evaluation process.

Name: St George Brown College
Overview:
Established in 1967, George Brown College (GBC) in Toronto, Canada is a well-renowned public applied arts and technology institute. It offers over 170 programs through seven academic centers, including the Center for Health Sciences, Business Center, Preparatory and Liberal Studies Center, among others. Catering to a diverse student population of around 30,000, GBC has three campuses located in downtown Toronto – the Casa Loma Campus, Waterfront Campus, and St. James Campus.

GBC offers a wide range of programs, such as Art and Design Foundation, Gemmology, Media Foundation, Fashion TECH, and Dance Performance. It also provides apprenticeship programs for those employed in the trades, such as Child Development Practitioner, Plumber Apprentice, and Steamfitter Apprentice. For those seeking flexible learning options, GBC offers online, day, weekend, and evening continuing education courses, including African Cooking, Cardiac Rehabilitation, and Addictions and Mental Health Program. The Second Career Program, designed for laid-off and underemployed individuals, offers further training opportunities to acquire suitable employment.

The estimated tuition fee at GBC is CAD 3,537 to CAD 19,646 for Canadian students and CAD 14,330 to CAD 26,350 for international students. Name: College of the North Atlantic - St. Anthony
Overview:
College of the North Atlantic, a public post-secondary institution located in Atlantic Canada, is widely recognized for its high standards of education and skills training. With 17 campuses spread across Newfoundland and Labrador, it is one of the largest institutions in the region. Its St. Anthony campus, situated on the Great Northern Peninsula, offers five programs including Business Administration, Personal Care Attendant, and Powerline Technician, in a rural setting.

The college has an impressive enrollment of 25,000 students and offers a diverse range of 128 programs, spanning areas such as Law, Computer Science, Business and Management, Architecture and Construction, and Social Studies. It boasts an impressive 94% placement rate, with 90% of its graduates securing jobs within six months. With an acceptance rate of 65%, the college prides itself on providing personalized attention to its students with a student-to-faculty ratio of 4:1.

At College of the North Atlantic, students are provided with a safe and welcoming environment, coupled with modern facilities including a renowned library and a full-service cafeteria. The college also offers the flexibility of transferring certificates and diplomas, making it an attractive choice for students. Despite not offering scholarships or financial aid, the institution attracts over 3500 international students owing to its affordable tuition fees and top-quality education. According to Webometrics, the college ranks at an impressive 85th position among all universities in Canada.

Placement: Several courses require students to complete an unpaid internship in order to attain their program certificate or graduate from the College of the North Atlantic. The objective of the work placement is to provide students with a unique learning opportunity within a natural workplace setting. This experience equips students with technical skills and enhances their employability, contributing to their personal growth. It also enables them to establish new connections and expand their perspectives on potential career paths. The work placement typically spans two weeks for certificate programs and six weeks for diploma programs, with a minimum work requirement of 30 hours per week and a maximum of 40 hours as specified by the employer. The availability of an appropriate employer during intersession determines the timing for the placement. For students who complete their degree out of the standard order, the work placement will occur in the semester immediately following their final semester of studies. Only those students who receive certificates will be required to complete a two-week work internship. For students in a two-year diploma program, the work placement will be completed at the end of the second year, regardless of their year of study.

To make the process of finding suitable living arrangements easier for students, the institution has compiled a list of off-campus accommodations in close proximity to each campus. Name: Coast Mountain College - Terrace
Overview:
Coast Mountain College was founded in 1975 in Terrace, British Columbia, and is an accredited post-secondary institution. Its previous name was Northwest Community College (NWCC), and it currently has five campuses serving 34 communities. The campus longhouse, situated at the southern end of the Terrace campus, is a hub for cultural and student-focused activities, as well as hosting various events throughout the year. The Freda Diesing studio, where the First Nations Fine Arts program takes place, is the only program of its kind in Canada, focusing on the traditional northern style of West Coast First Nations art.

Offering a range of Red Seal Trades training, post-degree diplomas, associate degrees, and certificates, Coast Mountain College provides diverse education opportunities. Students can pursue programs in environmental management, nursing, indigenous culture, social work, welding, business, and more. The college operates on a first-come, first-served admission basis, with priority given to students who apply early according to seat availability.

As per Webometrics, Coast Mountain College ranks 162nd out of all colleges in Canada and 2580th among North American colleges. Globally, it secures the 10274th position. The average tuition fee at the college is approximately CAD 12,500, with an additional cost of CAD 6,000 for residence and meals, and approximately CAD 2,000 for textbooks and supplies. This amounts to a total yearly expense of around CAD 25,900. The college offers fall, winter, and summer intake sessions and also has various partnerships for international degree opportunities, allowing students to study abroad after completing one or two years at the institution.

Name: Herzing College - Downtown Montreal
Overview: Herzing College is a privately-owned higher education institution with campuses located in Toronto, Ottawa, Cambridge, and Winnipeg, with two additional campuses in Montreal. The Central campus, known as Herzing College - Downtown Montreal, is situated in the bustling heart of the city. Founded in 1968, this esteemed institution is part of a network of eight campuses. With accreditation and partnerships at regional, local and national levels, Herzing College prides itself on providing students with career-focused education and training that prepares them for the job market. It offers over 10 diploma programs in business, design, technology, and education, with admissions open for the fall, winter, and spring semesters. With a notable alumni employment rate of 89%, Herzing College is recognized as a secondary vocational studies institute (permit no. 534501) and a post-secondary institution by the Ministry of Education and Higher Learning (permit no. 749758). Students have the opportunity to apply for various scholarships, including the Academic Scholarship (worth $1000), William R Rootham Scholarships (up to $20,000), and the Alumni Referral Scholarship. Eligible alumni can enroll in courses at no cost, apart from textbook and lab fees, and also receive a 20% discount on certificates and programs offered by Kompass Professional Development. The college also offers career development classes, following the P.R.I.C.E model (Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Caring, and Engagement) to ensure students have a well-rounded experience.
Eligibility Overview:
Below are the requirements that an applicant must meet in order to be considered for admission to the university. It is imperative that the following eligibility criteria be fulfilled:

- The student must have completed high school and must be at least 18 years old at the beginning of the program.
- The entrance assessment evaluation conducted by Herzing College must be successfully cleared.
- For non-native English speakers, the following minimum scores on an English Proficiency Test are required: TOEFL IBT - 78 or higher, and IELTS - 6.0 with no sub score less than 5.5.
- For students enrolling in a program taught in French, the language proficiency level must be as follows: B1 level for DEP programs and B2 level for AEC programs.
- In some cases, a general admissions exam and program-specific entrance tests may also be required.
Placement: Herzing College guarantees its students high-quality placements with a success rate of 89 percent (as of 2020). The college's Career Development Department collaborates closely with industry partners to ensure students are equipped with the necessary skills and knowledge demanded by the market. In addition to its career-focused curriculum, special Career Development courses are also provided to prepare students for the real world. The college follows the P.R.I.C.E approach (Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Caring, and Engagement) to create a well-rounded learning experience. The Career Development Department assists students in securing internships that align with their field of study and aids in crafting impressive resumes. Students' resumes are shared with companies seeking full-time or part-time employees. The college not only offers continuous employment support during the program but also after graduation.

Overview: Located in Montreal, the ITHQ is a leading public institution offering a wide range of professional and academic programs. Name: ILAC International College - Vancouver
Overview:
ILAC International College, founded by English education pioneers Jonathan Kolber and Ilan Cohen, is a prestigious private college with two branches - one in Toronto and the other in Vancouver. Known for its excellent infrastructure, top-notch education system and prime location, ILAC International College Vancouver is a boutique campus that fosters partnerships between corporations and talented students. The college also offers various short-term career courses such as tourism, human resource, project management, and business management, making it a highly sought-after destination for students from across the globe. Located in the vibrant and thriving city of Vancouver, the college provides its students with access to a dynamic economy, lucrative job opportunities, a modern lifestyle, and globally renowned companies. 
With an annual tuition fee ranging from CAD 7000 to CAD 10500, along with a cost of living of CAD 12,000 and an application fee of CAD 200 per year, ILAC International College Vancouver offers a moderate acceptance rate. Prospective candidates must pass the admission test in order to secure a spot in any of the courses offered. The college boasts of a strong global network, providing its students with excellent placement and training opportunities. Some prominent companies that recruit graduates from ILAC International College Vancouver include CN Tower, Marriott Hotels, Toronto Pearson Airport, Hays Recruitment, Starbucks Coffee Co., Tommy Hilfiger and more. 
The campus is well-equipped with state-of-the-art facilities for both on-campus and off-campus students, with modern classrooms, laboratories, and research centers that enhance the learning experience. As a result, ILAC International College Vancouver is at the top of the wishlist for many aspiring students.

Aspiring students should make arrangements for their accommodations well in advance of their arrival, as the available lodging options become quickly filled, especially prior to the semester's commencement.

Accommodation:
Below are the options for accommodation while studying in Canada:

On-Campus Accommodation: This type of housing is provided by the university itself. It includes residence halls, dormitories, and apartments that are located within or near the campus. These accommodations are typically communal, with shared living spaces and facilities, such as a kitchen and bathroom. This option is recommended for international students as it allows for easy access to classes and campus resources.

Off-Campus Accommodation: This option involves living in shared apartments, where students have their own private room but share common areas like the kitchen, bathroom, and living room with one or more people. These accommodations are similar to townhomes and usually offer a single-occupancy bedroom or living space. Off-campus accommodations may also include homestays, where students live with a host family and are provided with one to three meals a day and internet access. This provides a sense of security and home for international students, who can also learn about Canadian culture and customs from their host family.

Tips for Off-Campus Accommodation:

1. Check if your school or agent can assist you in reserving accommodation in Canada.
2. Never transfer money without personally visiting or meeting the owner to avoid being scammed, especially on platforms like Craigslist.
3. Some schools may offer placement agencies, while others may direct students to search for housing on their own or provide internal accommodation services. Familiarize yourself with the school's policy and take the necessary steps.
4. Keep in mind that you are not obligated to choose the housing suggested by the school. You can opt for other options that make you feel safe, secure, and conducive to studying while in Canada.

Name: Grant MacEwan University
Overview: Grant MacEwan University, previously known as Grant MacEwan Community College, was founded in 1971. It is a public institution located in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. The university has two urban campuses, namely Alberta College Campus and City Center Campus. The latter is the larger one, spanning over seven city blocks in downtown Edmonton and located a kilometer away from the Alberta campus. MacEwan has a diverse range of academic offerings, including four faculties and two schools that offer eight four-year undergraduate programs, two applied degrees, and 43 diploma and certificate courses. Popular courses offered at MacEwan include Accounts and Commerce, Bachelor of Design, and Business. The university provides both on-campus and off-campus accommodation options for its students. The on-campus housing facility is a 13-story building with fully furnished suites available at a monthly cost range of 988–1,300 CAD. The students also have access to various facilities, including game rooms, study lounges, luxury lounges, theatres, WiFi, shopping centers, and restaurants. Admissions at MacEwan are fairly competitive, with an acceptance rate of 59%. Interested students can apply by filling out application forms on the official website, along with an application fee of 110 CAD. The university requires applicants to submit their academic transcripts, as well as scores of standardized tests such as TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, etc., and other program-specific documents. MacEwan has a strong graduate employability rate, with 95% of the graduates securing employment within six months of graduation. The average annual salary for these graduates is $64756 CAD. The average undergraduate tuition fee at MacEwan is 20,137 CAD, with an estimated overall cost of living of up to 11,549 CAD. The university also offers various merit-based scholarships, such as the CFCW, valued at 1000 CAD, and the Aaron Michael Memorial Bursary, valued at 600 CAD. Interested students can apply for these scholarships on the official university portal.
Eligibility Overview: MacEwan University has varying admission requirements, which greatly depend on the degree being pursued. For international students, the application process involves submission of their Grade 12 results and subject credits. The specific entry requirements for Grade 12 are based on the approved curriculum and nomenclature of Alberta Education. High school curriculum is divided into four divisions, with the exception of English Language Arts, namely: Group A (Humanities), Group B (Fine Arts), Group C (Sciences), and Group D (Optional/Electives). The credit requirements may vary based on the chosen subjects of the students. Your International Student Placement Experience

It is imperative for international students to obtain a co-op work permit before embarking on their field placement/clinical practice/practicum. This work permit is separate from your study permit and allows you to engage in employment that is related to your area of study. As you will be working in vulnerable settings within the health, community, or medical fields, it is necessary for you to complete a medical assessment with an IRCC approved panel physician before applying for the co-op work permit. To obtain the necessary paperwork, please connect with MacEwan International. Due to current processing times, it is recommended that you apply for your co-op work permit 4-6 months before the start of your field placement/clinical practice/practicum. For more information, please visit our website at https://www.macewan.ca/academics/programs/bachelor-of-child-and-youth-care/academics/field-placement/.

Name: Alexander College - Burnaby
Overview:
Alexander College is a highly esteemed educational institution, renowned for offering a wide range of undergraduate and diploma courses in Burnaby, Columbia. With two urban campuses located in Vancouver and Burnaby, the college caters to over 2,000 students every year. Founded in 2006, the college is named after the famous Scottish author, Sir Alexander Mackenzie. Recognized and accredited by prominent organizations, the college is a proud member of the BC transfer system.

At Alexander College Burnaby, students are provided with state-of-the-art infrastructure and academic facilities, including well-equipped laboratories, libraries, learning centers, and bookstores. The curriculum includes a diverse range of subjects, covering disciplines of arts, science, and commerce. Along with undergraduate programs, the college also offers graduate courses and diploma programs. The faculty and board members comprise experienced professionals from various industries.

Catering to the educational needs of both domestic and international students, Alexander College Burnaby follows a comprehensive selection process, curriculum, and evaluation methods that are aligned with industry requirements. The fees for courses offered by the college are economical, making it a preferred choice among other universities in South America.

The teaching methodology adopted by the college is a combination of theoretical and practical aspects, providing students with a holistic learning experience that connects academia with the corporate world. To further enhance students' learning journey, the college offers various services such as on-campus work opportunities, academic advising, free tutorials, workshops, peer mentorship programs, interactive events, and activities. Located in an attractive city, the college attracts a diverse pool of students from all over the world.

In conclusion, Alexander College Burnaby is a well-established institution that offers students a conducive environment to pursue their higher education. With a focus on industry-relevant training, the college equips its students with the necessary skills and knowledge to excel in their respective fields. Its affordable fees, diverse programs, and comprehensive support services make it a top choice for students looking to kick-start their careers.

University Requirements:

Academic Qualifications: For undergraduate programs, students must possess a Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) Grade 12 certificate or a CISCE high school diploma (Council for Indian School Certificate Examinations). Certificates from intermediate or pre-university levels are also accepted. The university does not specify a cutoff, however, it is recommended to have a score of over 80% in secondary education from CBSE or ICSE. For graduate programs, students should hold a bachelor's degree or diploma from a tier-1 or tier-2 university. Each course may have different GPA requirements or prerequisites, but an average of at least 65% in each subject is typically required.

Accommodation:
Alexander College offers various degree programs and courses to students who wish to pursue higher education. It is a renowned educational institution that provides quality education to its students. The college has two main campuses, one in Burnaby and the other in Vancouver, both of which are known for their lively and diverse student community. Alexander College also has several off-campus locations, making it accessible to students from different parts of the city. 

Both local and international students can enroll at Alexander College, but international students will need to obtain a valid study permit and visa before studying at the college. These requirements must be fulfilled before students can begin their studies. 

On-campus accommodation is not provided by the college, as the campuses are located in urban areas. However, the college is conveniently located near major transit hubs, making it easy for students to commute. Hence, students have to arrange for off-campus accommodations on their own. There are primarily three accommodation options available for students, including homestay, room rental, and apartment rental. 

Homestay is the most popular choice among students who are looking for a truly immersive Canadian experience. It provides students with a secure and comfortable living arrangement, where they can also learn about Canadian culture. Host families provide a supportive and welcoming environment, making students feel like a part of their family. Students under the age of 19 must live with a host family and have a local legal guardian in British Columbia. For students over the age of 19, living with a host family is optional. However, homestay organizations also offer guardianship services for international students if needed. 

Apartment rental is another option for students, but it can be quite expensive. The rent for a studio or one-bedroom apartment in popular Vancouver neighborhoods such as Downtown, Yaletown, Cambie Village, and West Vancouver can go up to $2,000 per month. However, the rent may be more affordable in areas like East Vancouver, Commercial Drive, Fraserview, and Marpole, with prices starting from $1,000 per month. Burnaby also offers relatively cheaper rental options, with prices starting at $800 per month for a studio or one-bedroom apartment. The farther students are willing to move from Vancouver, the more affordable the apartments will be. 

Lastly, shared accommodation is a popular choice among international students as it allows them to save money while making friends. Students can find potential roommates or shared accommodation options through advertisements posted on the college

Name: Pacific Coast Community College (PCCC)
Overview:
Pacific Coast Community College (PCCC) was founded in 2004 to meet the growing demand for highly skilled Health Care Assistants (HCA). It is officially registered and approved as a Designated Learning Institution (DLI) by the Ministry of Advanced Education, Skills and Training's Private Training Institutions Branch (PTIB). Students can select from various PCCC programs, such as the Health Care Assistant, designed to train individuals to become competent frontline care providers and valuable members of a healthcare team. Another program is the Acute Care Aide, a full-time diploma program that prepares students to work in this specialized field. Additionally, PCCC offers the Acute Care Skills Program for HCAs, which expands upon core skills, knowledge, and attitudes acquired in the HCA/RCA program. Before enrolling in any of these programs, students must meet certain requirements, including a high school diploma or mature student status (at least 19 years old) and demonstrating the necessary English language proficiency level.

For students admitted to the Acute Care Skills Program for Health Care Assistants, the tuition fees range from $2,200 to $2,300, which includes a non-refundable registration fee of approximately $130 to $170. In comparison, students interested in the Health Care Assistant Program can expect to pay between $7,700 and $7,800, which includes additional fees. For those pursuing the Acute Care Aide Program, the tuition fees are higher, ranging from $16,600 to $16,700, plus additional fees. After successfully completing their program and becoming certified HCAs, entry-level HCA salaries can range from $25,000 to $35,000 per year, depending on the specific role. With increasing experience, HCAs can expect to earn higher salaries of at least $37,000 or more.
Eligibility Overview:
This information pertains to a variety of programs available through Pacific Coast Community College. In order to be eligible for admission, applicants must meet certain requirements including having a high school diploma or being a mature student over the age of 19. Additionally, applicants must demonstrate proficiency in the English language (further details outlined below) and meet specialized criteria, such as providing a recent criminal record check and TB screening, before participating in practical components of the program.

ENGLISH PROFICIENCY STANDARDS

1. Candidates who have received at least seven years of education in an English-speaking environment or who have completed three consecutive years of studies in an English-speaking educational institution, must provide proof of either: Successful completion of Grade 10 English, or a Language Proficiency Index (LPI) score of 20 or higher with an essay rating of at least 4, with a score of 24 out of 40.

2. Candidates who have not received at least seven years of education in an English-speaking environment, or who have not completed three consecutive years of studies in an English-speaking educational institution, must provide evidence of one of the following: a Canadian Language Benchmark Placement Test (CLB PT), taken within the last six months, with scores of Listening 7, Speaking 7, Reading 6, and Writing 6; a Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) taken within the last two years, with a minimum overall score of 76, and no section scores below 20 for both Speaking and Listening, and no score lower than 18 for Reading and Writing; an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) Academic or General test, taken within the last two years, with an overall score of 6 or higher, and a minimum score of 6 for both Speaking and Listening, and a minimum score of 5.5 for Reading and Writing; a Canadian English Language Proficiency Index Program (CELPIP - General) test, taken within the last two years, with scores of Listening 7, Speaking 7, Reading 6, and Writing 6; or a Canadian Academic English Language Assessment (CAEL) with an overall score of 60, and no section scores lower than 50.

The Portage campus, located in the Central Plains region of Manitoba, offers over 200 certificates, workshops, part-time courses, and full-time diploma programs, providing excellent opportunities for both personal and professional development for ambitious students at all stages of their careers. Overview:
St. Stephen's University is a small liberal arts university located in St. Stephen, New Brunswick, Canada. It was founded in 1975 and is authorized by the province of New Brunswick to offer bachelor's and master's degrees in ministry studies and liberal arts. The university also provides undergraduate BA degrees in a variety of areas such as social sciences, humanities, philosophy, religious studies, psychology, and literature. In the category of Arts, St. Stephen's University is ranked 201st by Time's Higher Education rating, making it one of the top 100 colleges. It also ranks 151 globally out of 49 other universities according to the Academy Ranking of World Universities.

St. Stephen's University offers undergraduate certificates and online graduate programs through its Institute for Peace, Justice, and Religion. The university's post-graduate ministry program is designed to provide training for lay ministry and professionals. Currently, St. Stephen's University offers undergraduate programs in Psychology, Arts in Humanities, and Community Engagement. At the post-graduate level, students can choose from two courses: Culture and Theology. Additionally, the university has recently launched a "School of Contemplation" for students interested in learning about modern and ancient practices. Over 400 students have graduated from the university, with one-third of them pursuing further studies.

Apart from academics, St. Stephen's University also provides a range of academic and non-academic facilities, including a library, study abroad programs, exchange programs, and administrative services. The university also offers various scholarships, with amounts ranging from 500 to 7,500 CAD. With an acceptance rate of 70%-80%, St. Stephen's University is a selective institution. Enrolled students can also take advantage of on-campus residence and alumni benefits. This university is dedicated to providing students with a comprehensive education and opportunities for personal growth and development.

However, the university also recognizes that there are other factors that may contribute to a student's academic success and therefore provides students with the opportunity to demonstrate their potential through the following means: 

1. Recommendation from a professor or other academic source, emphasizing the student's likelihood of completing their degree successfully.

3. Declaration of any relevant learning disabilities, accompanied by a legitimate evaluation or plans to obtain one.

Name: Seneca International Academy
Overview:
The Seneca International Academy (Seneca College) is a renowned public institution located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It offers a diverse range of programs, with 27 graduate courses, 59 diplomas, 29 advanced diplomas, 19 certificates, and 11 bachelor's degrees, across six faculties. These faculties include Aviation, Business, Education, Community & Social Services, Fashion & Esthetics, Hospitality & Tourism, Information Technology, Science, and Law. Seneca College has multiple campuses spread throughout Greater Toronto & Peterborough, in strategic locations such as Newnham, York, King City, Markham, Peterborough, Downtown Toronto, and Yorkgate. The student-faculty ratio is impressively low, at 12:1, ensuring that students receive personalized attention and support.

At Seneca College, practical experience is highly valued and actively promoted, and students have multiple options to gain industry experience and apply their classroom learnings. The Career & Placement cell provides opportunities such as co-ops, work-study programs, apprenticeships, employer-led projects (ELP), externships, internships, and job placements. This not only enhances their knowledge and skills but also makes them job-ready.

Seneca College offers on-campus & off-campus accommodation options for its students. The on-campus residences are suite-style units consisting of two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a bathroom. Meal plans and retail outlets are also available on campus, making it convenient for students. Additionally, Seneca College has collaborated with Places4Student Inc. to assist students in finding affordable off-campus accommodations through an online platform.

The cost of attending Seneca College for international students is approximately 6,795 CAD, excluding other expenses. To support its students, Seneca College offers scholarships & bursaries, with varying amounts ranging from 50 CAD to 1,500 CAD, to those who have applied to the college. These financial aids are available based on different criteria.

Name: McMaster University
Overview:
McMaster University, found in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada, is a prestigious doctoral-medical university with a focus on research. Established in the year 1887, it boasts of six academic faculties along with 70 research institutes. With more than 3000 undergraduate and 150 graduate programs available, it has emerged as a sought-after destination for students across the globe. Some of the popular majors offered at McMaster include Biology & Biochemistry, Computer Science, Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Environment/Ecology, Neuroscience & Behavior, and Psychiatry/Psychology. 

Located in the Westdale neighborhood of Ontario, near the western shores of Lake Ontario, McMaster spreads across an impressive 300 acres and has excellent connectivity through metro and bus routes. It is divided into three campuses, namely Core Campus, North Campus, and West Campus. It also has four regional campuses situated in Burlington, Niagara, Downtown Hamilton, and Kitchener-Waterloo. 

On-campus accommodation is available for more than 3,600 students in 12 residences, offering a variety of options such as Apartments, Suites, and Dormitories. The university also has an Off-Campus Resource Centre to assist international students in finding suitable off-campus accommodation after the first year. 

For international students, the average annual cost of attending McMaster University is 8,548 CAD. The university also offers financial aid in the form of scholarships, considering the academic merit and financial needs of the students. Some of the scholarships available are McMaster Honour Awards, Athletic Financial Awards, Entrance Awards for Indigenous Students, and Faculty Entrance Awards. 

To cater to the career growth and development of its students, McMaster University offers several opportunities such as the Work-Study Program, on-campus employment, paid internships, and placement assistance upon completion of the degree.

These programs also serve as academic pathways for further education at the University of Canada West.
