Name: Pures College of Technology
Overview:
Founded in 2007, Pures College of Technology is a privately owned academic institute situated in Toronto, Canada. The university offers degrees, diplomas, and certificates in three primary subject areas, namely Business, IT, and Social Sciences. The renowned university is favored by a large number of learners opting to pursue their education in various fields of study like Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, Sales and Marketing, Event Management, Nursing, Information Systems Management, Supply Chain and Logistics Management, Database Administration, Computerized Accounting, and Quality Assurance & Systems Testing. Moreover, Pures College also provides skill-based training programs, alongside the English Language Studies Program especially crafted for international students to make them more proficient in the language.

Admission into Pures College is dependent on either holding an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or similar education equivalent to an Ontario Secondary School Diploma. Alternatively, aspirants can sit for the Pures College Entrance Test, and their candidature will be decided based on the program-specific cutoffs. The institution also requires applicants to submit their past academic records, CVs, resumes, scores of English Language Proficiency exams, and Letter of Recommendations (LORs). Financial aid is also available for eligible students through the Second Career program, initiated by the Government of Ontario. Under this program, students can get a waiver of up to 33,786 CAD towards their tuition or accommodation costs. International students can also apply for study-work permits, enabling them to work up to 20 hours a week while pursuing courses that are longer than six months in duration.

While Pures College does not provide on-campus accommodation, it does offer housing assistance to its students. The university helps students in finding suitable accommodation either with local Canadian families or with other students living in apartments. The college is strategically located, with easy access to various amenities like a transportation hub, shopping center, supermarkets, banks, government offices, recreational areas, and restaurants.

Pures College has a vibrant and active student union that manages numerous clubs and societies catering to different academic and creative interests of its students. The institution also offers career counseling services to its students and alumni to guide them in their professional journeys. Workshops, internships, and career fairs are a regular part of the curriculum to prepare students for job interviews and placements.

Name: Renison University College - University of Waterloo
Overview:
Established in the year 1959, Renison University College - University of Waterloo is a publicly-funded educational institution situated in Waterloo, Canada. It is closely affiliated with the University of Waterloo, with its areas of focus being Global Engagement through Languages and Culture, Social Engagement and Innovation, and Community Engagement. This prestigious college was founded by a group of individuals comprising of Walter A. Bean, Carl E. Dunker, William N. Hancock, Russell A. Echlin, Stanley A. Lorriman, The Rev. Canon William A. Jones, Harold B. Soanes, William H. Timmis, The Ven. Harvey F. Southcott, and Joseph A. Underhill. 
Renison University College - University of Waterloo offers both undergraduate and graduate degree programs. The School of Social Work offers both bachelor's and master's degree programs, which can be studied on a full-time or part-time basis. In addition to this, the college also provides interdisciplinary courses under its Social Development Studies program, combining subjects such as Social Work, Psychology, and Sociology. The Centre for Community and Professional Education offers degree-free programs in the areas of spirituality, language, and culture. 
The college boasts an impressive acceptance rate of 53% annually, with a faculty to student ratio of 1:18. The beautiful 6-acre campus of Renison provides students with a wide variety of facilities and services, including the Lusi Wong Library, Chapel of St. Bede, The Luscott Ministry Center, and the Great Hall Cafeteria. The average class size at the college is 60, and the current student enrollment for the Centre for Community and Professional Education, Global Engagement through Language and Culture, and Social Development Studies and the School of Social Work are 5,129, 4,844, and 6,318 respectively. Financial aid is also available for students, with the current total financial aid disbursed by the college being $370,908.
Eligibility Overview:
Renison University College offers three undergraduate programs: Social Development Studies, Honours Arts & Business, and Honours Arts. Prospective students are required to apply through the OUAC website and pay a $130 fee. The application requirements include submitting transcripts from college, English proficiency test scores (for international students), personal statements, interviews, artistic portfolios, online evaluations, and an Admissions Information Form (AIF).

To be considered for admission, Renison expects applicants to meet country-specific standards. Some of these requirements are: achieving a score of 70% or higher in English in Class XII for the Indian education system; achieving a minimum of 75% in Senior 3 English and 85% in Senior 3 Mathematics for the Chinese education system; and obtaining a grade of 3 or above in English and an overall average of 4 in the Governmental System of Thailand. This information should be reviewed by applicants before applying to Renison University College.

Some of the top-rated programs at CIMT include PG Diploma in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, PG Diploma in Sales and Marketing, and MBA.

Moreover, the college prioritizes the health and well-being of its students by offering a comprehensive medical insurance plan. While the college itself does not provide on-campus housing, it has partnered with local representatives like Homestay and Airbnb to ensure affordable accommodation options for its students.

Placement:
Lakehead University offers a diverse range of learning opportunities that allow students to broaden their knowledge and skills. From international learning programs to community placements, students can explore various avenues of learning during their time at the university. These programs also provide valuable hands-on experience in different locations and working environments.

One of the unique learning opportunities at Lakehead is the option to participate in international teaching placements. This allows students to teach, learn, and work in attractive locations around the world through collaborations with international partners. The university currently offers five overseas placement destinations, including Malaysia, Sint Maarten, London, Scotland, and Wales, for a 5-week placement. It's worth noting that in the past, members of the Faculty of Education also had the chance to work in China and the United Kingdom as international teaching assistants. While these collaborations are currently inactive, they may be available in the future.

Another way for students to gain practical experience is through community placements. These placements allow students to apply their theoretical classroom knowledge in real-world situations related to history. To successfully complete a community placement, students are required to fulfill 150 community service hours, attend career seminars, and complete other relevant assignments.

Community placement, fieldwork, and internships are often used interchangeably to describe the practical work students undertake to supplement their theoretical studies. At Lakehead University, these experiences fall under the category of community placement and involve collaborating with a partner organization to gain valuable learning opportunities under the guidance of a supervisor. To be considered for a community placement, students must complete an application form provided by the Department of History. This application is also shared with the community placement partner, who selects the most suitable candidate for the placement.

In recent years, students have had the opportunity to work with a variety of community partners, including the City of Thunder Bay Archives, Lakehead University Archives, ShebaFilms, Northwestern Ontario Sports Hall of Fame, Thunder Bay Military Museum, Thunder Bay Historical Museum Society, and Thunder Bay Public Library. These partnerships provide a range of practical experiences related to history and heritage-related fields that enhance students' academic knowledge.
Accommodation:
Lakehead University- Orillia is situated in a prime location with easy access to a range of popular restaurants such as Starbucks, St. Louis Bar, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell. This educational institution takes great pride in its two exceptional research facilities, the Paleo-DNA Laboratory and the Biorefining Research Institute. The university is dedicated to providing a holistic and fulfilling experience to its students and encourages participation in various sports activities. It is home to four varsity teams and six competitive extramural sports teams. Lakehead University- Orillia offers a wide range of undergraduate and graduate degree programs to choose from. 

Accommodation on campus aims to create a safe and clean environment for students to ensure academic success and personal growth. The university strives to foster a diverse and thriving community. Lakehead University Residence provides a multitude of opportunities for social, educational, and recreational activities. It is the perfect place for students looking for an all-inclusive experience and a chance to broaden their horizons. The university's environmentally friendly residence hall offers 240 single bedrooms with shared bathrooms, kitchenettes, and quiet study spaces. The residence is structured in a unique, modern design with 40 single rooms on each floor. 

One of the top preferences for housing among students moving away from home for the first time as well as global and upper-year students is the Orillia Residence. It offers the convenience of living on campus and a welcoming community environment. The residence provides a comprehensive meal plan, freeing up more time for studying and extracurricular activities. Students coexist in a single room with only two roommates and share a full bathroom. 

The university provides a range of amenities to its residents, including a double-sized long captain-style bed with storage drawers, a desk with chair and lamp, a bookcase, bulletin board, closet with shelves, and clothes bar. Other facilities include waste and recycling bins, a window blind, snack fridge, full-length mirror, in-room sink, Wi-Fi, and cable TV hookup. All utilities are included in the housing fee. For more details, visit the university's website: https://www.lakeheadu.ca/students/student-life/residence.

Name: University of Moncton
Overview: The Université de Moncton, commonly known as the University of Moncton, is a publicly funded institution located in New Brunswick, Canada. It was founded in 1963 and offers a diverse range of academic programs, including 40 postgraduate programs. Over 53,000 degrees have been conferred by the university since its inception. The course offerings include but are not limited to Marketing, Business Administration, Engineering, Music, and Psychology. With six libraries on campus, namely the Rhía-Larose Library, the Champlain Library, and the Shippagan Library, students have access to a wide range of resources, including books, journals, media, and e-publications. Part-time courses are also available in various fields, such as Biotechnology, Visual Arts, Translation, and Biology. The university's unique Co-operative/COOP Education programs provide students with the opportunity to gain hands-on, professional experience, by working for 3-4 months while studying. Some of the popular COOP programs include Business Administration - Finance, Mechanical Engineering, and Information Management. The University of Moncton has established various inter-institutional agreements that recognize the educational qualifications earned by students at other universities. To meet the university's French language requirements, a French Immersion program is offered, which consists of four courses in the first year, specially designed for students from an English-based education system. The Continuing Education program at the university offers workshops and seminars, including courses on Contemporary Management, French in Business, and Healthy Start, aimed at helping students enhance their career skills. It costs approximately CAD 7,860 for domestic students and CAD 13,808 for international students to complete a baccalaureate program at the university. The university also provides financial aid, such as the Bourses Abdou-Diouf, Bourses Harrison-McCain, and Bourses d'accueil, to assist students with their academic pursuits. On-campus accommodation options include Lafrance, Lefebvre, and Midard-Collette residences, which offer studio apartments for students. Short-term and summer housing is also available for interns and guests. The university promotes physical activity and recreation by providing access to various sports facilities, including badminton courts, CrossFit training, and a swimming pool, as well as opportunities to participate in theater productions and music performances. The University of Moncton has an impressive graduate employment rate of 94%.

Obtaining a Study Permit from the Department of Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) is necessary to study in Canada.
For the undergraduate program, a completed and signed admission form is mandatory.
For French language courses, a minimum average of 65 percent is required.
The International French Test or TFI can be taken to demonstrate proficiency in the French language.
Fluency in French or completion of Grade 12 French course is required.

Name: Ascent College
Overview: Ascent College of Technology, situated in Montreal, Canada, is a renowned private career college. The college was established to provide students with the necessary skills and knowledge to thrive in the ever-evolving fields of artificial intelligence and network security. It offers a diverse range of courses in information technology, including the highly sought-after Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning AEC and Network Security and Ethical Cyber Piracy AEC, both of which are graduate certificate programs. Ascent College caters to both local and international students, offering courses in both English and French. These top-rated programs open up lucrative employment opportunities in emerging IT fields such as cybersecurity, data analytics, and game technology. Given its location in Montreal, students can also enjoy an enriching social life by being close to other prestigious universities and the vibrant downtown area. On average, students can expect to spend around CAD 11,000 for their annual living expenses, while on-campus housing for international students costs approximately CAD 5000.
Eligibility Overview:
Admission to Ascent College of Technology requires a bachelor's degree spanning three years with a minimum of 60.0 percent GPA (equivalent to 54 percent as per Indian standards).

For foreign students, an overall band score of 6.0 in IELTS is mandatory (with no score below 6). The minimum required scores for Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing are 6.0, 6.0, 6.0, and 6.0, respectively. Alternatively, a PTE score of 46 or more is acceptable.

Students can also opt for TOEFL iBT, with a minimum overall score of 60. The scores for individual sections must be 12.0 for Listening, 13.0 for Reading, 18.0 for Speaking, and 21.0 for Writing. These stringent standards enable us to ensure the quality of education we provide at Ascent College of Technology.

Name: St Lawrence College
Overview:
St. Lawrence College (SLC) is a publicly funded institution established in 1967 as a college of applied arts and technology, located in Ontario, Canada. It has three main campuses situated in Brockville, Cornwall, and Kingston. With a diverse student population of over 6,700 full-time students, SLC offers a broad range of programs (89 in total) including more than 30 certificate programs, 40 diplomas, and 20 advanced diplomas, certifications, and apprenticeship training programs in areas such as Applied Arts, Community Services, Business, Computer and Engineering Technology, Justice Studies, and Health Sciences. The tuition fees for different courses can vary from $15,000 CAD to $22,000 CAD per annum. Students can also avail scholarships such as the Board of Governors Entrance Scholarships and the Laul's M. Square Media Scholarships to assist with their financial needs. 

SLC provides a multitude of amenities for its students, including bookstores, food services, Scruffy Salon, Essence Dining Room, Hairstyling & Esthetics, Music theatre shows, and Event and Banquet Services. The campus boasts of impressive facilities like the Marianne van Silfhout Gallery, an 80,000-square-foot Student Life and Innovation Centre, a double gym, an outdoor atrium and deck, Health Care Simulation Labs, Student Services, and Davies Hall study area. Additionally, students can also join various clubs and societies, including the St. Lawrence Surge varsity teams, which regularly participate in various national championships. Accommodation options are available at all three campuses, with 29 double-occupancy rooms at the Brockville Campus, 44 private suites at the Cornwall campus, and a 600-bed residence at the Kingston campus. Students can expect to spend around $7,000 CAD for their living expenses. 

The institute's career management services are geared towards helping students secure employment opportunities, and it is evident through the fact that 91.6% of graduates find employment or further studies within six months after graduation. Some of the top employers for SLC graduates include the Department of National Defense, Queen's University, Empire Life, City of Kingston, and Kingston Health Sciences Center.

Name: Vancouver Film School
Overview: Vancouver Film School, based in British Columbia, Canada, is a renowned private institution for entertainment arts education. It has been a pioneer in this field since its inception in 1987, gaining global recognition. On a functioning level, the school is akin to a studio as it offers programs that cater to the creation of content for TV, film, games, and design. The curriculum follows a perfect balance between hands-on production work and industry-driven theory. Boasting 15 signature post-secondary programs, VFS delivers excellence in education. Some of its most sought-after programs include VR/AR Design & Development, Classical Animation, Film Production, and Sound Design. The school has a student base of 1000 and spreads its course offerings across eight campuses in Downtown Vancouver. Additionally, VFS also runs a branch in partnership with Shanghai University, where it has introduced the unique VFS teaching model for entertainment arts programs. The institution prioritizes student success and provides extensive career resources, which include both full-time and part-time internships, and summer programs. A strong portfolio is the cornerstone of a successful career, and thus, VFS grants access to industry-standard tools and job placements to its students. The tuition fees at VFS differ based on the program selected and range from $10,500 to $53,250. International and domestic students can both apply for scholarships offered by the school. VFS aims to enhance the overall campus experience by offering multiple student clubs and social organizations that foster connections, fun, and learning. Moreover, the school takes care of student well-being by providing housing and counseling services. The campus is fully equipped with top-notch infrastructure, including vending machines and studios. If you're looking to pursue a career in entertainment arts, Vancouver Film School should be your top choice.

University Language Requirements for First Level ProgramsActing Essentialsfoundation for Design and ArtFilm and Television DesignMakeup Design for Film and TVVisual Media Sound Design

The first tier programs at this university necessitate certain language proficiency standards.Essentials for Acting, Foundation in Visual Art and Design, Designing for Film and Television, Makeup Designing for Film and Television, and Sound Designing in Visual Media are all covered.


Level 1 Programs Language Requirements:
In order to qualify for Level 1 Programs, the following language proficiency levels must be met:

- For Essential of Acting, Visual Art & Design Foundation, Designing Makeup for Film and Television, and Visual Media Sound Design, applicants must achieve a minimum of Band 6.0 on the IELTS academic level test.
- A score of 68 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT) or 520 on the paper-based TOEFL (PBT) is required for all Level 1 programs.
- A score between 52 and 57 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE) is also accepted for these programs.
- An overall score of 700 on the Test of English for International Communication (TOEIC) is required.
- A minimum grade of C on the Cambridge English: First (FCE) exam is accepted.
- A Level 4 on the Language Proficiency Index (LPI) is also an accepted language proficiency level for Level 1 Programs.
- A score of 95-100 on the Duolingo exam is also acceptable.

Language Requirements for Level 2 Programs:
Applicants for the following Level 2 Programs must meet the following language proficiency levels:

- For Visual Effects & 3D Animation, Film & Television Acting, Concept Art for Animation, Animation in the Classical Style, Design for the Internet, Making a Movie, Designing Video Games, Game, Web, and Mobile Programming, Writing for Film, TV, and Video Games, and Design and Development of Virtual and Augmented Reality (VR/AR), a minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS academic level test is required.
- A minimum score of 80 on the internet-based TOE

Name: University of Windsor
Overview:
The University of Windsor was established in 1857 and is situated in the southern region of Canada. It boasts of a diverse community of 16,231+ students from over 100 nations, with 23% belonging to the international student body. With a wide array of subjects, the university offers 190 undergraduate and 65 graduate and doctorate programs across nine faculties including education, arts, social sciences, humanities, engineering, graduate studies, law, nursing, science, human kinetics, and the prestigious Odette School of Business.

The University of Windsor is home to several reputed departments such as the EPICentre (Entrepreneurship, Practice, and Innovation Centre), WEtech Alliance, CAW Centre, St. Denis Centre, and the Essex Centre of Research. These departments work towards providing students with a holistic educational experience, equipped with practical skills and the latest advancements in technology.

In addition, the university also provides its students with the opportunity to secure on-campus as well as off-campus jobs. International students can also benefit from acquiring a work permit that can eventually lead to permanent residency after graduation. The University of Windsor is dedicated to nurturing future leaders and strives to equip its students with the necessary tools and resources for a successful career in their chosen field.
Eligibility Overview: The University of Windsor requires a minimum of three years of high school for students applying to undergraduate programs, specifically Grades 10, 11, and 12. In addition, applicants are highly encouraged to submit their SAT and ACT scores to the university. It is also worth noting that credit transfer is possible for Advanced Placement, International Baccalaureate, and other globally recognized tests. When it comes to graduate and PhD programs, the University of Windsor mandates a minimum of a three or four-year bachelor's or master's degree (equivalent to the US education system) with an average of 70-77%. For non-native English speakers, the following standardized tests are required to demonstrate English proficiency: PTE or TOEFL iBT (minimum 100) or IELTS (minimum 7.0). However, for MBA programs, prior work experience is highly recommended. Additionally, the institution has set a minimum GMAT score of 550-600 for admission into these programs.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Bonavista
Overview:
The College of the North Atlantic, located in Atlantic, Canada, is a prominent post-secondary institution specializing in skills and educational training. With campuses spanning across 17 locations in various Canadian provinces and a technical education college in the Middle East, the institution offers a wide range of options for students. Its annual student body of 25,000 is provided with access to over 100 full-time and 300 part-time courses. Among these, the college offers diplomas in Civil Engineering Technology, Hospitality Tourism Management, Computer Systems and Networking, to name a few. Additionally, students can also pursue certificate courses such as the Certificate in Comprehensive Arts and Science Transition, Certificate in Heavy-duty Equipment Technician, and Certificate in Heavy Operator.

Situated in Bonavista Bay on the East coast of Newfoundland, the Bonavista campus is affiliated with a local high school and Discovery collegiate. This campus provides full-time credit programs, advanced block trades training, and Contract and Continuing Education courses. To accommodate students with busy schedules, many courses are also offered on weekends. Furthermore, meritorious students are eligible for various forms of financial aid, including scholarships and grants from the Canadian government and the government of Newfoundland and Labrador.

As per the US News 2022 rankings, the College of the North Atlantic secures a noteworthy 92nd position among the Best Colleges in National Liberal Arts College. It continues to offer comprehensive education and opportunities for students to excel in their chosen fields.
Eligibility Overview:
Academic Requirements: To be eligible for admission, applicants must hold a valid All India Senior School Certificate issued by CBSE or Indian School Certificate Year 12 published by CISCE. Other acceptable certificates include Higher Secondary Certificate, Higher Secondary School Certificate, Senior Secondary Certificate, Pre-University Certificate, or Intermediate Certificate issued by state boards. 

English Requirements: In addition to the above academic qualifications, applicants must also demonstrate proficiency in the English language. This can be shown through scoring well on standardized English language tests such as TOEFL, IELTS, or Cambridge Advanced English. Alternatively, applicants who have received their education in English may also be considered for admission.

University information:

At the College of the North Atlantic, students are provided with numerous opportunities to enhance their skills and knowledge through various programmes. These programmes include certificate and diploma programmes that aim to equip students with practical skills and employability. 

Certificate programmes offered at the university require students to complete an unpaid work placement in order to receive their programme certificate or graduate from the institution. This work placement gives students a valuable learning experience in a real workplace environment. The main objective of the work placement is to develop and demonstrate high standards of behavior and performance that are typically expected in a professional setting. Through this, students are able to gain technical skills and enhance their employability, contributing to their personal growth and development. In addition, the work placement enables students to expand their network of connections, providing them with a broader perspective on potential career paths.

Depending on the programme, the work placement can last for two weeks or six weeks for certificate and diploma programmes, respectively. Students are required to commit a minimum of 30 hours per week and a maximum of 40 hours per week as per the employer's requirements. The work placement typically takes place during the intersession period, subject to the availability of suitable employers. For students who complete their studies out of the regular course sequence, the work placement will take place in the semester immediately following the last semester of their studies. On completion of their certificate programmes, students will only undertake a two-week work placement. For students in their first year of a two-year diploma programme, the work placement will take place at the end of their second year.
Accommodation: The College of the Atlantic offers on-campus housing in the Bay St. George, Burin, and Happy Valley-Goose Bay campuses. Additionally, there are several off-campus accommodation options in Newfoundland and Labrador that are conveniently located near the university. To facilitate student housing, the college has compiled a list of off-campus housing options near each campus. Some examples of off-campus accommodation options are single rooms in apartments or houses, rental apartments, rental houses, and boarding houses. These housing options also offer meal plans for students. The costs for these off-campus accommodations range from $700 to $1000, depending on the type of accommodation chosen. Name: Mohawk College - Stoney Creek Campus for Skilled Trades
Overview: Mohawk College is an accredited institution funded by the Ministry of Training, Colleges and Universities. As a public college and member of the Association of Community Colleges of Canada, it boasts three main campuses, located in Ontario, Canada, and Hamilton. This reputable institution is the largest trainer in Ontario, annually preparing 2,900+ apprentices for the workforce. With a diverse selection of programs, including Auto Body & Collision Damage Repairer, Construction Engineering Technician, and Welder, students receive comprehensive training to excel in their chosen career paths. The college also offers 146 continuing education courses, such as Accessible Media Production and Air Brake Training, to further enhance students' knowledge and skills. The Marshall School of Skilled Trades & Apprenticeship, equipped with state-of-the-art facilities and experienced faculty, provides top-quality in-school job training. Upon completion, students will receive an Ontario College certificate. In addition to academic offerings, Mohawk College also provides off-campus housing options. To support students financially, the college has invested over $3 million in bursaries and scholarships. For financial literacy, students can seek guidance from the Mo' Money Resource Centre. According to Webometrics, Mohawk College ranks 88th in Canada. This institution has received over 25 awards for its sustainability efforts, including being named Canada's Greenest Employer in 2021. It also earned recognition as one of the "Top 3 Performers" in North America in the AASHE Campus Sustainability Index (2020). Within 6 months of graduation, 86% of Mohawk's graduates find full-time employment in their respective fields. The college's CareerReady portal allows students to search for seasonal, full-time, or part-time jobs, or schedule an appointment for career assistance. Additionally, the Mohawk College Alumni Association provides a platform for students to stay connected with their instructors and former classmates for career-related advice and resources.
Eligibility Overview:
Mohawk College offers undergraduate admissions for two bachelor's degrees: Bachelor of Science in Technology (B.Tech.) and Nursing Bachelor of Science. In order to apply, students must provide transcripts from their high school and higher education institute, which should be translated and notarized. They must also provide official IELTS or TOEFL scores. For the B.Sc. program, applicants must have completed biology and chemistry courses, while mathematics is required for B.Tech. Submission of a resume is also necessary. 

Mohawk College also offers admissions for advanced diploma programs, providing students with a pathway to transfer to other college and university programs. Some of the diploma programs available are Business Administration, Chemical Engineering Technology, Mechanical Engineering Technology, and Tourism. In order to be admitted, there is no specific cutoff for the 12th grade, but students must have completed a 10+2 high school diploma with required coursework in math and science, and have a 60 percent average on their 10+ diploma. They must also have a strong proficiency in English, and coursework in chemistry and physics is recommended. Students must also submit a resume to complete their application.
Placement: Renowned for its high graduate employability rate, Mohawk College boasts an impressive statistic of 88.4 percent of its alumni securing employment within six months of graduating. In fact, for the past five years, the College has consistently ranked first in the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area for graduate employability. Setting its students up for success, Mohawk College offers a valuable platform for career advancement through various events, including career fairs, workshops, and virtual meetups. The college also provides students with access to the Career Ready Portal – a hub where they can browse through job opportunities and where employers can list their available positions. With a reported average salary of 53,111 CAD for Mohawk College graduates and alumni, it's no surprise that this institution is a top choice for students seeking a promising career start.
Accommodation:
The university offers both on-campus and off-campus accommodation options for students. However, on-campus housing is in high demand, particularly for international students, and the application deadline for September housing is May 15th. Students living on campus are required to select a meal plan from the available options.

On-campus housing is convenient and desirable for students who prefer to live close to campus. To reserve a spot in College Residence, international students must submit their housing application by May 15th for the September intake. Additionally, all on-campus residents are obliged to select a meal plan, which can be chosen from a range of options provided.

For students who would rather explore off-campus options, there are various off-campus housing choices available. The university also assists students in finding off-campus accommodation, providing resources and guidance. However, it is recommended to apply early for on-campus housing

Name: Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN) - Grenfell Campus
Overview: Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN) is the single university located in Newfoundland and Labrador, serving as a public, research and teaching institution. This multi-disciplinary, multi-campus university encompasses four campuses, one of which is the Grenfell campus. The Grenfell campus is a small, interdisciplinary site that offers graduate programs in science and arts, along with undergraduate degrees in business, science, fine arts, arts, nursing, and resources management. It covers an area of 185 acres and has a student population of approximately 1300. The campus houses various schools, such as the School of Fine Arts, School of Science and the Environment, Western Regional School of Nursing, and School of Arts and Social Science. The University has received substantial funding from the provincial government, which reflects its high emphasis on education. This allows students to benefit from affordable and quality post-secondary education. The Memorial University of Newfoundland fees for undergraduate students (2 semesters, full time) range from $2500 to $11500, depending on their nationality (international, Newfoundland and Labrador, or other Canada-based students). The graduate tuition fee of this university is one of the lowest in Canada. The campus boasts of excellent facilities, such as new research labs and classrooms for digital multimedia and GIS, as well as the Boreal Ecosystem Research Facility. Other notable features include a fine arts theatre and gallery, Navigate Business Advising Centre, and an astronomical telescope for research purposes, used by astronomy and physics students.
Eligibility Overview:
Here are some requirements for gaining admission to a university:

1. Successful completion of a recognized university preparatory program, with approved senior level courses in five subject areas. These typically include: 
- English 
- Mathematics 
- A language (modern or classical) or laboratory science 
- Social science 
- Elective 

A minimum grade of at least 50% in each of the five required subject areas is necessary. This is generally equivalent to no more than two grades below 50% and a passing grade in each academic area. 

2. Demonstration of proficiency in the English language. 

3. Meeting the admission criteria for a competitive program, if applicable. Some programs have limited spots available, making admission highly competitive. As part of the faculty-specific admissions process, a higher overall grade average and additional materials may be required.

Name: Bow Valley College
Overview: Bow Valley College, founded in 1965, is a public tertiary institution located in Alberta, Canada, offering a wide range of vocational and technical courses. The college is divided into seven schools and centers, namely the School of Foundational Learning, the Chiu School of Business, the School of Global Access, and the School of Community Studies. It provides a variety of certificate, diploma, and degree programs such as pharmacy technician, business administration, foundation in entertainment arts, and disability studies. International students can also take part in various international programs and internships facilitated by the college's 'Study Abroad Programme.' Additionally, students can benefit from scholarships such as The Financial Need Bursary, Entrance Awards, Metis Scholar Award, and National Chief Atleo Scholarship. Bow Valley College takes pride in equipping its students with hands-on training to prepare them for the workforce. It also emphasizes skill development, ensuring that students are well-versed in the latest technologies. The college also offers career services and specialized interview training. As part of its commitment to gender equality, Bow Valley College has set up the '1000 Women Rising Fund' to support women in pursuing higher education despite financial barriers. So far, the fund has assisted more than 500 women, raising over $880,000 towards their education.

Name: New York Institute of Technology, Canada
Overview:
NYIT, also known as New York Tech, was founded in 1955 as a private research university. With a primary focus on technology and applied scientific research, it boasts two main campuses located in Old Westbury on Long Island and in Manhattan, New York. In addition, it has campuses in Arkansas, the United Arab Emirates, China, and Canada, along with a cybersecurity research facility and a biosciences and bioengineering lab on its Old Westbury campus. The Computer Graphics Lab at NYIT holds particular significance in the history of computer graphics and animation, as it is where both Pixar and Lucasfilm conducted their pioneering research.

The university is comprised of five schools and two colleges, which include the School of Architecture and Design, School of Interdisciplinary Studies and Education, School of Engineering and Computing Sciences, School of Health Professions, School of Management, College of Arts and Sciences, and College of Osteopathic Medicine. Undergraduate, master's, and doctorate degrees are offered across these various schools and colleges. Currently, NYIT offers five PhD programs, with plans to introduce more in the near future. Notably, it is also the birthplace of entirely 3D computer-generated imagery (CGI) films.

As of 2020, NYIT is connected to two Turing Award winners. In 2018, it had a total of 9,930 full-time students enrolled across its global campuses. According to the US News & World Report, NYIT is considered a "selective" university, with an acceptance rate of 75% as of 2022. This data provides an overview of the prestigious and technologically advanced New York Institute of Technology.
Eligibility Overview:
The following information pertains to admission requirements for undergraduate and postgraduate students at the university: 

- For undergraduate students, admission is determined by their AP, IB, and A-Level exam scores, as well as transcripts for any prior college coursework. Graduation from all previous schools and colleges must also be verified. 
- Postgraduate students are admitted based on their performance in the GRE, GMAT, and MAT exams. In order to qualify for the university's postgraduate program, candidates must hold a bachelor's degree from a recognized institution. 

To be considered for admission to the university, all students must meet the English language proficiency requirements.

Ph.D. students also offer free tutoring on selected evenings.

The university offers four types of fully furnished accommodations that come with meals. The average cost of on-campus housing and meals is approximately 10,000 CAD. The allocation of housing is based on a first-come, first-serve basis, hence it is advisable to apply early. The four on-campus residence options are designed keeping in mind the needs of students. Additionally, international students can opt for off-campus housing through the university's homestay program where they can stay with a local family. Other options for off-campus housing can be found on various websites, but it is essential to conduct thorough research before committing to any arrangement. Living in Saskatoon is comparatively affordable for international students, and the university also provides a U-bus pass to make transportation around the city more accessible.

The university has also earned a spot between 301 and 400 for computer courses in THE rankings for three consecutive years (2019-2021).
University Ranking:
The year 1907 marked the inauguration of the University of Saskatchewan, recognized internationally as a prestigious public research institution and an active member of the U15 Group of Canadian Research Universities. It effectively stands tall amongst many other research universities in Canada. Being the biggest educational establishment in Saskatchewan, Canada, it has made consistent strides in promoting higher education. The table tabulated underneath indicates the rankings garnered by the University of Saskatchewan (uSask) over the years.

The University of Saskatchewan (uSask) has been accorded a ranking of 465 by the reputed QS World University Rankings, exemplifying a climb from its earlier placement of 471 in 2016. Additionally, it was enrolled amongst the top 301-400 universities by the ARWU Shanghai Ranking for four consecutive years between 2017 and 2020. Further, the University maintained its QS World University Rankings at 465 while retaining its 538th position in the US News and World Report.

 It is pertinent to mention that different ranking systems make use of distinct criteria while assessing universities. While QS employs an extensive emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Faculty/Student Ratio (20%) and highly cited Research Papers (20%), Times Higher Education (THE) evaluates the universities based on a parity between Teaching Quality, Research Output, and Citation (30% each). Whereas, US News & World Report relies on various parameters including the Global & Local Research Reputation as well as the Number of Published Papers (weightedized and accounts for 12.5% each) in determing the University's rankings. The Shanghai Ranking, on its part, exercises no importance accorded to an institute's standing amongst researchers and peers. Instead, it relies on scrutinizing the quality of academic research undertaken and the number of Nobel Prizes clinched by the concerned faculty. Admissions to the University of Saskatchewan in the year 2021 shall follow.

Name: Niagara College - Niagara-on-the-Lake
Overview:
Niagara College was founded in 1967 and is located in Welland. It is considered to be the first college in Canada to offer courses in breweries and wineries. The college has three campuses, including Taif, Welland, and Niagara-on-the-Lake. One notable feature of the college is the Tourism Industry Development Centre, which provides specialized training in tourism and hospitality. The Niagara-on-the-Lake campus, situated at 135 Taylor Road, has various facilities such as a winery teaching section, dining room, Niagara culinary institute, Field Nursery, and Living Labs. The campus also includes a wine sensory laboratory, on-site greenhouse equipment, and three vineyards.

Niagara College offers a wide range of undergraduate, diploma, graduate, and certificate programs. In addition, it also provides general and vocational courses in areas like spa and salon services. The college is well-known for its business, hospitality, engineering, and management courses, along with its prestigious wine and culinary programs. The Wine Institute at the Niagara-on-the-Lake campus offers a variety of courses for students interested in pursuing a career in the brewery and culinary industries.

The college's Niagara-on-the-Lake campus is further divided into diverse schools, such as Academic, Liberal and Access Studies, Environmental and Horticulture, Apprenticeship, and the Canadian Food and Wine Institute. Moreover, Niagara College also offers a four-year Bachelor's degree in fields like Game Programming, Human Resources, International Commerce, and Global Development, and Game Design.

At Niagara College, students can access various scholarships, bursaries, and awards to make their education more affordable. With an impressive graduate employment rate of 86%, the college aims to prepare students for the job market, guaranteeing their employment within six months of graduation. As per the US News and World Report, the college has been ranked 21st in the Regional Universities North category.
Eligibility Overview: Niagara College Canada has specific eligibility requirements for their undergraduate and graduate degree programs. For undergraduate degrees, students must have earned a full-time bachelor's degree from an approved institution. When applying for a graduate degree, applicants must have a bachelor's degree and a minimum grade point average of 50%. In the event of prior research, there can be a maximum of nine academic backlogs. Additionally, Niagara College requires English proficiency for all degrees. The university follows a strict plagiarism policy and all data must be rephrased and personalized to ensure originality and avoid duplication. To maintain strong SEO, the rephrased data must be of the same length as the original and use SEO-oriented language to embed relevant keywords.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Prince Philip Drive
Overview:
The College of the North Atlantic, based in the province of Newfoundland and Labrador, is the largest post-secondary educational institution in Canada. It encompasses 17 campuses across the state, with the Prince Philip Drive campus situated in the southern region of the capital city, St. John's. This campus offers a diverse range of courses, including applied music, business management, cooking, early childhood education, and graphic design, amongst others, with a total of 37 full-time and per-semester credit courses. When it comes to employability, the College of the North Atlantic boasts a remarkable placement rate of 94%, with 96% of its graduates successfully placed within the first 6 months after completion of their studies. In 2020, the college was ranked 7th among National Universities by Webometrics University Ranking. 

One of the most appealing aspects of the college for international students is its relatively low tuition fees, compared to other institutions in Atlantic Canada. This, coupled with its commitment to providing high-quality education, with a student-to-faculty ratio of 4:1, makes it a sought-after choice among students from various countries. However, the college does not offer scholarships or financial aid to international students, as it aims to provide affordable quality education for all. Nonetheless, to assist students in meeting their educational expenses, the college works closely with the Government of Canada and the Government of Newfoundland and Labrador to offer financial aid to eligible students. Students can also avail themselves of student loans to finance their studies. 

Moreover, the college also offers a range of scholarships and awards, such as the Boyd Summers Memorial Bursary, Atlantic Credit Union Bursaries, TD Insurance Meloche Monnex Alumni Achievement Awards, CNA Faculty & Staff Achievement Awards, and the College of the North Atlantic Industrial Trades Distinction Scholarship. Name: Cornerstone International Community College of Canada - Cornerstone Tech
Overview:
Cornerstone International Community College of Canada is a reputable public university situated in the bustling city of Vancouver, British Columbia. Our institution specializes in a variety of courses including Web & Mobile App Development, Network & System Solutions Specialist, Digital Marketing Specialist, Hospitality Management, and English Language Training. With two campuses, Cornerstone Tech and West Hastings, our students have access to a dynamic and diverse educational environment.

The Tech campus, located in Downtown Vancouver, is conveniently situated just 10 minutes away from our other campus. Its central location places students in the heart of the city, surrounded by vibrant cafes, bars, shopping malls, and easily accessible transportation routes. This prime location also offers students close proximity to renowned tourist attractions such as Stanley Park, the Vancouver Aquarium, and two beautiful beaches within a five-minute radius.

At Cornerstone International Community College of Canada, we pride ourselves on providing a comprehensive education that prepares students for the workforce. Our diploma and certificate Co-op programs allow students to gain paid work experience during their academic term. With a 96% job placement rate within the first month of Co-op, our international students from over 72 countries have the opportunity to enhance their academic knowledge and gain practical experience in a Canadian workplace.

We understand that attending university can be financially challenging for international students. That's why we offer a range of scholarship opportunities to assist students with tuition and accommodation costs while studying in Canada. Our goal is to cultivate a multicultural community and foster social integration among our students. We organize various social activities to improve their language skills, and we strive to create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all our students in Canada.
Eligibility Overview:
Cornerstone College offers three intake options for international students: September, February, and July. To apply for a diploma program, there are four steps to follow.

Firstly, interested candidates must complete an online application form. Then, they must gather a copy of their passport and an English proficiency test score. However, for those applying for ESL programs, a test score is not required.

Next, applicants need to create an online profile and upload their necessary documents through the online platform. If an English proficiency test has not been taken, a placement test is mandatory for international students enrolling in English courses or other career programs. Scoring high on the TOEFL PBT (min. 513), TOEFL CBT (min. 183), TOEFL iBT (min. 65), or IELTS Academic (min. 5.5) will suffice. Alternatively, applicants can take the Cornerstone Placement Test and score at the high intermediate level.

Once admission requirements are met and all documents have been submitted, the college will send an invoice requiring the first payment. Upon receiving this payment, a letter of acceptance will be issued. Then, the applicant can proceed to apply for a student and work permit (if opting for co-op).

Name: Nova Scotia community college
Overview: NSC College, founded in 1996, is a publicly funded community college situated in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. It comprises of 16 campuses and community learning centers, catering to a student body of over 22,000 individuals. The college offers a diverse range of programs, including computer science, human and health services, new media, industrial trades, arts, business, and technologies. It is renowned for its undergraduate and postgraduate degrees, which number over 130 and are available for both full-time and part-time students. Specialized institutes of the college include the School of Fisheries, Centre of Geographical Sciences, Nautical Institute, and Aviation Institute. Admissions are accepted for the fall, winter, and spring semesters. In addition, the college also extends customized training programs to students in various industries, government agencies, and businesses. The top courses at NSC College encompass aircraft maintenance, animation, programming, graphic designing, and dental assisting. The Adult Learning program, devised by the college, enables students to attain an adult high school diploma. Sobey Awards are some of the scholarships awarded to students. The college does not provide on-campus accommodation, but has partnered with Places4students.com to assist students with off-campus housing options. NSC College provides financial aid and scholarship opportunities to international students through programs such as Urgent Aid, Sponsor A Students, and Donald R. Scholarships. It boasts of robust placement opportunities, with 88% of students securing employment within a few months after graduation, with a maximum salary potential of $25,000.
Eligibility Overview:
To be admitted to this university, there are certain requirements that must be met. Firstly, you must have successfully completed high school with a minimum grade point average (GPA) of 2.0, or an equivalent from another educational system. Additionally, you must also submit a final transcript showing proof of graduation.

Along with your transcript, you must also submit official results from a standardized test that assesses your English proficiency. If English is not your first language, you will need to provide one of the following: International English Language Testing System (IELTS Academic Test) with a minimum score of 6.0 in listening, reading, writing, and speaking, or a total score of 80 on the TOEFL iBT with a minimum of 60 on the paper-delivered test. Another option is the CanTest with an average score of 4.5, or a minimum level 8 score on the Canadian Language Benchmark (CLB).

In addition, this university also accepts a minimum band score of 60 on the Canadian Academic English Language Assessment (CAEL) or a minimum score of 59 on the Michigan English Test (MET). Finally, a minimum score of 55 on the Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE) is also accepted.

It is important to note that the exam must have been taken within the past two years from the date of submitting your application to be considered official. Furthermore, the official results must be sent directly from the testing company to the university's admissions office. Adhering to these requirements will ensure your application is considered for admission.

Name: Trent University
Overview:
Trent University, a prestigious public research university in Ontario, Canada, was founded in 1964 and is known for its high academic standards. The university offers a vast range of 128 undergraduate programs, including degrees, certificates, diplomas, and specializations, as well as 12 postgraduate courses, 14 thesis-based master's programs, 6 doctoral programs, and 4 graduate diploma programs. Name: Olds College
Overview: Olds College, located in Olds, Alberta, is a prominent public post-secondary institution. It was formerly known as Olds Agricultural College and is a member of the prestigious Alberta Rural Development Network. The curriculum at Olds College is tailored to advance the agricultural industry, making it a distinctive and locally-focused school. With a mission to provide accessible education, Olds College is recognized as Canada's premier Smart Agricultural College. Some of its top programs include Bachelor of Science in Agribusiness, Business Management Diploma, Precision Agriculture-Techgronomy Diploma, and Horticulture Technologist Diploma. Admission is granted based on GPA and English proficiency test scores. The average tuition fee for international students at Olds College is USD 4,460. Moreover, they can also apply for the Alberta Scholarship & Bursary Program. The institution offers excellent counseling services and other learning support to ensure students' academic success. The Calgary Campus is a collaboration with the Calgary Stampede Board, providing students with unique opportunities. Olds College is highly regarded for its exceptional job placements, including the prestigious Alberta Smithsonian Internship Programme.

- For applicants seeking a bachelor's degree, the minimum educational requirement is the completion of 12th grade with a minimum GPA of 75%.
- For students looking to pursue post-degree programs, a 2-year undergraduate diploma with a minimum GPA of 72% is required.

To demonstrate proficiency in English, applicants are required to take an English language proficiency test. The specified requirements for this test are as follows:

- For bachelor's degree seekers, an overall minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS (International English Language Testing System) test is required, with no individual band score below 6.0.

Placement: The university offers a range of opportunities for students to gain valuable job experience and explore their interests in various fields such as science, business, history, and the arts. The Alberta Smithsonian Internship Program is a 10-12 week program that allows students to work at the renowned Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C. and assist with research and production of exhibits. Successful applicants will receive a $10,000 prize and must have completed at least 60 credits with a minimum GPA of 3.0. Another option is the Alberta-Saxony Internship and Intercultural Alliance (ASiiA) which provides Alberta students with the opportunity to participate in a research or industry internship in Saxony, Germany. The internships are directly related to the student's field of study and can cover areas such as technology, business, health, energy, and education. A minimum of 24 credits with a GPA of 2.50 is required for this program and the ability to speak German is preferred. Both opportunities are available to Canadian citizens or permanent residents.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Clarenville
Overview:
College of the North Atlantic, located at 69 Pleasant Street, in Clarenville, Newfoundland, caters to approximately 175 full-time students and 400 continuing education students per semester. With an impressive offering of more than 100 programs, such as Computer Science, Business and Management, Applied and Pure Sciences, Tourism and Hospitality, Architecture and Design, and more, the college sees around 9,000 student enrollments annually. International students are encouraged to apply, with a student-to-faculty ratio of 4:1. In addition, the college offers both full-time and part-time courses, as well as options for transferability for students looking to continue their education at home or abroad. CNA also assists students in obtaining post-graduation work permits, as well as off-campus accommodations, allowing them to work and study simultaneously.

Ranked 92nd in the 2022 edition of Best Colleges in National Liberal Arts Colleges, CNA boasts an excellent alumni network dedicated to helping graduates secure employment opportunities. Moreover, with a 96% employment rate within six months of graduation, and an overall placement rate of 94%, the college is committed to bridging the gap between education and industry demands. CNA has partnered with industry leaders and government organizations to promote innovation and stay abreast with the ever-changing global economy, while also serving the needs of the local community.
Eligibility Overview:
The academic requirements differ across different programs, and no specific criteria have been mentioned. The requirements also vary according to the English proficiency level. The specific criteria for each program should be checked individually. For English proficiency, a minimum score of 60 in CAEL, 550 in TOEFL paper-based test, 79 in TOEFL internet-based test, 213 in TOEFL computer-based test (or equivalent), an overall band score of 6.0 in IELTS Academic test, and a minimum of 78 in MELAB is required.

Our university follows a diverse range of academic criteria, subject to variation depending upon the program pursued. However, no specific criteria have been explicitly stated, hence it is advisable to refer to individual program requirements. English proficiency is also a key factor to be considered, with a minimum score of 60

Name: Quest University Canada
Overview:
Quest University Canada is located in the bustling town of Squamish, British Columbia. It is a non-profit, private institution that offers a single four-year degree, the Bachelor of Arts and Sciences. With a student-faculty ratio of 14:1, the admission process is competitive, with an acceptance rate of 48%. The university has a seminar-style teaching method, allowing a maximum of 20 students per class. It has five divisions, covering a diverse range of subjects, including arts and humanities, life sciences, mathematics, physical sciences, and social sciences. The university is home to over 600 international students from 40 different countries who can pursue a Bachelor of Arts and Science degree. To be considered for admission, international students must provide the necessary documents, including TOEFL and IELTS scores.

The estimated annual cost of attendance at Quest University Canada is approximately $15,000. However, students can also take advantage of scholarships, bursaries, and government loan programs offered by the university. Apart from academic support, Quest University Canada offers a well-rounded student experience on campus. It has a library building, a gymnasium, and a service building with a cafeteria. The university also offers assistance with accommodations, with five student residences available.
Eligibility Overview:
To be eligible for enrollment in your preferred courses, you must satisfy the academic and language proficiency requirements listed below: 

Academic Qualifications: 
To begin your studies at Quest, you must either have completed the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma or will have completed it by the time you start your program. Additionally, you must have completed three full years of academic studies where English was the language of instruction. 

English Language Proficiency: 
To be considered eligible, you must meet the following requirements for English language proficiency: 

- By the time you commence your studies at Quest, you must have fulfilled or will fulfill the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma. 
- You must have completed three years of full-time academic studies where English was the primary language of instruction.

Placement: All campus jobs are paid at an hourly rate, with an additional 4% for vacation pay. Hours may either be fixed or project-based. Students will be under the supervision of either a staff or faculty member, who holds control over their employment. Failure to show up for scheduled shifts or meet satisfactory performance standards may result in job loss, with no replacement being made. Full-time or part-time job opportunities may occasionally arise beyond the usual academic year, following the conclusion of the spring semester. At university, students can enhance self-awareness, develop professional skills, explore diverse job options, and continue their education. Our Career Services department offers career guidance and advice, along with support and workshops on resume writing, interview skills, and other critical job search and application skills. Professional Week is a dedicated week of career development programming, including informative panels and seminars on career skills and exploration. We also host a Job Fair and provide workshops on effectively marketing your Quest degree. Students can access internet-based resources and view current job and opportunity postings.
Accommodation:
Quest University, Squamish, is a private liberal arts and sciences university located in British Columbia, Canada. Founded in 2002, the university offers a Bachelor of Arts and Sciences degree, allowing students to design their own degree program and take courses in various disciplines. With a student-faculty ratio of 10:1, the university provides personalized and interactive learning opportunities for its students.

Quest follows a block plan system, where students take one course at a time for an intense three and a half week period. This allows students to fully immerse themselves in the subject and have in-depth discussions with their classmates and professors. The university believes in experiential learning and encourages students to apply their knowledge and skills in real-world situations, giving them a competitive edge in the job market.

The campus is nestled in the scenic Squamish Valley, surrounded by mountains and forests, providing a beautiful and peaceful environment for studying and living. The campus also has modern facilities, including a library, a sportsplex, and a state-of-the-art science building. The university strongly believes in sustainability and has implemented initiatives such as a Waste Management System and an Organic Garden on campus.

The Quest experience is incomplete without living on campus. Students participate in activities and get to know their peers in a safe and friendly environment. Each residence building has a student Resident Assistant to coordinate activities and provide support, creating a strong sense of community. The university also has a Faculty-in-Residence program and some employees who live on campus, promoting accessibility and equity.

The main residence on campus, The Peaks, is divided into two buildings, Ossa and Red Tusk, named after the peaks of the Tantalus Range. These residences offer a balance of quiet and private spaces and communal and creative spaces. Students have single bedrooms and share a washroom with a neighbor. The Residences at Quest University offers 31 well-appointed rooms with budget-friendly prices, free WiFi, and parking. All rooms are non-smoking and disabled-friendly, with amenities such as a welcome tray, fresh towels, and a flat-screen TV.

Overall, Quest University provides a unique and comprehensive learning experience, combining top-quality education with beautiful surroundings, modern facilities, and a strong sense of community.

Name: International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) - Toronto
Overview: Since its establishment in 1997, the International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) has been a premier private English language institution, catering to international students seeking long or short-term courses to improve their language skills. With campuses in Ontario, British Columbia, and Vancouver, ILAC's Toronto location is conveniently located in the vibrant neighborhood of Yorkville. The Toronto campus boasts modern boutique-style schools, complete with advanced student lounges and common areas. ILAC's range of programs includes Business English, IELTS Exam Preparation, General English, College and University Pathway, and accommodations and activities options, as well as programs for young adults, GAP years, and high school students. ILAC also offers comprehensive college and university placement services, as well as post-secondary counseling services. With a diverse student body hailing from over 75 countries, ILAC prides itself on its ability to cater to students of all levels, ages, and requirements by creating custom study packages tailored to students' academic goals. Equipped with state-of-the-art facilities, ILAC's Toronto and Vancouver campuses offer a modern and innovative learning environment. With over 20 years of experience, ILAC specializes in fluency in more than 40 languages and employs only highly qualified instructors with TESOL training and top-notch degrees. Besides academic excellence, ILAC also focuses on providing students with immersive real-life English practice by organizing social events throughout the year. In 2021, ILAC received the Award for Language School in the Greater Toronto Area and has been named the Best Language School in Toronto for seven consecutive years. Additionally, ILAC was a finalist for Language Educator of the Year at the 2020 Pioneer Awards, further solidifying its reputation as a top-notch language institution committed to providing students with an exceptional learning experience.

Name: Red River College - Steinbach Campus
Overview:
Red River College Polytechnic (RRC Polytechnic) is a renowned institution that was established in 1938 and is located in Steinbach, Canada. It is the largest polytechnic college in the Manitoba Province, offering over 200 full-time and part-time degree programs with a strong focus on applied learning and research. The courses offered at the Red River College - Steinbach Campus cover a wide range of disciplines including Accounting, Business Administration, Computer Applications, Early Childhood Education, Languages, Human Resources Management, and Nursing, among others. However, international students have the opportunity to enroll in programs such as Business, Intensive English, Health Sciences, Computer and Information Systems Technology, Community Services, Creative Arts, Transportation Technology, Health Sciences, Indigenous Education, Hospitality, Skilled Trades, Engineering, Creative Arts, and CAD Technology.

At RRC Polytech, there are various financial aids available for eligible students, including awards, scholarships, and bursaries. Some of these include the Bell MTS Telecommunications Award, C.P. Loewen Family Foundation Bursary, Dave Orton Award, and Perry Allan Scholarship Award. The total student population at Red River College is more than 22,000, with over 1400+ students coming from different countries. On an average, the cost of living for a student at Red River College is around CAD 11,000, while the tuition fee varies depending on the course undertaken. The undergraduate tuition fee ranges from CAD 8,000 to CAD 18,000, while the graduate tuition fee is around CAD 17,000 to CAD 18,000. It is important to note that these fees are subject to change as per the course and citizenship of the student.

For admissions, applicants need to fulfill specific requirements related to their chosen program and also provide proof of their proficiency in the English language. The minimum IELTS score for undergraduates is 6, while for TOEFL it is 79. Graduate students need to have a minimum IELTS score of 6.5 or a TOEFL score of 80 to be eligible for admissions. With a diverse student population of 24% representing 60 different countries, Red River College provides ample opportunities for its students to enhance their skills and knowledge through recruitment fairs, work-study programs, interview preparation, on-the-job training and internships, and more.
Eligibility Overview:
1. The primary requirement for admission is the first specified condition, signified by the digit "1". This may refer to either High School Diploma (equivalent to Grade 12 in Manitoba) or Post-Secondary Education (equivalent to Grade 12 in Manitoba with a diploma or degree in the related field, as stated in that category). 
2. Fulfill the language proficiency criteria by obtaining minimum required scores in a language proficiency test (TOEFL, IELTS Academic, or CanTest).
3. Submit a comprehensive resume to the International Business Department.
4. Programs in the field of Creative Arts may necessitate participation in a mandatory orientation and submission of a portfolio (not mandatory at the time of applying but mandatory for completion of the admission process).
5. Provide evidence of current and completed vaccinations and health tests for the Health Care Aide program.
Placement: At the college, the career services department is dedicated to assisting both students and alumni in their job search. It offers a variety of resources such as job and internship listings, on-campus recruitment events, and career counseling. Students can also access the Job Central platform to view the latest job postings from employers. Additionally, employers are welcome to come to the college to recruit students for their companies. The average salaries for RRC's programs and courses over the past three years ranged from 24,960 to 90,000 CAD. Students can also participate in a work placement program to gain valuable hands-on experience. According to Emolument, RRC graduates and alumni earn on average 24,960 to 90,000 CAD based on their degree.

Name: George Brown College
Overview:
George Brown College of Applied Arts and Technology is a certified public institution that was founded in 1966 by the government of Ontario. The college boasts of three expansive and vibrant campuses located in Downtown Toronto, with its main campus being Casa Loma. This campus contains five buildings, ample green spaces, as well as a student gym, library, cafeteria, and theater. The St. James campus, on the other hand, is home to the Center for business, art, design, information technology, culinary arts, and hospitality. The Daphne Cockwell Centre for Health Sciences, located at the Waterfront Campus, offers programs in areas such as dental health, health service management, nursing, and design. 
George Brown College provides a wide range of academic options to international students, with over 162 courses and 193 areas of continued education. These include 27 certificate programs, five pre-college programs, ten apprenticeship programs, and 28 graduate certificate programs. The courses are offered through the college's various departments: Center for arts, design, and data technology, business, community services and early childhood, construction and engineering technologies, health sciences, hospitality and culinary arts, and preparatory and liberal studies. The college is highly recognized for its virtual and in-person campus tours which showcase state-of-the-art learning facilities that simulate real-world experiences for students.
The primary goal of the college is to equip students with the necessary skills and knowledge to excel in their chosen fields. International students are required to pay a tuition fee ranging from CAD 13,275 to 18,102. On-campus and off-campus accommodation options are available for students, with single and shared apartments costing around CAD 10,100 per year. Furthermore, George Brown College offers financial aid in the form of scholarships, bursaries, and awards to students who have demonstrated academic excellence or outstanding performance in sports. Graduates from this college are highly sought after, with many securing roles in human resources, sales, and business development.
Eligibility Overview: The English Proficiency Test Requirements for admission to George Brown College must be met by all international students who are non-native English speakers. These test scores are important for acceptance into the college and they are outlined below: An overall score of 6.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), a minimum of 84 on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) Online version, a 70 on the Canadian Academic English Language (CAEL) test, a score of 60 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic, and an 85 on the Michigan English Language Assessment Battery (MELAB). These scores are essential to demonstrate sufficient English language proficiency in order to be granted admission.
Placement: Some of the most lucrative job opportunities are available for graduates who have completed their degrees/certifications from George Brown College. According to recent statistics, those who pursued courses in Human Resources, Sales, and Business Development were offered the highest salaries. On average, a graduate from this college can expect to earn approximately $45,000 annually. To further aid students in their career success, the college provides a dedicated career coach who offers valuable services such as resume building, career assessments, and job search assistance in Canada. These services are designed to guide students towards a promising and fulfilling career path.
Accommodation:
At the university, individuals have the option to select from a variety of temporary housing options, including Shared Accommodations, One-Bedroom Apartments, and Two-Bedroom Apartments, each with their own respective costs.

Applicants can decide which type of residential accommodation suits their needs best, as there are multiple options available to choose from. These options include Shared Accommodations, which involve living with others, One-Bedroom Apartments, as well as Two-Bedroom Apartments. The costs for each type of accommodation may vary.
