Name: Red River College - Notre Dame Campus
Overview: Established in the mid-1930s, Red River College (RRC) is the largest polytechnic institute in Manitoba, Canada, known for its focus on applied learning and research. With three major campuses located in Winnipeg, RRC's Notre Dame Campus is the most spacious and vibrant, housing advanced programs in transportation technology, health sciences, skilled trades, and engineering. This campus also serves as a home to the Rebels, RRC's athletic teams. As the hub of various facilities, such as computer labs, student lounges, Tim Hortons, applied research labs, and two fully-equipped gyms, it offers students a complete college experience. Along with academic support, RRC's Awards and Financial Aid Office provides extensive information on financial assistance programs that Manitoba students can avail. In 2020, RRC granted over $2.9 million in bursaries, scholarships, and awards to support students in their academic journey. The cost of tuition varies according to the program enrolled in, and additional fees, such as Student Services Fee, Technology Fee, Material Fee, Technology Infrastructure Fee, Canadian Nursing Student Association Fee, and Supplemental Exam Fee, apply as necessary. For domestic applicants, a non-refundable application fee of $100 to $120 is charged per application, whereas international applicants must pay $130 to $160. RRC's Student Employment Services prepares students for their careers by offering a range of support services, including a dedicated online job board, Job Central. Alumni can also access these services within six months of their graduation to help them find employment opportunities.

Name: Okanagan College - Salmon Arm
Overview:
Located in British Columbia, Canada, Okanagan College is a world-renowned institution that offers post-secondary education services. It was originally founded in 1963 as B.C. Vocational School and later renamed Okanagan College in 1965. The college is affiliated with prominent organizations such as CiCAN, CCAA, CCBC, and CBIE. Each year, it welcomes over 20,000 new students from around the globe. The college's mission is to provide an inclusive learning environment for both students and the community.

Okanagan College operates four campuses, each offering a wide range of programs at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels. Popular areas of study include science, humanities, accounting, business, tourism, technology, trade apprenticeship, and education assistance. The Salmon Arm campus, in particular, is known for its extensive adult upgrading system, where students can upgrade their diplomas to degree programs.

The college boasts various facilities such as a library, bookstore, student housing, and rentals, as well as campus security. One of the unique features of the Salmon Arm campus is its adult upgrading system, where students can upgrade their diplomas to degree programs. The latest Canadian University ranking (Uni Rank) places Okanagan College at number 82 among the top universities in Canada.

With a moderately selective acceptance rate, the college has seen a steady increase in international student enrollments, with an average of 900 students every year. The college maintains a student-faculty ratio of 19:1 in its classes. However, the tuition fees can be quite expensive, ranging from $55,000 to $60,000. Fortunately, the college offers various scholarship opportunities for deserving students. Additionally, the university strives to understand the employment needs of its graduating students and alumni. It has a partnership with the Student, Graduate, and Co-op Employment Centre to provide them with the latest job and internship opportunities after graduation.

Name: University of Calgary
Overview:
The University of Calgary is a renowned public research university founded in 1966 in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. It enrolls students in courses related to arts and humanities, psychology, physical sciences, biotechnology, applied microbiology, business management, economics, engineering & technology, architecture, education, and communication. It boasts of its extensive range of academic programs, with over 250 undergraduate majors and 70+ graduate options across its five campuses, spread across 14 different faculties. The primary campus covers 530 acres in Calgary's Northwest Quadrant. Aside from the Main Campus, the University also has four other campuses, namely the Foothills Campus, the Downtown Campus, the Spy Hill Campus, and the Qatar Campus, all of which offer various specialized courses at graduate and undergraduate levels. 

Boasting a highly diverse student population, the University of Calgary has a considerable international student presence. In terms of expenses, the University charges an average annual cost of 16,642 CAD, including tuition fees, accommodation expenses, and other miscellaneous costs. However, for students facing financial constraints, the University offers various financial aids, scholarships, and grants, including work-study programs and bursaries that can go up to $25,000 for master's programs.

With a student-faculty ratio of 17:1, the University of Calgary ensures personalized attention to its students. For students staying on campus, the University has a capacity of 2,500 beds divided between dorm-style and apartment-style accommodations. Additionally, the University offers various placement and career opportunities to its students, including work-study programs, internships, research opportunities, training, and part-time and full-time placements. This helps students gain practical experience and real-world exposure while pursuing their academic studies at the University of Calgary.
Eligibility Overview:
The following are the academic requirements for admission to the desired courses at our university: 
Requirements for undergraduate students: 
- High school and post-secondary study transcripts/projected outcomes must be provided 
- Fulfillment of subject requirements for the chosen program, with English being a compulsory subject 
- A valid TOEFL/IELTS Academic/Pearson Test of English (iBT) score 

Requirements for Master's degree students: 
- Completion of a four-year Bachelor's degree with First Class division 
- A minimum CGPA of 8/10 (or 7.5/10) for IIT students 
- Applicants with a three-year Bachelor's degree must hold a Master's degree 
- A valid TOEFL/IELTS Academic/Pearson Test of English (iBT) score 

Requirements for Doctoral Programs: 
- A Master's degree with honours in the first division 
- A minimum CGPA of 8/10 (or 7.5/10) for IIT students 

English language test requirements: 
International students must provide scores for one of the following English language proficiency tests: TOEFL/IELTS Academic/Pearson Test of English (iBT) in the internet-based format.

Name: New Brunswick Community College - St. Andrews
Overview:
New Brunswick Community College (NBCC) was founded in 1974 and is a public community college located in Canada. With six campuses in Fredericton, Moncton, Miramichi, Saint John, St. Andrews, and Woodstock, the college offers a wide range of programs for students. The St. Andrews campus, situated in one of Canada's oldest resort towns, offers excellent opportunities for students looking to pursue careers in the tourism and hospitality sector. The campus, which is close to banks, supermarkets, and medical services, is a convenient place for students to live and study. Additionally, the campus is just an hour away from the nearest airport in Saint John. NBCC has affiliations with prestigious organizations such as the Canadian Collegiate Athletic Association (CCAA), Canadian Bureau for International Education (CBIE), Association of Universities and Colleges of Canada (AUCC), and the Association of Canadian Community Colleges (ACCC). The St. Andrews campus offers full-time programs in Aquaculture Operations, Carpentry, Culinary Arts, Culinary Arts Management, Electrical (Industrial), Hotel and Restaurant Management, and more. Part-time online programs are also available, such as Abnormal Psychology, Calculus, and Business Math. NBCC also offers apprenticeship programs in Refrigeration and Air Conditioning, providing students with hands-on professional experience while they study. The college offers scholarships, awards, and bursaries to help fund eligible students' education. According to the Webometrics ranking, NBCC is ranked 152nd in Canada. The tuition fees at NBCC vary for each course and differ between domestic and international students. For example, domestic students enrolled in a full-time program may need to pay approximately $3,380, while international students would pay $9,468. 
NBCC offers various resources and support to students, including TutorMe, which provides three hours of free private tutoring per week. Students can also receive assistance through Learning Circles and peer tutoring programs. The latest survey shows that within one year of graduation, 91% of students from the 2019 batch had found employment, with 94% of them working in New Brunswick. NBCC has a strong alumni network, which offers various benefits, such as job opportunities and networking opportunities with other graduates.
Eligibility Overview:
Below are the requirements for admission to our university. Please note that these guidelines must be followed in order for your application to be considered. Failure to meet any of these requirements may result in your application being rejected.

- Official transcripts from all previous academic institutions must be submitted. This includes transcripts from high school and any bachelor's degree programs.

- If English is not your native language or if you have not completed at least three years of secondary school or one year of post-secondary education at a university where English is the primary language of instruction, you must demonstrate your English proficiency by submitting scores from tests such as IELTS, TOEFL, or other acceptable exams.

- Each test has its own specific criteria that must be met. Please refer to the individual test's guidelines to ensure you meet all requirements.

Name: Holland College - Summerside Waterfront
Overview:
Holland College, established in 1969, is a renowned provincial community college located in Prince Edward Island, Canada's smallest province. The college is spread across 8 campuses, each specializing in a particular field. The newest addition to these campuses is the Summerside Waterfront campus, which was opened in 2012. It is situated 60 km away from the main campus, the Prince of Wales campus in Charlottetown. This campus is in the second-largest city of the province, famous for its cultural heritage. Featured on the banks of Summerside Harbour, the Summerside Waterfront campus offers students a chance to explore water sports and cultural sites such as the Wyatt Historic House Museum and Eptek Art and Culture Centre. Safety-wise, Summerside is among the safest cities to live in Canada.

Summerside Waterfront Campus is a centralized hub for business, computer studies, and health studies. It also serves as the center for Industrial Technology and Trade. The unique geographic location of the campus also makes it an excellent Marine Training Centre. Well known for maintaining a high graduation rate, Holland College recorded 92% in 2020. The college also emphasizes practical knowledge, allowing students to apply their classroom learning in real-life industrial settings through internships. International students can further benefit from 20 hours of weekly on-campus work. With a student fund of CAD 500,000, Holland College provides scholarships to both international and domestic students. Moreover, with 90+ pathway degree programs, students can transfer their credits to prestigious universities in Canada and the USA for advanced studies in their fields of interest.
Eligibility Overview: To apply for admission to our university, you will need to submit several required documents and meet specific criteria. These documents include official academic transcripts, standardised test results (such as TOEFL or IELTS) for any previous studies in Canada, financial documentation, and immigration documents. We accept various scores from tests like TOEFL, IELTS, and PTE as proof of English proficiency. International applicants can use these scores to demonstrate their language skills, and we require a minimum score for consideration.

The admission requirements at Coquitlam College include proof of English proficiency through scores of exams like IELTS and TOEFL, as well as standardized test scores like GRE, SAT, GMAT, etc. Students must also submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, transcripts from previous institutions, and valid passports and visas for admission.

Name: Mentora College of Business & Technology
Overview: Mentora College of Business and Technology, a higher education initiative of BAU Global, is a private business career college located in Toronto. Offering programs in Hotel Management and Business Administration Management, this college emphasizes on interactive and project-based learning, catering to a small group of 14 students in each class. To ensure practical learning, the programs require students to complete a 384-hour supervised practicum. Mentora College also holds a membership in the BAU Global Network and houses an English as Second Language (ESL) school, Mentora Language Academy Toronto. Collaborating with Georgian College, one of the premier public colleges in Ontario, the college offers a pathway program where the credits earned can be transferred to the latter. Students seeking admission at Mentora College of Business and Technology must meet certain requirements, such as holding an Ontario Secondary School Diploma (OSSD) or equivalent, being at least 18 years old, and passing a qualifying test that is approved by the Superintendent of Private Career Colleges. International students must also obtain a minimum of 5.5 on the IELTS English language test. Both the diploma programs at Mentora College of Business and Technology include work placements, supervised by the college's placement team. These placements not only provide students with hands-on experience, but also employment references for their future careers. After completing the Diploma in Hotel Management, students can pursue careers in roles such as Guest Services Supervisor, Banquet Supervisor, Front Office Supervisor, Assistant Restaurant Manager, and Food and Beverage Controller. Similarly, students graduating with a Diploma in Business Administration Management can opt for careers as Office Administrators, Marketing Assistants, Assistant Managers, Management Trainees, Branch Managers, and Project Coordinators, among other options.
Eligibility Overview: To be admitted into this university, you must meet two requirements. Firstly, you must be at least 18 years old and pass an admissions test which has been approved by the superintendent. In case English is not your native language, you may be asked to provide evidence of any one or more of the following: a) a satisfactory score on a recognized English proficiency test such as Duolingo English or IELTS 5.5; b) official confirmation of a degree from a reputable higher education institution where English was the medium of instruction; c) successful completion of other recognized English preparation courses, with a demonstrated equivalent to a 5.5 IELTS score or higher; or d) obtaining a minimum of 60% marks in each course.
Placement: At Mentora College, students have the opportunity to complete a 384-hour work placement during their final semester. This mandatory requirement is crucial for obtaining the advanced diploma, but it is a highly valued and sought-after experience by our students. The work placements are available in various companies located in downtown Toronto, providing students with an opportunity to put their acquired knowledge into practice and gain real-world experience. Upon completion of their English studies, students can continue working towards their diploma on the same campus, further enhancing their educational journey.
Accommodation:
For students attending the university, it is crucial that they book their accommodations well in advance to ensure availability, as lodgings tend to fill up quickly, particularly before the semester begins. It is recommended to secure lodgings before arrival.

There are a variety of off-campus rental housing options available, including single homes, duplexes, apartments, and rooms for rent in the surrounding area. Students must conduct thorough research and arrive early prior to the semester's start if they choose to live off-campus.

Homestays are also a popular choice among students, with options tailored to their interests and preferences. Hosts range from singles, young couples with children and pets, to elderly couples. Our partners strive to find the perfect homestay match for each student.

Name: Georgian College - South Georgian Bay
Overview:
Located in the province of Ontario, Georgian College has earned accreditation from the prestigious Canadian Association for Co-operative Education (CAFCE). The college focuses on providing students with comprehensive education through a variety of programs, including graduate degrees, certificates, apprenticeship training, and university programs. Its vast array of more than 130 programs has catered to a diverse range of over 3,600 international students. Spread across seven campuses, Georgian College has a reputation for excellence in education. 
One of its campuses, the South Georgian Bay Campus, boasts a spacious 20,000-square-foot building and offers courses in business and management, healthcare, community services, tourism, hospitality, and human services. Equipped with state-of-the-art facilities like community rooms, computer labs, and nursing simulation labs, the campus provides a conducive environment for learning. 
The college has an impressive track record of placing 89% of its graduates within six months of graduation. With smaller class sizes and a high level of transparency in the student-faculty ratio, Georgian College is highly selective in its admission process, with a current acceptance rate of 81%. The campus is situated in the picturesque Collingwood area, on the southern banks of Georgian Bay. 
Georgian College prides itself on its career-oriented education, with a strong emphasis on practical training and industry connections. The college's career development services provide students with valuable guidance and support in their job search. Its strong alumni association boasts highly successful individuals, reflecting the effective placement strategies of the college. Additionally, students can also benefit from discounts on college publications and magazines through the alumni association.

Moreover, please keep in mind that a high school diploma is a must-have credential (school records are not sufficient). Additionally, applicants must have completed Grade XII level courses in math and English.

Please note that providing a college record is not enough; applicants must submit each year's grade sheet as well. Moreover, a curriculum vitae including details about professional experience and community service is also required.

Name: Keyano College
Overview:
Keyano College, situated in the Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo, initially known as Alberta Vocational Centre (AVC) since 1965, is a comprehensive community institution. It aims to meet the academic, cultural, and personal enrichment needs of its students through its various centers, including Suncor Energy Industrial Centre in Fort McMurray, Clearwater Campus, Fort Chipewyan Campus, and Learning Centers in Gregoire Lake and Fort McKay.

This college offers a wide range of programs leading to baccalaureate degrees, certificates of qualification (trades), certificates, and diplomas. It also prioritizes the development of professional skills and knowledge in multiple sectors such as education, human services, energy, arts, sciences, construction, business, transportation, health, and safety. Additionally, Keyano College offers corporate training options for client organizations as well as programs focused on Aboriginal Education and Regional Stewardship to enhance access to learning opportunities.

The college provides financial support for students through bursaries, scholarships, and awards for their achievements. Moreover, financial assistance is available to individuals enrolled at Keyano College. Students can also avail the facilities offered by the Syncrude Sport and Wellness Centre by becoming a member.

In conclusion, Keyano College is a prestigious public institution governed by a board, catering to the diverse educational and cultural needs of the Wood Buffalo community. Its wide range of programs and facilities, along with its commitment to providing financial support, make it a popular choice among students seeking quality education.
Eligibility Overview: This university's admission requirements state that the applicants must meet certain academic standards in order to be considered for their desired courses. These criteria include scoring a minimum of 60% in their 12th standard examination. Additionally, candidates must demonstrate proficiency in the English language by providing relevant documentation. This entails fulfilling both academic and language proficiency requirements. Meeting these qualifications is necessary for admission to the university.

Placement:
There are certain organizations that actively seek to employ college students. Some of these employers include the Magnet Student Work Placement Program, Canada-Alberta Job Grant, Government of Canada - Science and Technology Internship Program, Canada Summer Jobs, and Young Canada Works.

The Magnet Student Work Placement Program is a collaboration between employers, students, and post-secondary education stakeholders, aimed at providing high-quality work-integrated learning opportunities to college students. Employers may receive pay subsidies for hiring post-secondary students for paid internships, while students gain valuable work experience related to their field of study, increasing their chances of securing future employment.

The Canada-Alberta Job Grant is a training program that allows employers to apply for approved training expenses for both current and future employees. Through this program, employers have the freedom to choose the type of training that their staff requires, with funding provided by the Canadian government through the Workforce Development Agreement.

The Government of Canada - Science and Technology Internship Program encourages employers to hire interns by offering a subsidy of up to $13,200 for a maximum of 52 weeks. This subsidy is given to the intern, with the aim of enticing employers to provide internship opportunities. By partnering with Natural Resources Canada, non-federal organizations such as private corporations, universities, colleges, non-profit organizations, and provincial or municipal governments can receive a contribution payment towards a portion of the intern's income.

Canada Summer Jobs is a grant program that assists not-for-profit organizations, public sector employers, and small businesses with 50 or fewer employees in creating jobs for students aged 15 to 30. This program is designed to provide students with valuable work experience while they are on their summer break.

Lastly, Young Canada Works offers pay subsidies and access to talented individuals with innovative ideas and competitive skills to employers in the fields of heritage, arts, culture, and official languages. This program aims to support the growth of these industries by connecting them with promising young talent.

Name: Wilfrid Laurier University
Overview:
Wilfrid Laurier University, named in honor of former Canadian Prime Minister Sir Wilfrid Laurier, is a public higher educational institution located in the city of Waterloo, Ontario, Canada. Established in 1960, the university offers a wide range of academic programs including bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees, as well as online, minor, and other specialized courses. The fields of study offered by the university include arts, science, business and economics, education, human and social sciences, liberal arts, music, social work, international policy, and governance.

Laurier University's career centers provide students with valuable resources for networking and connecting with potential employers. Services offered by these centers include assistance with securing internships, job opportunities, as well as preparing for interviews, writing cover letters, and creating professional portfolios. Furthermore, the university's International Student Work Experience Program (ISWEP) offers students the opportunity to gain practical work experience related to their fields of study while pursuing their academic degrees. To be eligible for this program, students must maintain a minimum GPA of 5.0 and have completed at least one semester. The program offers a wage of 12 CAD per hour, with a work limit of 70 hours per semester.

An impressive statistic, 94.9% of international students at Laurier University secure employment or continue their education within 12 months of graduation. The university has also established partnerships with over 25 institutes across the globe, offering students the chance to participate in a global student exchange program and gain a truly diverse and international experience.

1. Minimum Score Requirements: The university sets a minimum score requirement for standardized English language proficiency tests, which students must adhere to.

2. English Proficiency Tests: As English is not the first language for international students, they must provide proof of their proficiency in the language by taking one of the designated standardized English proficiency tests.

Wilfrid Laurier University has a total of five campuses, with the two main ones located in Waterloo and Brantford. There are also campuses in Kitchener for social work students and in Toronto for part-time MBA programs. As an international student, you will have access to a variety of on-campus and off-campus housing options to choose from during your time at the university. Here is an overview of the different housing options available to you: 

On-Campus Accommodation: Wilfrid Laurier University guarantees on-campus housing for all international students. To secure a spot in the residence hall, you will need to pay a non-refundable fee of 600 CAD. There are two main types of on-campus housing: dorms and apartments. Waterloo campus offers both options, while the Brantford campus only has apartments available for students. Additionally, all students are required to purchase a meal plan, which ranges from 2,374 CAD to 6,155 CAD at the Waterloo campus and 883 CAD to 1,200 CAD at the Brantford campus. 

Off-Campus Accommodation: For students who prefer to live off-campus, Wilfrid Laurier University has partnered with Places4Students.com to provide a variety of housing options near each campus. These options include studio apartments, multiple bedroom apartments, and shared apartments. All of these accommodations come fully equipped with amenities such as air conditioning, high-speed internet, and a kitchen. Monthly costs can vary from 450 to 900 CAD depending on the occupancy and location. These off-campus options also give students the opportunity to live in a residential neighborhood and experience the local culture.

Name: Concordia University of Edmonton
Overview:
Concordia University Edmonton is a prestigious private university located in Edmonton, Canada. Established in 1921, the university is recognized by the Alberta Post-Secondary Learning Act. It offers a diverse range of undergraduate programs in Arts, Management, and Science, as well as graduate degrees in fields such as Information Security, Education, Information Technology, and Psychology. Additionally, it provides several post-graduate degrees, diplomas, and certificates. The university's dedicated faculty and students engage in research activities not only in their respective fields but also in collaboration with other research communities.

The university's library offers a wide range of online tutorials specifically curated to assist students with their research and citations. Ranked 77th in the country by UniRank, Concordia University Edmonton is highly esteemed globally and known for its exceptional focus on academics, research, and teaching. It accepts over 2000 students from various parts of Canada and more than 40 countries worldwide, with an admission rate ranging from 50% to 60%. It also holds the 24th position for being one of the most affordable schools in the US.

Furthermore, the university provides both academic and non-academic services, including libraries, financial aid and scholarships, housing, and sports facilities, to its students. With an impressive 92% employment rate after graduation, Concordia University Edmonton is renowned for its commitment towards providing outstanding education and preparing its students for successful careers.
Eligibility Overview:
Eligibility for admission to desired courses is subject to meeting specific academic and English language proficiency score requirements as outlined below.

Academic Requirements:
In order to meet the admissions criteria for the desired courses, the following academic requirements must be fulfilled:

Undergraduate Programs:
Students must possess a Higher School Certificate, Intermediate Certificate, Higher Secondary Certificate, Indian School Certificate, All India Senior School Certificate, or Pre-University Certificate. If currently enrolled in school, results from prior terms and a list of current classes must also be included. For select schools, additional requirements such as letters of intent, interviews, portfolios, and auditions may be required.

Graduate Programs:
Students must have a bachelor's degree, with a high standing, for programs such as master's degrees, diplomas, and graduate certificates. For Honors, a GPA equivalent to a B average and a specialization are also required. A master's degree, with a high standing, is necessary for doctoral programs.

International applicants seeking Concordia University admissions are required to have a minimum GPA of 3.

English Language Requirements:
Meeting the below-mentioned English language proficiency score requirements is essential for successful admissions:

- For undergraduate programs: A high score on English proficiency tests, such as IELTS, TOEFL, or PTE, is required.
- For graduate programs: Applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English through standardized test scores or other approved means. Letters of recommendation and a statement of purpose may also be required.

Name: Vancouver Community College
Overview:
Established in 1965, Vancouver Community College (VCC) is the oldest institution in British Columbia, Canada. Starting out with a campus in Langara, VCC became an independent college in 1994. It now boasts three campuses - the Downtown Campus in Hamilton, the East Broadway Campus, and Annacis Island. With a network of 36 community and learning centers, VCC offers a wide range of programs in areas such as Design, University Transfer, Academic Upgrading, Health Sciences, Business, Dance, and Music. With over 1,600 students enrolled in its various programs, VCC attracts learners from over 150 countries worldwide, making it a truly international institution.

One of the highlights of VCC is its homestay program, which provides students with private rooms equipped with essential amenities. Other housing options include apartments, basement suites, and condominiums. VCC also has a stellar track record of helping students achieve their career goals, thanks to partnerships with renowned companies like Vancouver Lookout, Bansito Foods and Hospitality, UNESCO-DBT Regional Centre, and Mercury Capital Group of Companies.

For international students, VCC's average tuition fee starts at $10,326, making it a highly affordable option for quality education. With its diverse programs, excellent facilities, and strong industry partnerships, VCC is a top choice for students looking to excel in their chosen fields.

Homestay is a fantastic option that allows students to practice English outside the classroom while also immersing themselves in Canadian culture. At our university, we work with trusted and secure homestay provider, Liane's Vancouver Homestay, to ensure our students have a comfortable and enriching experience.

International students who choose homestay will be placed in a private bedroom equipped with essentials like a bed, mattress, dresser, desk, chair, desk light, and closet. Your homestay family will provide three meals a day, and we encourage students to communicate with their hosts to arrange meal times that suit their schedule.

While the university does not have on-campus housing, we do have plenty of off-campus options for students to choose from. We understand the importance of students finding their own accommodation, and we recommend Liane's Vancouver Homestay for international students. In addition to homestay, students can consider other off-campus options such as furnished and unfurnished houses, basement suites, condos, and apartments. We encourage you to explore the different possibilities and choose the one that suits your needs and budget.

Name: Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) - Melbourne (Heidelberg)
Overview: The Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) was founded in 2007 and is dedicated to providing practical, career-oriented education in fields such as Health Management, Nursing, Community Services (including Aged and Disability Care), and Early Childhood Education. As a part of HCI (Health Careers International), along with Edu Systems and the Institute of Health and Management (IHM), IHNA offers a variety of benefits, such as TEQSA accreditation for Post Graduate certification, compliance with the Australian national regulations for Vocational Education and Training (VET), and accreditation by the Australian Skills Quality Authority (ASQA) for Higher Education. With over 14,000 students from over 50 different nations, IHNA is committed to delivering high-quality education across multiple locations, including Melbourne – the cultural and sporting capital of Australia. The institute follows a self-directed learning approach and utilizes adult learning principles, including self-direction, hands-on experience, practice, and personal development, in its teaching methodology. All courses offered at IHNA are compliant with the Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF). Some of IHNA's university partners include Charles Darwin University (CDU), Western Sydney University, Murdoch University, Flinders University, and the University of Southern Queensland. Students also receive additional support, like mock interviews, career counseling sessions, and workshops on CV writing. The institute enjoys strong partnerships with over 200 placement organizations, including Uniting.

Name: Mercury Colleges - Sydney
Overview:
Mercury College, founded in 1960, offers a diverse range of programs for students. Located in the heart of Sydney, the college attracts a global student body from regions such as the Middle East, East and South Asia, Europe, North America, and South America. At Mercury College Sydney, students can enrol in courses related to Project Management, Marketing, Leadership and Management, Business, English, and Aged Care. The campus is well-equipped to cater to the diverse needs of international students.

The Business program at Mercury College offers two certificate courses, namely Certificate III and Certificate IV in Business. As for Ageing Support and Community Services, students can choose from Certificate III in Individual Support, Certificate IV in Ageing Support, and Diploma of Community Services. The Aged Care program has a fee range of $8,000 to $20,000, while the Project Management program ranges from $6,000 to $10,000.

Mercury College Sydney offers top-notch facilities for its students, including Wi-Fi, kitchens on every floor, and computers in the classroom. It is important to note that the college does not provide accommodation, and students must arrange their own.

Name: Charles Darwin University
Overview: In 2003, the collaborative efforts of Northern Territory University, the Menzies School of Health Research, and Centralian College led to the establishment of Charles Darwin University (CDU). This public institution boasts five campuses, namely Casuarina, Palmerstone, Katherine, Alice Springs, and Sydney. As a member of the Innovative Research Universities, CDU is highly regarded and nationally ranked. The university offers both undergraduate and postgraduate degree programs in a variety of fields, including Arts, Business, Education, Management, Engineering, Psychology, Nursing, Midwifery, Tourism, Humanities, and Information Technology. Additionally, CDU provides vocational courses geared towards skill development, such as Accounting and Bookkeeping, Rural Operations, Construction, Creative Arts and Design, Sport, Tourism and Hospitality, as well as Transport and Logistics. Furthermore, the university offers 16-week Pathway programs designed to assist students in specific areas. For international students, on-campus accommodation is available at Charles Darwin's International House, offering 334 rooms across 16 buildings with access to computers, a study lounge, recreational areas, and a swimming pool. For those studying at the Katherine or Alice Springs campuses, single furnished rooms are available at a cost of 385 AUD and 448 AUD per week, respectively. With an impressive graduation rate of 83.39%, Times Higher Education has recognized CDU as the 28th best millennial university. The average undergraduate tuition fee ranges from 25,328 to 33,480 AUD, while postgraduate programs range from 28,104 to 34,680 AUD. However, the university offers various scholarships, such as the CDU Global Excellence Award, CDU Global Leader Award, CDU Global Achiever Award, and Destination Australia Scholarship, providing financial aid to deserving students.

Name: Australian Technical and Management College (ATMC) - Federation University - Melbourne Campus
Overview:
Australian Technical and Management College (ATMC) is a prestigious educational institute that originated in the Indian subcontinent. It holds national recognition and operates from two campuses, with one located in Melbourne. ATMC has a strong affiliation with two renowned Australian universities, namely the University of the Sunshine Coast (USC) and Federation University Australia (Fed), with a focus on business and information technology programs. The college provides a diverse range of courses, including associate degrees, bachelor's degrees, graduate diplomas, and master's degrees in Accounting and Business, as well as master's degrees in Information Systems and Information Technology. The classrooms at ATMC are equipped with updated technology and learning resources, ensuring students have access to the latest software and hardware solutions.

ATMC provides training in various areas, including high-end applications such as Java Enterprise, .NET, and Case Tools, as well as diverse operating systems like UNIX, Linux, and XP. The college's state-of-the-art laboratories feature Database management solutions, high-end HP servers, wireless devices, and multimedia workstations. An exceptional aspect of ATMC is its Work Integrated Learning (WIL) program, which allows students to gain industry experience through Capstone Industry Projects in their curriculum. These projects are aligned with the Skills Framework for the Information Age (SFIA) and cover areas such as project management, software testing, development, and systems administration. Students work on real-life digital projects, preparing them for the workforce and enhancing their employability. ATMC also offers job placement assistance to students, providing guidance in areas such as mock interviews and resume preparation.

Name: Stanley College - West Perth
Overview:
Situated at Outram Street, Perth, WA 6005, Stanley College - West Perth is a privately owned institution that boasts multiple accolades. Recognized as an accredited higher education provider and a registered training organization, its curriculum focuses on various fields like art, science, engineering, law, etc. The primary goal of this esteemed institution is to deliver quality learning and training experience, thereby raising the academic standards of its students.

With its wide range of English language, undergraduate, postgraduate, vocational, professional, and industry-related courses, Stanley College caters to the needs of its diverse student population. Furthermore, with a strong emphasis on articulation pathways, students from faculties such as hospitality, early childhood education, and business are guided towards their desired career paths. The institution houses a team of 200 experienced and qualified faculty members, who collectively speak 18 different languages. With four dedicated campuses in Perth, Stanley College ensures that students receive top-notch education in various areas, including ELICOS, VET, HE, and PYP. The tuition fee for these programs ranges from (421,483- 534,351) INR, depending on the selected course. Boasting a diverse student community, Stanley College currently caters to over 1300 students, making it one of Australia's largest and most distinguished independent education providers.

The six faculties at Stanley College are the Faculty of Health, Culinary Arts, and Hospitality, the Faculty of Business, and more. With a focus on integrative learning, the college offers a robust curriculum that equips students with the necessary skills to thrive in today's competitive world. The institution maintains strong ties with reputable industries, ensuring that students receive ample opportunities to kickstart their career.

Apart from an exceptional academic experience, students also have access to a plethora of resources at the college library. Fostering personal growth and academic achievement
Eligibility Overview:
The following are the academic and English language proficiency requirements for admission to the desired courses at our university:

1. Age requirement: All applicants must be 18 years of age or older when they begin their course.

2. Academic qualification: A qualification equivalent to an Australian Diploma or higher, as evaluated by the Overseas Qualifications Unit (OQU) – Migration Services, Department of Training and Workforce Development (DTWD); OR completion of at least six months of continuous study, or its equivalent, from any Australian higher education institution.

3. English language proficiency: Applicants must submit proof of meeting the following requirements:

- An overseas equivalent qualification from a recognized Higher Education Provider (HEP) that meets the English language proficiency criteria set by the university.
- Completion of at least six months of continuous study, or an equivalent, from any Australian university or other recognized Higher Education Provider (HEP).
- A minimum score in an approved English language test such as IELTS, TOEFL, PTE, etc.
- English language proficiency requirements may vary depending on the program and level of study.

Name: Central Queensland University (CQU) - Gladstone
Overview:
Central Queensland University Gladstone is located across from the scenic Gladstone Marina parklands. The institution specializes in cutting-edge research and plays host to various industry partnership projects, conferences, and professional development programs. Central Queensland University Gladstone also boasts an impressive Engineering and Environmental Management Complex that is dedicated to research and training. This state-of-the-art facility serves as a residential school and conference venue, with exceptional resources including The Cyril Golding Library, bookshops, a computer lab, lecture theatre, and training facilities. The university also provides students with comprehensive career counselling and support services for their personal and professional growth.

The Gladstone area is renowned for its vibrant sporting community, offering various outdoor and indoor activities for students to engage in. From yachting and fishing to rowing, bowling, boxing, and BMX, students have a range of options to choose from to stay active and healthy. Additionally, students can establish their own teams or join the local teams to participate in different sports. The Campus Life Committee (CLC) at Central Queensland University Gladstone regularly organizes social activities for students, providing them with an excellent opportunity to connect with others and participate in fun-filled events.

On July 1st, 2014, Central Queensland University merged with CQ TAFE, making it a more comprehensive university. Today, the university offers over 300 options for education and training, including various certificate courses, diplomas, short courses, postgraduate, undergraduate, and research higher degrees. Graduates of Central Queensland University have consistently achieved high levels of success in their careers, as evidenced by data from the recent Graduate Outcomes Survey.
Eligibility Overview:
There are some requirements that international applicants must fulfil in order to secure admission to the various undergraduate and postgraduate programs offered by this university. These requirements pertain to the minimum academic performance as well as language proficiency.

Undergraduate Program
In order to be considered for admission to the undergraduate program, students from CBSE, ISC, West Bengal, and Maharashtra boards must have a minimum score of 55% in four academic subjects. For students from all other boards, a minimum score of 60% is required. 

Postgraduate Program
To be eligible for admission to a postgraduate program, international applicants must possess a bachelor's degree from a recognized institution that is equivalent to an Australian bachelor's degree. Additionally, their final two terms must have a minimum score equivalent to an Australian pass grade average. 

English Language Proficiency
International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in the English language by submitting their scores on recognized tests. These include exams such as IELTS, TOEFL, and PTE, among others. A minimum score corresponding to an Australian pass grade average is required to meet this requirement.

Accommodation:
Central Queensland University offers on-campus accommodation to its students, providing a conducive environment for learning while also recognizing and celebrating academic and personal achievements. The university has a range of options to cater to different needs, including affordable and brand new residences, some with ensuite facilities and others with shared bathrooms. Students can choose between self-catered and fully-catered options, though the latter is only available in Rockhampton. Accommodation can be arranged for the duration of a student's education, a semester, or for boarding purposes.

Students who prefer off-campus housing also have plenty of options to choose from. These include studio, three-bedroom, four-bedroom, and communal apartments, with a typical weekly rent of between 150 and 200 Australian dollars. Basic services such as electricity, water, and high-speed internet access are usually included in the rent. Most off-campus apartments are situated within 7 to 10 kilometers from Rockhampton.

With careful consideration, students can find the perfect accommodation to suit their budget and needs.

Name: University of Notre Dame Australia
Overview:
The University of Notre Dame Australia was established in 1989, as a nationally recognized Catholic institution with campuses in Western Australia and New South Wales. It boasts a student enrollment of 12,000, offering a diverse range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs across nine fields of study, such as education, health sciences, medicine, and physiotherapy. Popular courses include Human Resource Management, Business Administration, Philosophy, Bioethics, and Journalism. The university has three campuses: Fremantle, Sydney, and Broome. 

For students who do not meet the specified entrance requirements for the undergraduate program, the university offers the Tertiary Pathway Program, which combines VET study, Higher Education study, and recent secondary education, among other qualifications. Additionally, through the Early Offer Program, high school seniors can secure a place at the university before graduating. 

There are numerous academic, sports, and special interest clubs and societies available for students to engage in, such as Newspeak, NDA Labor, and Basketball Association. Furthermore, the university provides internal and external volunteer opportunities at events like Orientation Day, RUOK? Day, and Caritas Australia, as well as a variety of sports activities, including badminton, netball, and volleyball. 

On-campus accommodation is available at both Fremantle and Broome campuses, with options such as residential halls, including Port Lodge, P&O Hotel, and Cleopatra Hotel, or the Village, which offers a hostel and nine self-contained houses. 

Statistics show that Notre Dame graduates earn a median salary of AUD 83,311, while postgraduates earn an average salary of AUD 10,000. To help with the financial burden, the university offers various types of financial aid, such as the Bushfire Relief Scholarship, Student Hardship Assistance Fund, The Trophy Land Scholarship, and HECS-HELP loan options.

If an applicant has relevant work experience, they must provide documented evidence along with a completed enabling course to demonstrate their capability to pursue higher education in Australia. It is mandatory to meet the English language proficiency test requirements.

Placement:
The Majarlin Kimberley Centre for Remote Health operates from the Broome Campus of the University of Notre Dame Australia. The centre is dedicated to arranging placements for students in the fields of allied health and nursing. These placements are available throughout Broome and the wider Kimberley region.

Choosing to undertake a placement in the Kimberley offers a unique opportunity for students to gain academic, professional, social, and cultural experiences in one location. The centre's focus is on providing inter-professional education to its students, making it an enriching learning experience. Majarlin offers a diverse range of placement options including placements in hospitals, private practices, NDIS providers, community health, community organizations like Anglicare and Life Without Barriers, health organizations such as Milliya Rumurra Aboriginal Corporation and Boab Health, aged care facilities, visits to remote communities, and volunteering opportunities at community events like the Garnduwa football carnival and NAIDOC week.

To ease the transition for students, the centre provides numerous services including organizing and facilitating clinical placements, a one-day cultural and orientation program, clinical educator support throughout the placement, evaluation, social support, and networking opportunities. Majarlin also offers exercises for reflection and debriefing, interdisciplinary education, pastoral assistance, internet access, and suggestions for ways to explore the region during weekends, such as cycling. Domestic students are eligible for subsidies for travel and accommodation, making it an affordable option for those interested in undertaking placements in the Kimberley.

Name: Coder Academy - Melbourne
Overview:
Coder Academy, located in three major cities across Australia with one in Melbourne, offers an extensive range of online tutorials, part-time courses, bootcamps, workshops, and programs for school students to acquire the necessary coding and technology skills for their future endeavors. As the only accredited coding bootcamp in the country, Coder Academy guarantees high-quality courses with a particular focus on intensive learning. In fact, their courses are specifically designed to compress two-year degree programs into 6-10 months without compromising the learning outcomes.

The collection of courses offered at Coder Academy includes an Undergraduate Certificate in Data Analysis, Web Development Bootcamp (Standard), Code, Cloud & Cyber Bootcamp, Web Development Bootcamp (Accelerated), and an Undergraduate Certificate in Programming. Among these courses, two are delivered in varying durations, with the Standard Web Development Bootcamp taking 10 months to complete and the Accelerated Bootcamp taking 6 months. The groundbreaking Code, Cloud & Cyber Bootcamp is the first-ever of its kind in Australia and provides the opportunity for students to obtain a higher Diploma of Information Technology, as well as sit for the AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner Exam.

Managed and approved by the CRICOS, Coder Academy's bootcamp courses have undergone rigorous quality checks. Additionally, their Undergraduate Certificate courses in Programming and Data Analysis possess accreditation from the Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency (TEQSA), with course content derived from an existing higher education qualification. This guarantees the effortless transition of students to the AQF level 5, 6, or 7 qualification after completion of the certificate course. And as for job placements, Coder Academy boasts an impressive track record, with over 50% of graduates securing employment through industry placements, and 80% receiving job offers within three months. With a one-month optional industry placement opportunity, students can expect to enter the workforce confidently equipped with the necessary skills and knowledge.

Name: Australian National University
Overview: Australian National University, located in the capital city of Canberra, is a prestigious educational institution established in 1946. It provides a diverse range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and professional development courses through its seven colleges, which consist of various schools and research centers. Some of the subjects covered by these programs include Business & Commerce, Law & Legal Studies, Arts, Society & Culture, Energy Change, Robotics, Human Rights, Linguistics, and Legal Practice. The university's research-oriented courses focus on crucial areas like Biodiversity, Food Security, International Studies, and Space Sciences. ANU has three main campuses - Acton, Kioloa Coastal, and North Australia Research Unit, along with the Siding Spring Observatory and Mount Stromlo Observatory. In addition, it has six extensive library branches, including the Art & Music Library, Hancock Library, and Menzies Library. ANU offers flexible degree options such as Flexible Double Degrees, Vertical Double Degrees, and Flexible Double Master Degrees, giving students the freedom to design their own study programs. It also welcomes international students from partner and non-partner universities through its Exchange and Study Abroad program. The university also provides several online degree programs and certificate/diploma courses for students' convenience. ANU offers financial aid to students in the form of scholarships, loans, bursaries, and awards, such as FEE-HELP, DFAT Australia Awards, ACTION Trust Honours Scholarship, and CanHELP. The university also offers various residential options, including catered and self-catered facilities like Burgmann College, Fenner Hall, University House, and Warrumbul Lodge. These options range from single/double rooms to studios and apartments, all equipped with dining services. ANU has a thriving student community, with over 130 clubs and societies that organize academic, cultural, social, and political events. ANU Sport comprises 35 clubs for various sports such as basketball, cycling, and quidditch, along with fitness services like gyms, fitness studios, and sports courts/fields. According to placement records, ANU graduates earn an average gross annual salary of AUD 59,000, while postgraduates earn AUD 82,330.
Eligibility Overview:
International applicants seeking admission to ANU must possess a minimum GPA of 5.0, achieve a score of at least 6.5 on the IELTS exam, and be able to demonstrate 3 to 5 years of work experience. It is highly recommended for students to submit a statement of purpose to enhance their chances of acceptance.

To be eligible for a study abroad program at one of ANU's exchange partners in the United States, students are required to have a minimum GPA of 6.0. This translates to a student consistently earning Distinctions and High Distinctions.

Name: Kaplan Business School - Melbourne
Overview:
Kaplan Business School has been operating since 2008 under the guidance of Stanley Kaplan. The institution was established in 1938 as a tutoring center in London and was later accredited in 2008. It has since evolved into a prestigious business school with three branches. Kaplan Business School Melbourne is a student-friendly campus equipped with state-of-the-art infrastructure and amenities. The school offers undergraduate and postgraduate programs, including diplomas and bachelor's degrees in fields such as business administration, business analytics, accounting, data-driven leadership, tourism, and hospitality. Most programs require an IELTS score of 5.5. 

The tuition fee at Kaplan Business School Melbourne is AUD 18,992, with an additional cost of living of AUD 20,290. The application fee ranges from AUD 260 to AUD 285. The school provides scholarships and internships to assist students with their financial needs. It is highly recognized for its large alumni community of over 300,000 graduates, many of whom are employed in top companies. Kaplan Business School has a strong network with various corporations and industry leaders, providing students with opportunities for internships, training, and job placement. Some notable corporate partners include Swans and Davidsons, among others. With its strong focus on student success and established connections with industry leaders, Kaplan Business School remains one of the leading institutions in Australia.
Eligibility Overview:
The following information provides details about academic requirements for admissions to a university in India. These requirements include the completion of specific courses and achieving certain average grades. It is important to note that the requirements may vary depending on the type of program a student is applying for. The academic requirements for different levels of education are as follows:

1. High School Certificate Equivalent Requirements:
- Completion of Indian Higher Secondary School Certificate (State Boards) with a minimum overall average of 55% in four core subjects.
- Completion of CBSE All India School Certificate (CBSE) with a minimum overall average of 55% in four core subjects.
- Completion of Indian School Certificate (ISC) with a minimum average of 55% in four core subjects.

2. Bachelor's Degree Equivalent Requirements:
- Completion of Indian Higher Secondary School Certificate (State Boards) with a minimum overall average of 60% in four core subjects.
- Successful completion of CBSE All India School Certificate with a minimum overall average of 60% in four core subjects.
- Completion of Indian School Certificate (ISC) with a minimum average of 60% in four core subjects.

3. Postgraduate Certificate and Diploma Requirements:
- Completion of an Advanced Diploma/Associate Degree (or equivalent at AQF level 6) and a Postgraduate Qualifying Program (or equivalent).
- Completion of a Diploma (or equivalent at AQF level 5) and a minimum of two years of relevant industry experience. This should be accompanied by completion of a Postgraduate Qualifying Program (or equivalent).

4. Master's Degree Requirements:
- Completion of a Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent at AQF level 7).
- Completion of an Advanced Diploma/Associate Degree (or equivalent at AQF level 6) and a minimum of two years of relevant industry experience

Name: Central Queensland University (CQU) - Adelaide
Overview: Central Queensland University (CQU) Adelaide campus is situated towards the southwest of the city, in close proximity to the Adelaide Showgrounds. Public transportation options are readily available to students from this location. Along with the campus in Adelaide, students can also benefit from online support provided by partner Regional University Centres located in Murray River, Port Augusta, Port Pirie, and Berri. CQU Adelaide now offers courses in paramedical science, occupational health and safety, and psychology on campus, ensuring smaller class sizes and a more interactive and personalized learning experience. This also allows students to establish strong connections with fellow peers and faculty members. Study options available at Central Queensland University cover a wide array of areas including Allied Health, Law, Criminology and Justice, Digital Media, Communication and Arts, Business and Accounting, Safety Services, and Service Industries. There are multiple study levels to choose from, such as undergraduate, postgraduate, research, certificates, and diplomas. The campus also houses The Appleton Institute, a multidisciplinary research hub that specializes in human factors and safety management, human-animal interaction, sleep and fatigue, safety science, applied psychology, and cultural anthropology. Students can apply for various scholarships, including Destination Australia Scholarship (Bachelor), CQUniCares Adam Scott Foundation Western Australia Scholarship, Indigenous Laptop Bundle Bursary, Research Training Program (RTP) Stipend Scholarship, CQUniCares Adam Scott Foundation Scholarship, and CQUniCares Industry Placement Scholarship, to support their academic journey.
Eligibility Overview:
The following information pertains to the undergraduate and postgraduate admissions for our university.

Undergraduate Programme Admissions: 

- Diploma: Equivalent to an AQF Certificate IV or high school level in Australia. Students from India should have a minimum of 55% in four academic courses for CBSE, ISC, West Bengal, and Maharashtra boards, while other boards require a minimum of 60%.
- Bachelors: Equivalent to high school level in Australia. Students from India should have a minimum of 60% in four academic courses for CBSE, ISC, West Bengal, and Maharashtra boards, while other boards require a minimum of 65%.

Postgraduate Coursework Admissions: 

International applicants must hold a bachelor's degree from a recognized institution, with a minimum score equivalent to an Australian pass grade average in the final two terms. The length of the bachelor's degree must be similar to an Australian bachelor's degree.

We believe in providing equal opportunities to all students and consider the absolute academic performance of each individual during the admission process. No discrimination or bias is made against any country or educational board.
Placement:
The university offers students various opportunities for career and leadership development, enabling them to grow both personally and professionally. Valuable skills training seminars and sessions are provided, equipping students with essential knowledge and competencies for the job market. They are taught effective techniques for writing impressive CVs and cover letters, effective management skills, work ethics, and other relevant topics. Regular career fairs, seminars, and workshops are conducted to help students connect with industry experts and secure employment opportunities in Australia and beyond.

Through its Career Cell, the university brings together employers and graduates to facilitate job placements. Yearly career fairs are organized by the university to aid students in exploring various employment possibilities.

A dedicated Career Hub website is available, featuring a comprehensive list of job openings in different organizations.

Boasting a domestic graduate employment rate of 79.5%, the university surpasses the sector average of 72.3%.
Accommodation: Central Queensland University offers on-campus and off-campus accommodation for students. This provides a beneficial learning environment that promotes academic and personal achievement. There are a variety of options available to cater to diverse needs, including affordable and brand new housing with either ensuite or shared bathrooms, self-catered or fully-catered options (only in Rockhampton). Students can choose to stay for the entirety of their education, a semester, or boarding schools. Information on on-campus housing can be found on the university website, while off-campus housing includes studio, three-bedroom, four-bedroom, and communal apartments. Rent typically ranges between 150 and 200 Australian dollars per week, and utilities such as power, water, and internet are included in the fees. Most off-campus apartments are within a 7-10 kilometer radius of Rockhampton. Online resources such as Flatmates and Walkscore can assist students in finding suitable off-campus housing options.

Name: University of Wollongong - Australia
Overview:
Located in New South Wales, Australia, the University of Wollongong was founded in 1975 as a public research university. It boasts a diverse student body of 35,969 and a faculty of 1,094, divided into four faculties and multiple schools. The University offers a comprehensive selection of undergraduate, postgraduate, and research programs covering 18 subject areas, including Information Technology, Health Analytics, Exercise Science, French, and International Studies. With a main campus in Wollongong and a campus in Sydney, along with several regional campuses, students have access to exemplary academic opportunities.

The University of Wollongong boasts eight libraries across its metropolitan and regional campuses, offering a vast array of resources, including books, journals, articles, collections, and online publications. To prepare students for university life, the University offers Pathways Programs like UOW College and the Indigenous Admissions Program. Moreover, students can earn academic credit through the university's SMART program, allowing them to engage with professors and expand their knowledge base.

Through study abroad and exchange programs, students can experience different cultures and pursue their education overseas while still enrolled at the University. Additionally, students can receive financial aid through various options such as UOW Equity Scholarships, Tertiary Access Payment, HELP loans, Austudy, and Youth Allowance.

The University of Wollongong offers a variety of accommodation options, including on-campus and off-campus options. For on-campus housing, students can choose from residences such as Kooloobong Village, Bangalay, Marketview, and Graduate House. Off-campus housing options include private rentals, shared accommodations, and short-stay facilities.

The University of Wollongong provides a rich campus life, with numerous cultural, artistic, political, volunteer, and academic clubs to join. Additionally, students can engage in various sports activities, such as badminton, volleyball, and netball. Postgraduates from the University of Wollongong are distinguished for earning a median starting salary of AUD 90,000, making it an excellent choice for advancing one's career.
Eligibility Overview:
The minimum educational requirement for admission to this university is a full-time study of more than 12 years from an accredited board or institution. A high school diploma or equivalent with a minimum grade of 80% is necessary for consideration. Proficiency in the English language is also a requirement. The submission of JEE scores is not mandatory. 

English Language Proficiency Requirements
The university requires a rigorous academic background of at least 12 years from a recognized board or institution. To be considered, a minimum of 80% grade in high school is necessary. Fluency in English is also a key requirement. There is no need to submit JEE scores.

Name: Charles Sturt University - Sydney Campus
Overview:
Charles Sturt University (CSU) is a renowned public multi-campus university based in New South Wales, Australia. It was established in the year 1989.
The CSU Study Centers in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, and Wangaratta are a collaborative effort between Charles Sturt University and Study Group to provide a wide range of educational opportunities to international students from over 120 countries. The courses offered include undergraduate and postgraduate programs. Students can also opt for the Distance Education or the Single Subject Study program. 
The Distance Education program caters to students who cannot physically attend the university and relies on written or electronic communication for interaction between lecturers and students. These programs are designed for working professionals who are already employed in their field of study. 
Situated in the heart of Sydney's bustling Central Business District (CBD), the Charles Sturt University Study Centers are in close proximity to shopping centers, restaurants, and excellent public transportation options in Darlinghurst. Students have the option to choose from a variety of postgraduate and undergraduate courses, all of which feature state-of-the-art classrooms equipped with necessary facilities and study materials for academic success. Charles Sturt University awards scholarships and grants exceeding $3 million every year to deserving students.
Eligibility Overview:
Minimum educational criteria to be eligible for admission to a university in India includes completing the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) or any state board recognized Senior School Certificates with a minimum of 60% overall in all four academic subjects. This includes the All India Senior School Certificate from the CBSE and other state boards such as Higher Secondary Certificate Examination, Higher Secondary Examination, Higher Secondary Part-II Examination, Higher Secondary School Certificate Examination, Higher Secondary School Leaving Certificate Examination, Intermediate Examination, Intermediate Public Examination, Second Year Pre-University Examination, and Senior Secondary (12th Class) Examination.

For international students, a diploma earned with an International Baccalaureate score of 24 or higher, completion of two GCE A2 Levels with at least two Ds, or a Pre-University Certificate pass in the first division are all acceptable alternatives to the Indian educational criteria.

In addition to the educational requirements, all applicants must have a strong proficiency in English. This may be demonstrated through a minimum total score of 24 in the International Baccalaureate, completion of two GCE A2 Levels with at least two Ds or equivalent, or a Pre-University Certificate pass in the first division. Essentially, applicants must be able to demonstrate a satisfactory level of English proficiency in order to be considered for admission to a university in India.

Name: Acknowledge Creativity - Sydney
Overview: Acknowledge Creativity - Sydney was founded on the belief that fostering creative skills and innovative thinking could drive changes in the corporate world. With three campuses in Australia, this institute focuses on nurturing and shaping the entrepreneurial instincts of its students. Located in Sydney, one of the fastest-growing business hubs, the institute offers diploma, graduate, and unit programs. The course curriculum is designed strategically, and the staff employs advanced tools, training modules, and practical programs to ensure each student receives a comprehensive education. Through an amalgamation of arts, commerce, and business, the institute aims to develop future entrepreneurs. The three-year graduation program and the eight-unit diploma course cover subjects such as marketing, PR, sales, budgeting, risk management, cultural communications, finance, and management. Domestic students have the option to pursue single units, whereas international students are required to complete all eight units for the diploma. The Acknowledge Creativity - Sydney fee for domestic students is $2,250 per unit, while the average cost of living ranges between $21,000 and $22,000 per year. International students will have to pay an amount ranging from $2,250 to $10,000 per unit, depending on the program they choose. Eligible students have the option to apply for a loan through FEE-HELP, which helps them to cover their tuition fees. Each subject has a maximum loan limit, which is equivalent to the tuition fees. The aim of the program and evaluation modules is to equip students with the skills to develop and implement creative and viable business plans. The institute offers a blend of traditional and contemporary teaching methods, giving students the opportunity to hone their problem-solving abilities collaboratively and creatively.

Name: Murdoch University - Mandurah
Overview: Founded in 1976, Murdoch University is a government-owned academic institution, with campuses across the globe in Perth, Rockingham, Singapore, Dubai, Myanmar, and Mandurah. Located just 45 minutes away from Perth, the Mandurah campus focuses on specialized subjects, such as Nursing, postgraduate Counselling - Creative Arts Therapies, while offering a diverse range of 270+ courses in fields ranging from Accounting to Animal Health and Animal Science. Open Universities Australia, Innovative Research Universities, and Universities Australia are some of the prominent affiliations that Murdoch holds. The Mandurah campus is fortified with state-of-the-art facilities including a video communication room with 80 seats, a multipurpose laboratory, and three 30-seat teaching rooms, all equipped with advanced audio and video conferencing technology. Ensuring the holistic well-being of its students, the University also provides comprehensive counseling services, prioritizing their physical and mental health. Candidates looking for direct admission into undergraduate programs can enroll in the 14-week OnTrack program, specifically designed to make them eligible for the same. With a strong research output, Murdoch University is also the recipient of Murdoch scholarships, International Accommodation Scholarship, and other such accolades. On-campus, the University offers a 90% student satisfaction rate as per the International Student Barometer. For individuals with busy professional schedules, Murdoch offers a range of free, online short courses through FutureLearn. Students can access the "my Murdoch Career" portal for various opportunities, from job listings to networking events, to assist in their pursuit of employment.

Name: Imagine Education Australia - Main Campus
Overview:
Imagine Education Australia is a private English language center and Vocational Education and Training Centre, situated on the beautiful Gold Coast. The main campus, located only five minutes from Southport Central Business District and ten minutes from Surfers Paradise, boasts state-of-the-art facilities and a serene environment nestled in native bushland. It's conveniently located near a major shopping center that houses essential amenities like a post office, medical facilities, chemist, supermarkets, and specialty stores. The Gold Coast also offers world-renowned beaches and internationally renowned surfing, making it a top destination for international students.

The main campus is home to several faculties, including Business, Finance, and Childcare, as well as the High School Preparation and Young Learner English Program. Additionally, our Gold Coast campus features three live training environments for students to gain valuable hands-on experience in the Faculty of Automotive, Faculty of Children's Care, and Faculty of Hospitality. Our main campus is outfitted with ten classrooms, all equipped with modern furnishings and advanced teaching facilities. Recently, a brand new on-site commercial kitchen was inaugurated in March 2021 for students in our hospitality programs. Our Children's Services students have the added advantage of an on-site childcare center for practical training.

Services offered at the Main Campus include purpose-built classrooms, a well-stocked commercial kitchen, computer labs with wi-fi connectivity, a student kitchen and common areas, and an outdoor deck for students to relax and socialize. There's also convenient access to public transportation, shopping complex, supermarkets, healthcare facilities, banks, and dining options.

REQUIREMENTS FOR ADMISSION
Courses leading to a diploma or advanced degree:
In order to successfully complete diploma level courses, students must meet the following criteria - be at least 15 years of age and possess reading, writing, and comprehension abilities comparable to a Year 10 pass level.

A score of 5.5 or higher on the IELTS (with no individual band lower than 5.0)

TOEFL i-BT score of 65-78 (as determined by Imagine Education Australia)
Successful completion of Upper Intermediate level General English may also be accepted.

Name: Front Cooking School - Brisbane Campus
Overview:
Front Cooking School is an esteemed educational institution in Australia that offers a wide range of programs, including certificates, diplomas, and advanced diplomas, in the field of Cookery, Patisserie, and Hospitality Management. Emphasizing a balance between theory and practice, the school boasts fully equipped kitchens and ovens for individual hands-on learning. Additionally, students have access to 24/7 Wi-Fi, changing rooms, lockers, break rooms, and a resource library. It is worth noting that the school does not offer scholarships or financial aid to international students.

Situated on the beautiful banks of the Brisbane River, the school is conveniently accessible by bus, car, or plane, with the nearest airport, Brisbane Airport, just 15 minutes away. Students at this campus also have the advantage of being in close proximity to Brisbane's Central Business District, providing opportunities for networking and future career prospects. In conclusion, Front Cooking School is a highly sought-after destination for students seeking an exceptional educational experience in the culinary and hospitality fields.
