Name: Federation University - Gippsland
Overview:
Located in the township of Churchill, nestled in the foothills of the Strzelecki Ranges, lies the Gippsland Campus of Federation University. Strategically positioned near whitewater rivers, Victoria's Mount Baw Baw ski resort, and coastal parks such as Gippsland Lakes and Wilson's Promontory, it is an ideal hub for nature enthusiasts. The journey from Melbourne to reach this campus is approximately two hours by car or an estimated 90 minutes on a high-speed train.

Federation University's Gippsland campus boasts a diverse range of schools, including the renowned Federation Business School, School of Arts, School of Education, School of Engineering, Information Technology and Physical Sciences, School of Health, School of Science, Psychology, and Sport. Along with that, the campus is home to several centers, such as the Centre for Gippsland Studies, the Hexagon Theatre, the Gippsland Centre for Arts and Design, and the Gippsland Enterprise Centre, to name a few.

Known as the leading educational institute in regional Victoria, Federation University takes pride in its top-notch student support services. It has earned the No. 1 ranking for its exceptional student support programs. The campus offers a variety of programs, including a Bachelor of Education Studies in Early Childhood and Primary education, a Bachelor of Outdoor and Environmental Education, a Graduate Diploma of Education Studies, and a Master of Education Studies, among others. Moreover, the university offers various modes of study, including online learning, distance learning, block mode, and flexible delivery, catering to the varying needs of its students.

Federation University also offers several scholarship, grant, and bursary options to its students. Available scholarships include opportunities for rural students, early childhood educators, and many more. With its commitment to providing quality education and extensive resources, Federation University's Gippsland campus is an ideal choice for students seeking a well-rounded academic experience.
Eligibility Overview:
The qualification necessities for each of the courses offered by the university are as follows:
1. Minimum age requirement: Applicants must be at least 18 years of age by the date of the Commencement of Enrolment (CoE).
2. International applicants from non-English speaking countries must meet the English proficiency requirements.
For undergraduate (UG) students:
3. Academic eligibility: Candidates must have passed their secondary education with a minimum required grade point average (CGPA) or equivalent.
For postgraduate (PG) students:
4. Academic eligibility: Candidates must hold an Australian bachelor's degree or its international equivalent with a minimum stipulated CGPA or grades.
5. Other requirements: For non-research-based postgraduate studies like MBA, relevant work experience may also be necessary. Additionally, a first-class degree and an overall IELTS score of 6.0 (with no band score lower than 6.0) is essential for admission.

Name: Mercury Colleges - Hurstville
Overview: Mercury College Hurstville was founded in the year 1960 and offers an array of courses focused on Business, English, Aged care, Leadership and Management, Project Management, and Marketing. The campus is conveniently located near the Hurstville railway station, only a 2-minute walk away, and a 20-minute walk from Sydney Central Railway Station. International and domestic students can choose from a wide range of courses at Mercury College. Business programs include Certificates III and IV courses, and English courses consist of English for Academic Purposes, General English, and IELTS preparation. Along with this, students can enroll in Advanced Diploma of Leadership and Management and Diploma of Leadership and Management for their Leadership and Management studies. Project Management programs offered are Certificate IV courses in Project Management Practice and a Diploma of Project Management. Additionally, Mercury College provides courses such as Advanced Diploma of Marketing and Communication, Certificate IV in Marketing and Communication, and Diploma of Marketing and Communication. In the field of Ageing Support and Community Services, students can opt for Certificate III in Individual Support, Certificate IV in Ageing Support, and Diploma of Community Services. The student body at Mercury College Hurstville represents various countries of the world, including Italy, Spain, Czech Republic, Greece, Slovakia, Lithuania, Hungary, Poland, Estonia, Russia, Belarus, Ukraine, Indonesia, Philippines, Korea, Taiwan, Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, Japan, India, Bangladesh, Nepal, Pakistan, Jordan, Columbia, Venezuela, Brazil, Mexico, Peru, Chile, and Argentina. The fee structure of Mercury College Hurstville varies per course, with a minimum of $3,480 and a maximum of $20,000. Students can access Mercury College online through Office 365 and Moodle. Moreover, completion of Mercury EAP fulfills the English requirement for Torrens University.
Eligibility Overview:
This information pertains to the Advanced Diploma in Leadership and Management (BSB60420) program offered by a university. Non-Australian students must be at least 18 years old and must provide evidence that they meet the following academic and English language prerequisites in order to enroll:

- In-class requirements: Completion of Year 12 or an equivalent and/or higher academic qualification.

- English language requirements: A minimum score of 5.5 on the IELTS exam or an equivalent level of proficiency.

Any qualification from the Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) that is taught and evaluated solely in English at the Certificate III level or above, regardless of the discipline, may satisfy both the academic and English language admission criteria.

Name: Flinders University
Overview:
Flinders University, located in Adelaide, Australia, was founded in 1966 and is a publicly funded educational institution with three main campuses: Victoria Square, Bedford Park, and Tonsley. The university boasts an impressive enrollment of over 26,000 students and employs a staff of 2,300. Across its six colleges, the university offers an expansive selection of over 500 undergraduate, research, and graduate programs in 17 study areas, including Science and Engineering, Medicine and Public Health, Business, and Law. Some of the unique programs offered at Flinders University include Disability and Development Education, Paramedic Science, Theological Studies, and Aquatic Biology. Its highly rated library system is comprised of five branches, including the Central Library, Sturt Library, URRSA, The Adelaide Theological Library, and Gus Fraenkel Medical Library. 
In addition to its wide range of academic offerings, Flinders University provides various pathways and preparatory programs to assist high school students in gaining admission. These include uniTest, Research Project B pathway, and the School Recommendation Program. For undergraduate students looking for a more customizable educational experience, Flinders University offers a variety of Honours degree courses that allow for a focused specialization within a chosen undergraduate program. 
For those seeking a more flexible educational experience, Flinders University also offers a variety of online undergraduate, graduate, and research programs in disciplines such as Business, Information Technology, and Environmental Health. Furthermore, students can take advantage of the university's extensive network of over 100 partner institutions worldwide and participate in semester exchange programs or short-term study abroad programs in countries such as Norway, Canada, and Japan.
Flinders University provides on-campus housing for approximately 550 students in Deirdre Jordan Village and University Hall. These accommodations offer single or double rooms, as well as 2-3 bedroom units and dining services. In addition, the university also provides short-term accommodations for those in need, both on and off-campus. 
The Flinders University Student Association manages a variety of clubs and societies, including the Bahai Society, Critical Care Society, and Friendship International. For students interested in sports, there are over 23 sports clubs, including baseball, lacrosse, volleyball, and soccer. The university also offers a range of fitness facilities, such as the Weights Room, Ladies Only Gym, Cardio & Functional Training Room, and Strength & Conditioning Room. Graduates of Flinders University's Business and Management programs have reported a median salary of AUD 102,000, making it a highly sought-after

To be considered for admission, students must meet specific criteria, including having a minimum of 65% average in the best four subjects for a CBSE School certificate or a minimum of 70% average in the best four subjects for an ISC School certificate. Placement:
The university offers various options for healthcare students seeking unique placement opportunities in the Northern Territory. These placements are available in a wide range of locations, including rural desert towns and the diverse cities of Darwin and Alice Springs. Students have the opportunity to learn and get involved in their communities, promoting the overall well-being of the population. Flinders NT supports and encourages students to embrace these experiences and make the most of their learning opportunities. 

Flinders NT arranges internships for medical students at the Royal Darwin Hospital and the Alice Springs Hospital. These placements are open to students in their penultimate or final year of a medical degree and require a minimum of four or eight weeks. However, placement availability and clearance must be taken into consideration. 

Placements in Darwin are subject to availability and formal clearance and can potentially be found in departments such as Anesthesia & Perioperative, Cardiology, Communicable Disease Control, Ear, Nose & Throat, Emergency, Endocrinology & Diabetes, General Medicine, Geriatrics, Hematology/Medical Oncology, Immunology/Rheumatology, Intensive Care Unit, Maxillofacial Surgery, Ophthalmology, Orthopedic Surgery, Palliative Care, Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery, Rehabilitation, Renal Medicine, and Respiratory Medicine. 

Meanwhile, placements in Alice Springs are open to domestic students only and require formal approval in addition to availability. Potential departments include Anesthesia, Emergency Medicine, General Medicine, General Surgery, Obstetrics & Gynecologic, Ophthalmology, Orthopedic Surgery, Pediatric, Psychiatry, and Renal Medicine. 

Before starting a placement in the NT, it is essential to obtain clearance to work with children (Ochre Card). This process can take up to eight weeks, so it is recommended to apply at least that much in advance. If the card has not been received by then, it is advised to follow up with Safe NT until a response is received. Please note that online applications for the Ochre Card are not accepted for international students; instead, a paper application must be completed and mailed. 

The teaching hospital affiliated with Flinders Medical Centre can accommodate a limited number of visiting final-year medical students for clinical electives. These electives can be completed for a minimum of four weeks and a maximum of eight weeks. 

The Remote and Rural Interprofessional Placement Learning NT (RIPPL NT) team provides support and assistance for allied health and nursing students, their universities, and clinical supervisors to optimize their clinical placements in the Northern Territory. All students enrolled in health-related courses are welcome to take advantage of these services.
Accommodation:
This university provides on-campus and off-campus accommodation options for students. Living on campus at Flinders Living is a secure, cost-effective, and convenient choice. You will be a part of a diverse community of students from all over Australia and more than 30 countries if you choose to reside on campus. Some reasons to consider living on campus at Flinders University are the inclusion of diversity in living and learning environments, easy access to classes on both Bedford Park and Sturt campuses on foot, and convenient access to public transportation. Other perks include a free membership to the Flinders Sport and Fitness facilities, as well as easy access to music venues, libraries, and computer labs. Safety is also a priority for the campus, with 24/7 access to university security and support services for student welfare. Moreover, the cost of living on campus is affordable, and utilities and Wi-Fi are included in the package.

Flinders University offers two options for on-campus accommodation, including University Hall and Deirdre Jordan Village. University Hall provides single, fully-furnished rooms for over 200 students. The rooms come with secure storage and parking, as well as shared kitchens. The hall also features common areas, play areas, pavilions, and gardens where students can socialize with one another. On the other hand, Deirdre Jordan Village houses more than 350 students in self-catered, fully-furnished flats. The village boasts amenities such as parking, lockable storage, BBQ areas, and landscaped gardens. Additionally, the Community Center at the village organizes cultural activities to foster a strong sense of community among students.

If you prefer living off-campus, Flinders University's location and excellent transportation options make it easy to find suitable and affordable housing. However, the university advises against signing rental contracts before physically inspecting the property upon arrival in Australia. The most common neighbourhoods for students to reside in off-campus are Bedford Park, Clovelly Park, Edwardstown, Melrose Park, St. Marys, Mitchell Park, Flagstaff Hill, Panorama, Pasadena, and Sturt. These neighbourhoods are well-connected to the Bedford Park campus by public transportation. In addition, areas like Mile End, Plympton, Cumberland Park, Goodwood, and Camden Park, located between Bedford Park and the Victoria Square campus, also offer rental housing options. Flinders Living maintains a free website listing private rental properties in these areas and can also provide assistance on tenancy rights and obligations.

To summarize, Flinders University's accommodation options include secure, cost-effective, and convenient living arrangements both on and off-campus. These facilities aim to provide students with a diverse and inclusive living and learning experience, easy access to campus facilities, and a strong sense of community. Housing options are also available in both nearby and intermediate neighbourhoods, and students can get assistance from Flinders Living to find suitable off-campus living arrangements.

Name: Southern Cross University - Sydney Campus
Overview:
Founded in 1994, Southern Cross University (SCU) is a premier Australian public university ranked among the top 100 young universities globally. The university has campuses at Lismore, Coffs Harbour, and Gold Coast, and boasts the National Marine Science Centre, The Hotel School Sydney, and The Hotel School Melbourne. With six schools, two colleges, and nine research centers, SCU offers a diverse range of 83 undergraduate programs, 80 graduate programs, and 20 other courses, including full-time, part-time, and online options. Popular areas of study include Arts, Nursing, Midwifery, Psychology, Speech Pathology, Education, Information Technology, Law, Tourism, Business and Management, Social Sciences, Economics, and Clinical and Preclinical Health.
International applicants can apply online or through an agent for admission, which takes place thrice a year. The minimum requirement for undergraduate programs is an overall IELTS score of 6.0, while postgraduate programs require an overall score of 6.5, in addition to previous academic records and transcripts. Scores from TOFEL and PTE are also considered, with varying cut-offs depending on the program.
On-campus accommodation is available at SCU's residential colleges, including SCU Village Lismore and Coffs Harbour, offering modern and fully furnished rooms with amenities such as kitchen, lounge, dining area, and library.
The average tuition fees range from 26,800 AUD to 32,000 AUD, depending on the chosen area of study. International students can also benefit from various scholarships offered by SCU, including the Destination Australia Scholarship worth 15,000 AUD, as well as the International Advancement Scholarship, Dr. Allan Phan Scholarship, and Nathan Asher Student Experience Scholarship, all worth 5000 AUD.
With a high employment rate, 75% for undergraduates and 87% for postgraduates, SCU graduates can expect a promising career ahead. On average, undergraduates earn 80,506 AUD, while postgraduates earn 1,10,600 AUD.
Eligibility Overview:
Southern Cross University offers a wide range of undergraduate programmes, including over 90 degree programmes, as well as associate degrees and diplomas. The admission requirements for undergraduate programmes are calculated using the indicative ATAR score, which varies depending on the degree. A minimum ATAR score of 60 is required for popular programmes in fields such as Arts, Science and Environment, Education, Social Sciences, and Community Welfare. However, for programmes in Engineering and Law, the prerequisites are slightly higher, ranging from 70 to 80.

To be eligible for undergraduate programmes, applicants must fulfill the following criteria:

- Submit high school transcripts
- Provide proof of English language proficiency
- Meet the required ATAR score (usually between 45-85)
- Submit references from professors and employers
- Apply for advanced standing if applicable

Southern Cross University offers nearly 50 graduate programmes in various fields, including master's degrees, diplomas, and graduate certifications. Some of the most sought-after programmes include Master of Business Administration, Master of Teaching, Master of Social Work, and Graduate Certificate in Regenerative Agriculture. Admission requirements for graduate programmes differ depending on the programme.

The general criteria for admission to all graduate programmes are:

- Completion of an online application
- Submission of transcripts from previous colleges and universities
- A bachelor's degree in a related field
- Demonstration of English language proficiency
- A personal statement or mission statement
- Relevant work experience.
Placement: Southern Cross University offers exceptional support to its students right from the beginning of their courses. The university's dedicated career and employability team organizes a range of skill development workshops and events, along with providing opportunities for internships and industrial tours. To assist students in advancing their careers in Australia, SCU also offers assistance with resume building and interview preparation. In recognition of its efforts, SCU has received a 5-star rating for graduate employability in the Good University Guide 2021.

Name: University of South Australia
Overview:
The University of South Australia (UniSA) is a renowned public research institution that was founded in South Australia in 1856. It boasts a large student enrollment of over 35,000 and employs a dedicated team of more than 2,800 staff members. With a vast selection of undergraduate, postgraduate, and research courses spanning across 35+ study areas, UniSA has established itself as a leading university in Australia. The university has six main campuses - City West, Magill, Mawson Lakes, City East, Mt Gambier, and Whyalla - along with numerous research centers and institutes.

Students at UniSA can pursue diverse courses such as Film and Television, Construction Management, Architecture, and Cybersecurity. For those seeking a flexible study option, UniSA Online offers more than 70 online degrees in fields such as business, criminal justice, and public health. In addition, the university also offers over 250 10-week single courses, providing students with a wide range of study options online. To encourage students' skill development, UniSA offers short courses in areas such as Mathematics, Social Media Management, and Pain Sciences, some of which are government-subsidized.

UniSA also provides opportunities for international exposure through its study abroad program, where students can study at one of its partner institutions, as well as participate in overseas study tours, exchanges, and placements. On completion of their degree, UniSA graduates earn a median salary of AUD 62,600.

To support students in their academic pursuits, UniSA offers various scholarships, including the Asian Experience Travel Grant, Ehrenberg Scholarship, US Federal Student Loan, and Laity Morrow Scholarship.

For accommodation, students can choose from a variety of options offered by the university, including student hostels, residential colleges, student apartments, homestays, and private rentals such as StudentRooms, Alexandra Lodge, Lincoln College, Atira, and Urbanest. The university also has a rich student life, with over 100 academic, sports, and cultural clubs and societies for students to join, such as the Beer Club and ECC Alliance.
Eligibility Overview: At UniSA, students applying from overseas must have completed the Senior Secondary Certificate (10+2) with a minimum average of 60% in their top four subjects. Additionally, they must have an overall IELTS score of 6.5 to demonstrate their proficiency in English. These criteria are necessary for admission to our university.

Name: Russo Business School
Overview:
Introducing Russo Business School, a dynamic higher education institution that offers unrivaled opportunities for companies, professionals, and students through innovative programs in business, leadership, and entrepreneurship. Part of the renowned Sarina Russo Group, a global leader in education, training, and employment, Russo Business School strives to create successful entrepreneurs from the ground up. Our unique point of difference? Free job placement for students.

In 1979, Sarina Russo founded "The Office" Business Academy, a pioneering institution that focused on secretarial training and offered the industry's first-ever student job placement program. Building on this success, in 1980, she established "The Office" International College, a destination for international students seeking English language classes and study tour programs.

As Sarina's business endeavors continued to flourish, in 1987 she relocated her activities to the bustling heart of Brisbane City, specifically her own high-rise building, Sarina Russo Centre - 82 Ann Street. Five years later, in 1992, Russo Institute of Technology Australia was launched, offering an array of English, Business, Information Technology, and Hotel and Tourism programs.

In 1998, Sarina's entrepreneurial spirit and dedication to advancing education earned her a major government contract to own and manage 31 "Job Network" offices throughout Australia, which were later established as Sarina Russo Job Access Australia. In 2000, this organization relocated its headquarters to Sarina Russo Plaza, a building that Sarina had recently purchased and renovated to suit its needs.

As the company continued to expand, Sarina acquired her third high-rise skyscraper in Brisbane City, Sarina Russo River Centre - 100 Eagle Street, to serve as its national headquarters. In 2017, she announced the formation of Sarina Russo Schools | Australia, a comprehensive education provider that includes Russo English | Australia, Russo College | Australia (a popular pathway to university program), Russo School of Hotel and Tourism | Australia, and Russo Institute | Australia, cementing the company's reputation as a premier provider of English language and university preparation courses.

In line with our commitment to promoting education, Russo English | Australia launched the Bridging English Admission Program (BEEP) in 2019, offering a direct entry English qualification program for students interested in pursuing higher education. At Russo Business School, we believe in empowering individuals to achieve their goals through quality education and professional development.
Eligibility Overview:
At Russo Business School, we highly value diversity and believe that every student has unique skills and abilities that can contribute to our learning community. As such, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds and walks of life to join us in pursuing their education and career goals.

To apply to our university, you can start by filling out our application form and providing all necessary supporting documents. These include verified academic transcripts and English proficiency scores, such as IELTS, TOEFL, or Pearson (PTE Academic). If you have any prior learning that you would like to be considered for recognition, please make sure to indicate it on your application form.

It is important to note that if your academic transcripts or any other documents are in a language other than English, they must be translated by either the issuing organization or an official translating service. This translation must be certified and official.

Once we receive your completed application and supporting documents, our evaluation process will begin. We will review your application based on the academic and English entry requirements for your desired degree.

Eligibility Overview:
Important Entry Requirements for CQUniversity Programs 

Undergraduate Requirements 
Achievement of the equivalent of Year 12 in Australia is a necessary condition for entry into any undergraduate program. This can also be satisfied by completing authorized university foundation studies or an Australian Certificate IV. If you have successfully completed a certificate, diploma, or advanced diploma (or its equivalent), you may also be eligible for advanced standing in your selected program at CQUniversity. 

Postgraduate Requirements 
In order to be considered for any postgraduate program at CQUniversity, applicants must have completed a bachelor's degree with a pass grade average in the final two terms from a recognized higher education institution. 

English Language Proficiency 
Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate their proficiency in the language. This can be done by providing evidence of completing studies in an English-speaking country, or by achieving required scores on approved English language tests.

Name: University of Adelaide College - Melbourne
Overview:
The University of Adelaide College, a member of the prestigious Group of Eight universities, is the preferred pathway provider for the University of Adelaide. In 2020, the university established its first interstate campus in Docklands, Melbourne, marking a significant milestone in its 147-year history. This institution is renowned for its outstanding academic reputation, with a QS rating of five stars plus. It has consistently been ranked in the top 1% globally by both the Times Higher Education and QS ranking. The University offers a variety of programs such as Degree Transfer, English Language, Pre-Master's, and Foundation Studies, all of which serve as pathways to postgraduate and undergraduate degrees at the University of Adelaide.

The University of Adelaide College Melbourne provides flexibility to its students by offering three intake periods per year. Students from various countries, including China, Indonesia, Singapore, Egypt, Oman, South Korea, Hong Kong, Malaysia, India, and Vietnam, choose to study at this esteemed institution. The Melbourne campus offers a range of facilities for its students, including an Academic Support Centre, Student Support team, Resource Centre, and Career Central.

The University of Adelaide College Melbourne fees for Foundation Studies Program range from $25,000 AUD to $30,000 AUD, depending on the chosen study area. The Pre-Master's Program (Three Trimesters) costs between $40,000 AUD and $45,000 AUD, while the Pre-Master's Program Accelerated (Two Trimesters) is priced between $20,000 AUD and $25,000 AUD for all areas of study. Additionally, students are required to pay enrolment fees ranging between $300 AUD and $400 AUD in addition to the tuition fees.

This esteemed institution boasts a legacy of over 100 Rhodes Scholars and five Nobel Laureates. Some notable alumni of the University include Julia Gillard, the first female Prime Minister of Australia, Robin Warren, a Nobel Prize recipient, and bestselling author J.M. Coetzee. The preferred student accommodation provider for the University of Adelaide College is Scape @University of Adelaide, offering a range of rooms with unlimited internet access, electricity, and water included in the weekly rent.

UniLodge City Gardens, another new student accommodation option, also boasts of great facilities and a prime location. With communal areas like gym, laundry rooms, kitchen and dining space, it is perfect for students to socialize and study. The Village and UniLodge City Gardens are a 25-minute brisk walk or a short bus ride from the College.

Finally, Atira Apartments, situated on Waymouth Street, is a convenient and modern accommodation option for students. Name: Victoria University - Sydney Campus
Overview:
Located in the heart of Sydney's central business district, the Victoria University-Sydney Campus is a renowned public university in Australia. It offers both Technical and Further Education (TAFE) as well as higher education courses, making it a sought-after dual-sector center. The university follows the innovative VU Block Model, where one unit is taught concurrently, allowing for focused and enhanced learning.

Each level of education (certificates, diplomas, advanced diplomas) has its own specific requirements, which can be found on the university's website. In terms of English proficiency, a minimum score of 5.5 bands overall in Academic IELTS is required, with a minimum of 5 in each section. Alternatively, a TOEFL score of 55 (with specific scores for Listening, Speaking, Reading, and Writing) or a PTE Academic score of 42-49 (with no section score less than 40) is also accepted. Additionally, an overall score of 162 (with no individual section score less than 154) in the Advanced (CAE) at the University of Cambridge or completion of VU English-English for Academic Purposes (EAP) (Level 4) are also recognized as proof of English proficiency.

Name: Murdoch University
Overview:
Established in 1973, located in Perth, Australia, Murdoch University is an illustrious public research university. It boasts of a diverse student body of over 23,000 students, enrolled in undergraduate, postgraduate, and research programs in 9 study areas, including business, engineering, and teaching. The university boasts a highly qualified staff of 1,700 members. It offers a diverse range of 313 courses, including data science, Asian studies, creative media, global security, and extractive metallurgy. The university has four campuses, namely the Perth campus, CBD campus, Mandurah campus, and Rockingham campus.

The university's extensive libraries, including the Geoffrey Bolton Library, Mandurah Campus Library, and Veterinary Library, provide students access to an extensive collection of books, journals, articles, e-publications, and study spaces. Additionally, the university offers a variety of Murdoch University online courses on health, environment, and technology on FutureLearn.

For students looking to enroll at Murdoch University, the university offers various enabling courses, both online and offline, such as FlexiTrack, On Track, and K-Track. The university also offers several honors courses, including communications, criminology, and law, to help students pursue a postgraduate program. Students can opt for either full-time or part-time study, with the option to switch later on.

Through the Study Abroad and Exchange Program, the university offers international students from its Singapore, Dubai, and Myanmar campuses, as well as its partner universities, the opportunity to study at Murdoch. The university also provides various financial aid options, such as HELP loans, the AJ Parker Memorial Scholarship, Academic Excellence Awards, Apiam Animal Health Bursary, and Alumni Tuition Fee Discounts.

For student housing, Murdoch University Villages provides comfortable living spaces to over 800 students in 1-6 bedroom apartments. For those looking for off-campus housing options, there are shared and independent accommodation options available in the surrounding suburbs.

Students can also take advantage of over 110 Murdoch Guild clubs, offering diverse interests like the Murdoch Rockers, The Singapore Link, and VETSOS, as well as various sports teams, including cricket, athletics, badminton, and netball.

Fitness enthusiasts can make use of the university's extensive sports facilities, including indoor and outdoor courts, the Lower Bush Court sports field, sports oval, and The Zone Fitness Center. Murdoch University's MBA program has a high success rate, with graduates earning an average salary of AUD 77,000, according to reports.

Placement: An important aspect of tertiary education involves student work placements, which involve students dedicating an extended period of time to a defined programme within a host organization, under appropriate supervision. These placements require students to perform unpaid work in order to fulfill the requirements of their vocational course, all while receiving academic credit. These placements, often referred to as internships, practicums or clinical placements depending on the field of study, are guided by a workplace business agreement that the host organization signs with Murdoch University. This agreement not only outlines the terms and conditions of the placement but also ensures that the student is covered by appropriate insurance policies. This agreement is typically valid for a three-year period. It's important to note that there is no obligation for host organizations to offer positions to students at the completion of their placement.
Accommodation: The following is information about the accommodation options available at a university. The university village, named Murdoch University Village, is home to a vibrant community of more than 800 students. The village offers a variety of secure residences and a range of recreational amenities, including a beach volleyball court, pool, study rooms, and a student lounge. Additionally, students have the opportunity to participate in the Live, Learn, and Grow residential living program, designed to assist with the transition to college life. There are also various off-campus accommodation options available for students, including shared or independent housing. For those looking to live close to the university's Perth campus, suburbs like Murdoch, Kardinya, Leeming, Coolbellup, Bibra Lake, North Lake, Bull Creek, Winthrop, Bateman, or Willagee are recommended. Alternatively, international students can apply for homestay housing through the Australian Homestay Network, which allows them to experience living with an Australian family while studying abroad. This offers the opportunity to improve English language skills and learn about local culture. Host families also provide support and guidance to students during their stay. For more information, please visit https://www.murdoch.edu.au/study/international-students/life-in-perth/accommodation.

It has ranked consistently within the range of 551 and 600 in the QS World University Rankings for three consecutive years, from 2019 to 2021. The QS World University Rankings gives the utmost importance to academic prestige (40%), followed by faculty-to-student ratio and citations per faculty (20%) each, as part of their evaluation process. Moreover, The Times Higher Education (THE) has ranked Murdoch University between 501 and 600 for 2021 and between 401 and 500 for the past four years, from 2017 to 2020. The Times Higher Education (THE) considers teaching, research, and citations as their primary determining factors, with 30% weightage each. US News & World Report's Global Universities for 2021, ranks Murdoch University at 679. Previously, the university held the 637th spot for the years 2019 and 2020. Name: Institute of Health and Management (IHM) - Melbourne CBD
Overview: Located in North Melbourne, the Institute of Health and Management (IHM) is a renowned institution that focuses on offering high-quality education and research opportunities in the field of Nursing. Established by Health Careers International (HCI), IHM is a sister organization of the Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA). It provides exceptional postgraduate degrees for Nurses under the guidance of experienced nursing academics. With its strong global network, IHM is the ideal choice for individuals looking for a successful career in the medical industry. The institute boasts state-of-the-art facilities, including fully-equipped simulation labs, and offers students the convenience of interactive sessions led by expert educators and round-the-clock support from skilled facilitators. Moreover, IHM has an impressive track record of training over 2,000 nurses, helping them build a solid foundation in nursing and secure employment opportunities in Australia. It has four campuses situated in Melbourne CBD, North Melbourne, Perth, and Sydney, and is accredited by NCAP. This accreditation allows IHM to offer the Gateway to Global Nursing program, a platform that enables nurses to register and practice in English-speaking countries like Canada and New Zealand. Recognized as one of the top 25 higher education institutions for its commitment to providing quality education, IHM is constantly striving to make significant contributions to the healthcare sector in Australia. Additionally, as part of its nationwide initiatives, IHM has also launched a student referral program to encourage students and employees in the Health industry to promote and enhance the institute. At IHM, our ultimate goal is to support the growth and development of healthcare professionals and contribute to the overall improvement of the health sector in Australia.
Eligibility Overview:
Listed below are the requirements for admission to the Master of Nursing program at our university. Please ensure that your application meets these criteria:

- Possess a Bachelor's degree in Nursing or its equivalent
- Be a registered nurse with AHPRA
- If not registered with AHPRA, hold registration with the Nurses' Board/Council in your country of residence or origin
- Demonstrate English Language Proficiency by fulfilling one of the following criteria:

- Achieve an overall score of at least 6.5 in the IELTS with no individual band score below 6
- Obtain equivalent scores in OET, PTE or other recognized English examinations
- Successfully complete an English for Academic Purpose (EAP) course with a score of no less than 70%

Note: The purpose of these requirements is to ensure that all successful candidates have a strong understanding of English, which is necessary for success in our program.

English Language Proficiency requirements are as follows:

PTE: Overall score of 56 with no individual band score below 46
IELTS: Overall score of 6.5 with no individual band score below 6.0
OET: Overall score of 6.5 with no individual grade below B

Name: The University of Queensland
Overview: Established in 1909, The University of Queensland is an esteemed Australian public research institute and one of the six sandstone universities. It is highly renowned for its Doctor of Philosophy, Bachelor of Engineering, and Bachelor of Arts programs and has a large student enrollment of over 55,305 individuals, including 35,051 undergraduates and 19,939 postgraduates. The university consists of six faculties including Science, Medicine, Business, Economics and Law, as well as eight institutes such as the Global Change Institute and Queensland Brain Institute. With a robust team of 7,208 staff members, the university offers a wide range of courses including Drama, Earth Science, Australian Studies, Agribusiness and Veterinary Science. The university has three main campuses, namely St. Lucia, Gatton, and Herston, as well as multiple research sites. The library system of The University of Queensland is well-equipped with over 2.17 million books, 158,000 journals, and approximately 100,000 computers spread across ten branches, including the Central Library, Fryer Library, and Law Library. The university offers Professional Doctorate and Higher Degree by Research programs. To ease the transition for new students, the UQ College initiative prepares them for university life, and there are also multiple courses available in the Summer semester. Additionally, the Study Abroad and Exchanges program enables students from other universities to study at UQ for a semester or two. The university also provides various financial assistance options, including Google PhD Fellowships, Sleath String Performance Prize, Science International Scholarship, and Barbara Hebden Music Bursary. As for accommodation, there are eleven residential colleges with dining services on campus, such as Kings College, Grace College, and Emmanuel College, offering various rooms, including standard, deluxe, suite, and shared options. UQ students can also join one of the 220 clubs and societies, such as VESA UQ, One for the World, or UQ Menzies, for a well-rounded university experience. For sports enthusiasts, the university has excellent facilities, including the Aquatic Centre, Old Gym, Fitness Centre, courts, and fields. Upon graduation with a bachelor's degree from UQ, students have the potential to earn an average starting salary of AUD 52,000- AUD 58,000.
Eligibility Overview: The required English proficiency for admission to this university varies based on the program of study. For clinical programs, a minimum overall score of 7.0 in IELTS is required, with a score of 7.0 in each sub-band. For all other disciplines, a minimum overall score of 6.5 in IELTS is needed, with at least a 6.0 in each sub-band. Alternatively, applicants must have a minimum score of 570 on the paper-based TOEFL, with 5.0 on the TWE and 54 on reading and listening. For the internet-based TOEFL, a minimum score of 87 is required, with at least a 21 in writing and 19 in reading, listening, and speaking. A total score of 64 on the PTE is also acceptable, with a minimum score of 60 in each sub-band. Students who completed XII grade from the CBSE, ICSE, or State Boards of Gujarat, Maharashtra, West Bengal, and Karnataka may be exempt from the ESL criteria if they have received the university's minimum English grades. Please visit the university's website for more information.

Eligibility Overview:
The requirements for international students to apply for an undergraduate programme at this university are as follows: a recognized senior secondary school diploma or equivalent, a foundational course from a recognized university, a two- or three-year diploma, advanced diploma, or associate degree, or a minimum of one year of study towards a university degree at an accredited institution.

Academic criteria apply for Indian applicants seeking admission at Macquarie University. This includes proficiency in English and satisfactory grades during their schooling or college years. The university follows specific criteria for undergraduate admissions: CBSE based scores on the average of top four academic subjects for AISSC holders, state board scores calculated using the average of all subjects for HSSC holders, and ISC scores considering an average of top three academic electives in addition to English. For postgraduate programmes, a minimum passing mark of 50% (second class) is required for Group A (percentage) and a grade of C or 5.0 (Pass) for Group B (point system), with WAM ranging between 50% and 60% and between 5.0 and 6.0, respectively. International students must also meet the English language proficiency requirements.

Name: The University of Western Australia
Overview: The University of Western Australia, founded in 1911, is the oldest research-based university in Australia. The university's main campus, situated in Swan River, Perth, contains a mix of modern and historic buildings, equipped with state-of-the-art facilities such as research labs, lecture halls, performance theaters, and more. Another campus, UWA Albany, is located in the Old Post Office Building in Albany and offers advanced academic programs, including the UWA Albany center, excellence in natural resource management, and rural clinical school. The university boasts a diverse offering of over 290 bachelor's and master's programs through its six faculties and schools, which include agriculture, environment & biological sciences, architecture, design & planning, business & commerce, education, engineering, humanities & social sciences, and law. The most sought-after programs at UWA are in the fields of arts, biomedical sciences, business, science, and philosophy. The university houses various research institutes, including the Ocean Institute, Center for Software Practice, and Center for Energy and Minerals. The average cost of pursuing a bachelor's degree is approximately AUD 42,540, while a master's degree costs around AUD 47,696. For international students, the average cost of living is around AUD 8,662 per annum. UWA offers financial assistance in the form of university-funded scholarships and loans to help students finance their education in Australia. Boasting top rankings for graduate employment, research excellence, and academic facilities, the University of Western Australia provides pre-placement programs and career center workshops to equip students with the necessary skills and opportunities to secure jobs and internships during their studies.
Eligibility Overview: The minimum educational prerequisite for entry to the Western Australian University Foundation Programme (WAUFP) is a Year 11 qualification or equivalent. This programme is specifically designed for international students who are non-native English speakers and do not meet the academic requirements for direct admission into a university in Western Australia.

Name: Charles Sturt University
Overview: Established in 1989 in New South Wales, Australia, Charles Sturt University is a leading public university consisting of three faculties - Arts and Education, Business, Justice and Behavioural Sciences, and Science. These faculties are further divided into schools and centers, offering an extensive range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and research programs to more than 43,697 students, including 10,623 international students. The university prides itself on its courses in Viticulture, Speech Pathology, Applied Finance, Criminal Justice, and Gerontology. With six campuses located in Dubbo, Albury-Wodonga, Orange, Bathurst, and Wagga Wagga, and several specialized campuses and study centers, Charles Sturt University provides students with a rich learning experience backed by a wealth of resources. These resources, comprising both printed and online materials, can be accessed at the six campus libraries and the three study center libraries. For students seeking to develop their professional skills, the university offers a variety of short online courses, including micro-credentials and single subjects. As an added bonus, the university also provides students with an opportunity to experience university-level academics for free through its Open Pathways courses. Furthermore, non-Charles Sturt University students can also enroll in online or campus-based courses under the Cross-institutional Learning Program. For students interested in broadening their academic horizons, the university also offers a study abroad program, allowing students to participate in short-term programs, exchanges with over 50 partner universities worldwide, global internships, work placements, and volunteer work opportunities. Charles Sturt University is also committed to providing financial assistance to its students through loans, grants, bursaries, awards, and scholarships, including HELP loans, Emergency Equity Grant, Australian Government Scholarships, and CAL Scholarship. To accommodate its diverse student population, the university offers a variety of traditional and modern on-campus accommodation options, such as en-suite, shared, and single rooms, as well as cottages and apartments. Additionally, students can also join numerous clubs and societies and participate in competitive and social sports like rugby, hockey, and netball. According to placement reports, Charles Sturt University graduates earn an average starting salary of AUD 67,100, making it an excellent choice for students seeking world-class education and career prospects.
Eligibility Overview:
For students interested in pursuing undergraduate studies at this university, they must have completed the All India Senior School Certificates from CBSE or metro state boards. An overall score of 60% in four academic subjects is required for consideration.

Candidates with an Indian School Certificate (ISC) or a completed state board award with a minimum total score of 24 or above can also apply. Additionally, those with a minimum total score of 24 or above in the International Baccalaureate are also eligible. For students who have completed two GCE A2 Levels, a minimum of 2 x D or equivalent in at least two subjects is required, with A=5, B=4, C=3, D=2, and E=1. Students with a pass in the first division in the Pre-University Certificate can also apply.

For postgraduate students, the eligibility requirements vary according to the course they wish to pursue.

One important factor to keep in mind for all applicants is the proficiency in the English language. A minimum overall score of 6.0 in IELTS is required, with no individual score below 5.5. Meeting this requirement is essential for successful enrollment at this university.

Name: Western Sydney University
Overview:
Western Sydney University, previously known as the University of Western Sydney, was founded in the year 1989 following the merger of two universities. It is regarded as one of the top public universities in Australia and boasts of multiple campuses spread across an extensive area of 1713.5 hectares. The campuses, namely Penrith, Blacktown, Campbelltown, Parramatta, Hawkesbury, and Bankstown, provide comprehensive academic, residential, and recreational facilities to students.
The university offers a diverse range of over 400 undergraduate and postgraduate programs under 16 different subject areas. Its most renowned courses include Law, Medicine, Social Sciences, Psychology, Humanities, and Business, while courses like Civil Engineering, Nursing, Agricultural Sciences, Ecology, Sociology, Education, and Tourism have also gained high recognition. Apart from traditional on-campus programs, the university also offers numerous online programs as well as pathway programs at various levels. 
Admissions at Western Sydney University are selective, primarily based on merit, and can be made through the official website or authorized agents. Admissions are granted based on a combination of factors such as IELTS, TOEFL, and PTE scores, Academic Transcripts, Award Certificates, Supplementary Documents Information, and Letters of Recommendation if required. 
The average annual tuition fee for undergraduate programs amounts to 27,662 AUD, while the cost of living per year can range between 19,713 AUD to 24,878 AUD. To assist international students with their financial needs, the university offers around 32 scholarships ranging from 5,019 AUD to 9,893 AUD. These scholarships are primarily merit-based and include the Western Sydney International Scholarships and the Vice-Chancellor's Academic Excellence Scholarships. 
The university also provides on-campus accommodation options at reasonable prices. These self-catered, fully furnished rooms offer various amenities such as student lounges with communal kitchens, TV lounges, computer and study rooms, BBQ areas, and free internet access. The costs for on-campus accommodation range from 160 AUD to 320 AUD per week. 
In addition to offering excellent academic programs, Western Sydney University also promotes student development through its 270 clubs and organizations. These clubs cater to various interests and help students enhance their skills and expand their network. 
Western Sydney University boasts of an impressive placement record with 83.4% of undergraduate and 91.5% of postgraduate students securing jobs within four months of graduation. The average salary offered to graduates is 89,000 AUD. To ensure that students receive ample employment opportunities, the university organizes programs like Career Mentoring, Women in Science and Engineering, and Career-Launch programs.
Eligibility Overview:
The admission eligibility requirements for WSU Australia involve meeting the minimum academic and English proficiency criteria. Applicants must also be at least 18 years old at the time of application, with some exceptions for international students who must fulfill additional conditions. It's important to note that international and Australian applicants are held to the same standards. While the qualifications listed below serve as a baseline for admission, they do not guarantee acceptance as some courses may have specific entry criteria and work experience requirements. These course-specific requirements can be found in our guidebook. WSU Australia has country-specific minimum requirements for each course, which applies to Indian students as follows:

University Foundation Studies (three semesters)
- Successful completion of Year 11 with an overall grade of: 
  - 50% for CBSE
  - 50% for ISC
  - 65% for state boards
University Foundation Studies (two semesters)
- Successful completion of Year 11 with an overall grade of: 
  - 60% for CBSE 
  - 60% for ISC 
  - 75% for state boards 
Diploma (three semesters)
- Completion of the Higher Secondary Certificate with an average score (best four) of: 
  - 50% for CBSE 
  - 50% for ISC 
  - 55% for state boards 
Diploma (two semesters) 
- Completion of the Higher Secondary Certificate with an average score (best four) of: 
  - 55% for CBSE 
  - 55% for ISC 
  - 65% for state boards 
Bachelor's degree 
- Completion of the Higher Secondary Certificate with an average score (best four) of: 
  - 60% for CBSE 
  - 60% for ISC 
  - 70% for state boards
Master's degree 
- Completion of a recognized Bachelor's degree, which is comparable to an Australian degree.

The University's Placements Hub plays a pivotal role in facilitating internships and other work-integrated learning experiences for students. Its primary function is to lead and coordinate a university-wide initiative to implement partnership-based pedagogy. The Hub ensures that the curriculum aligns with legislative and accreditation guidelines, as well as university regulations and administrative processes. 

To achieve this, the Placements Hub works closely with various stakeholders to design and oversee effective placement programs. These programs are tailored to meet the needs of industry and ensure that students gain practical experience that prepares them for their future careers. The Hub also stays updated on the latest developments in legislative and accreditation frameworks to ensure that the placement programs are aligned with these standards.

Moreover, the Placements Hub is responsible for managing administrative tasks related to placements, such as logistics, documentation, and assessment processes. This

On-campus accommodation is readily available, offering amenities such as study rooms, computer rooms for collaborative work, laundry services, and recreational activities like table tennis, pool, and sand volleyball. Off-campus housing is also an option, with various options like studio flats, shared apartments, and homestays. The average weekly rent ranges from 200 to 400 Australian dollars. These off-campus options are conveniently located and well-equipped, providing key-in rooms, furnished with a desk, high-quality mattresses, TV, free Wi-Fi, and ample off-road parking. Name: Federation University - Berwick
Overview:
The Berwick campus of Federation University is located in Melbourne's southeastern outskirts, approximately 40 kilometers from the city center. Easily accessible by a well-connected rail network, the campus sits on land that has been traditionally occupied by the Wurundjeri and Boon Wurrung peoples. The campus boasts modern, architecturally-designed multi-level buildings surrounded by ample gardens and courtyards. Additionally, the bustling Berwick Village Center is within close proximity, providing convenient access to a wide range of facilities for students to enjoy.

Comprised of various schools including the School of Arts, School of Education, Federation Business School, School of Health, School of Science, Psychology and Sport, and the School of Engineering, Information Technology, and Physical Sciences, the campus offers a vast selection of courses. The campus also houses important facilities such as the Aboriginal Education Centre, Centre for Learning Innovation and Professional Practice (CLIPP), Nursing labs, PC Laboratories, Student Lounge, and Science Labs, to name a few. To support students in their academic journey, the campus offers the widely popular ASK (Academic Skills and Knowledge) program, led by a team of dedicated and experienced student leaders. This program assists students with various aspects of their undergraduate degree, from finding relevant reading materials to perfecting their referencing skills.

In terms of accommodation, the campus is committed to providing a variety of options for students, staff, and community members through Fedliving, catering to long, short, and medium-term stays with flexible solutions.

At Federation University Berwick campus, research is highly valued and contributes significantly to its academic stature. The university has identified three broad, cross-disciplinary research priority areas: Society and the environment, Virtual, digital and computational environments, and Health and wellbeing. In the recent Excellence in Research for Australia (ERA) evaluation, 80% of the submitted Fields of Research (FoR) received ratings at or above world standard, showcasing the university's commitment to producing high-quality research.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Criteria: For Bachelor's Degree - 12th Class (Indian School Certificate or the All India Senior School Certificate) with 60% average OR 65% average for Higher Secondary Certificate (State Board). For Postgraduate Degree - Australian bachelor's degree or equivalent from abroad with specified minimum CGPA or grades. Some postgraduate programmes may also require relevant work experience for admission, such as an MBA. The applicant must also score an IELTS 6.0 (no section less than 6.0) for non-research based programmes. For research programmes, a master's degree and a well-formulated research proposal is a prerequisite. The master's degree must include a dissertation showcasing the potential for conducting PhD-level research. English Language Proficiency: IELTS 6.0 (no section less than 6.0).

Placement:
At Federation University, students have access to a range of on-campus placement opportunities offered by different organizations. One such program is the Career Accelerate Program (CAP) which focuses on enhancing students' employability skills. Participation in CAP is mandatory, as it is an integral part of the Industry Placement Program. CareerHub, the university's electronic job board, features job postings from registered companies. These include part-time or temporary positions as well as roles specific to students' fields of study. 

Based on the 2018 Graduate Outcomes Survey, nearly 90% of undergraduates from Federation University landed jobs upon graduation. Impressively, over 78% of these graduates secured full-time employment, surpassing the national average of 72.9%. The university also achieved a 91% employer satisfaction rate in the 2018 Employer Satisfaction Survey, ranking first among all Australian universities. The high employability rates and satisfaction of employers from Federation University speak to the institution's strong commitment to preparing students for the workforce. Furthermore, reports indicate that a significant number of graduates choose to live and work in the regions where they studied, contributing to the local economy. Postgraduate alumni from the university also show a strong presence in their respective regions, with 63% of them actively working in the area.

These options include flexible catering, self-contained units, houses, and apartments, both on and off-campus. Each Ballarat residence is conveniently equipped with a kitchen/common area, two bathrooms, and one study bedroom, accommodating a range of 10-12 students. Our single spacious bedrooms with shared bathrooms are available in Peter Lalor Hall. Living in Peter Lalor allows easy access to your classes and all the university's facilities. Bella Guerin Hall, situated in the beautiful Mt. Helen Campus, consists of independent two-story buildings, housing 11 students each. Here, students can share a well-equipped kitchen, living area, dining space and two bathrooms, while being surrounded by serene landscaped gardens. Jemacra Place provides easy access to public transport and nearby shopping centers. Just minutes away from Mt. Helen Campus, this community accommodates up to five or six students in its multi-bedroom residences. Enjoy the paved outdoor area with a beautiful pergola. The Camp Street residence is perfect for those looking to live in the heart of Ballarat. This apartment-style residence has four-bedroom units and exclusive ensuite studio rooms with kitchenettes, along with a large self-catering kitchen. Six students can find a comfortable living space in the Victoria Street House, a spacious historic home. Its residents share a well-equipped kitchen, dining room, TV room and laundry facilities. The Victoria Street Hotel is perfect for twelve students, offering single rooms with private bathrooms.

Name: The University of Newcastle
Overview:
The University of Newcastle, located in New South Wales, is a well-established public university in Australia. It was founded in 1965 under the name "Newcastle University," and is widely recognized for its innovative approach towards medical education, including the introduction of a problem-based curriculum and the Undergraduate Medical and Health Services Admission Test (UMAT), which is now the standard nationwide. The university's five faculties offer a wide range of programs, including certificates, undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees. Some of the most popular courses at the University of Newcastle are Bachelor of Medical Science, Masters in Cyber Security, and Masters of Business Administration (MBA).

Spread across 346 acres of land, the university's main campus in Callaghan, Newcastle, is the largest and houses all of its primary faculties, offices, and student administration centres. It also has an international campus located in Singapore. The university boasts a diverse and dynamic student community, providing its students with a holistic learning experience. With over 100 registered student organizations and clubs, students have plenty of opportunities to connect and collaborate with their peers outside of academics. To promote student welfare, the university organizes various innovative events and activities throughout the year, such as Band Camp and Student Engagement Awards.

The cost of tuition at the University of Newcastle ranges from AUD 29,500 to 39,000 per annum, depending on the selected program and its duration. This makes it an affordable option for many students seeking quality education.
Eligibility Overview:
The GPA requirements for admission to this university are a minimum of 2.0/4.0 or an equivalent score. This applies to undergraduate students and they must have completed at least one full year of study at a university or approved higher education institution. For postgraduate admission, applicants must have a bachelor's degree in an appropriate field.

If you are considering a gap year admission, you will need to provide a complete high school transcript for individual evaluation.

To be eligible for admission, international students must meet the English language requirements. This includes providing proof of proficiency in English through a recognized test or equivalent. Exceptional cases may be considered on an individual basis.

Name: Victoria University
Overview:
Victoria University, situated in Melbourne, Victoria, is a well-established public institution offering research and dual-sector tertiary education. It was established in 1916 and currently boasts an enrollment of approximately 40,000 students in training, vocational programs, and degree courses across its six colleges. These colleges include VU College, Victoria University Business School, School for the Visitor Economy, First Year College, and School for Transport Systems and Civic Infrastructure. The university offers a wide range of courses including Youth Work, Sports Management, Psychological Studies, Nursing, and Business Administration.
Through its online platform, Victoria University Online, students have access to various undergraduate, postgraduate, diploma, and certificate courses that can be completed from the comfort of their own home. The university also provides pathway courses, such as Law, Business, Education and Arts, to enable students to transition seamlessly between different levels of education. Additionally, the university offers 13-week foundation courses to support students in their academic journey. For those looking to improve their skills, the university provides a variety of short courses, including professional and personal development courses, job-ready courses, and single units of study.
At Victoria University, financial aid is available in the form of scholarships, grants, bursaries, awards, and loans. These include the Higher Education Loan Program, VU Alumni Discount, Australia Awards fellowships, Indigenous Commonwealth scholarships, and more. These resources aim to assist students in achieving their academic goals and further their education.
Eligibility Overview:
The eligibility requirements for overseas applicants interested in participating in Victoria University's programs are outlined below: 

Requirements for Undergraduate Programs: 

There are two main components to the eligibility criteria for undergraduate programs - basic education and English proficiency. Please note that the requirements for certificates, diplomas, and advanced diplomas differ from the requirements for bachelor's degrees. 

Certificates, Diplomas, and Advanced Diplomas: 

Basic Education: Each certificate and diploma program has specific requirements which can be found on the university's website. Please refer to the dedicated course page for more information. 

English Proficiency: Applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English through one of the following ways: 

- Academic IELTS: A minimum overall band score of 5.5, with no individual score below 5. 
- TOEFL: An aggregate score of 55, with a minimum score of 9 in the Listening section, 16 in Speaking, 10 in Reading, and 18 in Writing. 
- PTE Academic: A total score of 42-49, with no section score below 40. 
- CAE (Advanced) at the University of Cambridge: A minimum total score of 162, with no individual score below 154. 
- Completion of VU English - English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program at Level 4.

Bachelor's Degrees: 

Basic Education: Applicants must have completed Grade 12 in a relevant discipline, equivalent to an Australian Year 12 certificate. 

English Proficiency: Applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English through one of the following ways: 

- Academic IELTS: A minimum overall band score of 6, with no individual score below 6. 
- TOEFL: An aggregate score of 67, with a minimum score of 12 in the Listening section, 18 in Speaking, 15 in Reading, and 21 in Writing. 
- PTE Academic: A total score of 50-67, with no section score below 50. 
- CAE (Advanced) at the University of Cambridge: A minimum total score of 169, with no individual score below 169. 
- Completion of VU English - English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program at Level 5.

Name: University of New South Wales
Overview:
The University of New South Wales was established in 1949 and is a publicly-funded research university located in Kensington, New South Wales, Australia. It was previously known as the New South Wales University of Technology and has additional campuses in Newcastle and Wollongong. The university has six faculties including UNSW Faculty of Arts, Design & Architecture; UNSW Faculty of Business; UNSW Faculty of Engineering; UNSW Faculty of Law & Justice; UNSW Faculty of Medicine & Health; and UNSW Faculty of Science. Eligibility requirements for admission into the university's 284 postgraduate, 142 undergraduate, and doctoral degree programs are based on English language proficiency tests such as IELTS, TOEFL, PTE, and GMAT.

The university has a student population of over 64,000 and its main campus spans across 94 acres of land comprising of state-of-the-art research facilities. Other amenities provided to students include theatre and music venues, fitness centers, medical assistance, pharmacy, restaurants, pools, and shops. The university boasts a high placement rate of 94.3%, with graduates earning an average salary between AUD120,000 to AUD160,000. Students can choose from 11 residential colleges and four halls for on-campus accommodation. These facilities offer a range of services including internet access, laundry, catering, study areas, and parking.

Prospective students can apply for admission in three terms - November, March, and July - by paying an application fee of AUD125. The tuition fees for undergraduate and postgraduate courses are AUD935 and AUD735 per credit, respectively. Financial aid is also available to enrolled students through scholarships such as UNSW Business School Scholarship, UNSW Art and Design International Scholarship, and University International Postgraduate Award.

In summary, the University of New South Wales is a reputable institution with a diverse range of academic programs and ample opportunities for financial assistance. With its excellent facilities and high-quality education, it is a popular choice among students worldwide.

Before submitting an application for a degree, it's crucial to confirm that your secondary or tertiary education credentials are recognized by our institution. This includes qualifications from secondary education, higher education, diploma or other post-secondary studies, and foundation studies. A minimum percentage of 65% to 85% is required to qualify. Additionally, it's important for students to demonstrate English language proficiency by taking a standardized test. Our university has specific English language proficiency requirements that must be met.

Placement:
Internal Internships and Work Placements are excellent opportunities for university students to enhance their professional skills and obtain valuable real-world experience. These internships are highly sought-after as they provide students with valuable industry exposure, which greatly improves their employability. The following programs have been approved for inclusion on the Australian Higher Education Graduation Statement (AHEGS), making them eligible for recognition. The Construction Management and Property Work Experience Program are particularly beneficial for students as it allows them to be better prepared for the fast-paced and competitive construction and property industries. The program encourages participation in internships, cadetships, and other work experience activities related to the sector, which helps students gain practical experience and learn industry techniques and culture independently.

Interested students who wish to participate in the Construction Management and Property Work Experience Program can apply at any time by sending an email to the program coordinator. Please note that this opportunity is exclusively open to undergraduate students enrolled in the Construction Management and Property Program.

Another great opportunity for students to gain a competitive advantage in the job market is the Graduate Advantage Program (GAP). This program collaborates with prestigious firms to provide an intensive and unique professional development program for students, giving them the "graduate advantage". The program helps participants develop personal and professional skills, gain a better understanding of the corporate world, and improve their employability. To be eligible for GAP, students need to be in their final year of studies with an Australian citizenship or Permanent Residency, have a credit WAM, and be pursuing a degree through the UNSW Business School, Faculty of Engineering, Science, Law, or Arts and Social Sciences. Applicants must also be available from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. for the whole week and complete online questionnaires, interviews, curriculum vitae, and provide a copy of their academic transcript.

The Co-op Program at UNSW offers Industry Training Experience (ITE) placements for students to gain degree-relevant employment experience before graduation. Each ITE placement provides a unique learning opportunity that complements academic courses. During the ITE, scholars are expected to follow professional standards in terms of performance, attire, and business hours and complete relevant duties and obligations. To participate in ITE, students must have a credit WAM and apply directly to the UNSW Co-op Program office. Please note that this opportunity is only available in a few Co-op Program fields of study.

As an Arc member, students can participate in the Arc Internship Program to gain hands-on industry experience in their chosen field of study. The program helps students acquire practical skills that enhance their resumes and give them a competitive edge after graduation. Applications for the following year's intake open in October and close in November. The interviews start in November, and successful interns undergo an induction session in January before starting their internships in February.

UNSW Co-NNECTIONS is another excellent program that aims to improve the educational and career outcomes of students from all backgrounds. Participants go through a range of professional development events throughout two semesters to build their confidence and skills while also building a community of like-minded peers. The program is open to Equity students who have completed at least two terms of study, and recruitment for the next intake starts in the third term.

Employers can leverage the Diploma of Professional Practice (DPP) work placement program to bring excitement, energy, and entrepreneurial spirit of UNSW students to their workplace. This opportunity not only benefits employers but also creates opportunities for recent graduates to learn new job skills. The DPP is designed to help UNSW students become job-ready in a competitive job market, making them more appealing to potential employers. By hosting a student industrial placement, employers provide students with a better understanding of the workplace and a head start in their careers.

The Diploma of Professional Practice includes a range of skills and experiences, making it a highly beneficial program for students to participate in. Employers can play a crucial role in helping students gain these new skills and experiences, preparing them to excel in their future careers. By doing so, employers contribute to the betterment of the workforce and society as a whole.

Name: Stotts College - Melbourne
Overview:
"Sydney Stott founded Stotts College in 1883 with the aim of being a pioneer in education and academia. The college is accredited by the Australian Community Workers Association (ACWA) and has expanded to offer high school and graduate courses. With over 3000 enrolled students, Stotts College has been a leader in Australian academics for 138 years. The institution has three main departments - Higher Education (Bachelor Degree), Vocational (Diploma), and VCE (Victorian Certificate of Education).

One of the college's key strengths is the quality of education provided by its tutors. Popular areas of study for undergraduate and vocational courses include Business, Healthcare, Civil Construction, Accounting, Tourism and Hospitality, and Social Work. To support students, Stotts College offers various facilities such as technical laboratories, libraries, residential halls, central Wi-Fi, and student kitchen services. The Melbourne campus, which boasts excellent transport links and accommodation options, is considered the main campus.

The college's acceptance rate is relatively high, and it currently hosts 391 international students. Stotts College ranks 203rd among all secondary schools in Victoria. The institution maintains a small student-faculty ratio to ensure small class sizes and personalized attention for students. Tuition fees for international students range from $50,000 to $55,000, which may be a financial burden for some students. However, the college offers excellent placement facilities, including weekly work placement seminars. These seminars equip students with essential employability skills such as resume writing, internships, interview tips, workplace etiquette, and customer service techniques, making them job-ready upon graduation. This proven track record of employment helps students secure jobs in their chosen fields quickly.

Admission Criteria:

Minimum Requirement: Successful completion of Year 12 or its equivalent. The applicant must be at least 18 years of age.
International students must demonstrate proficiency in English by scoring at least 6.0 on the IELTS (Academic) exam.
The IELTS exam should have been completed in the last 12 months from the proposed start date of the Bachelor programs. The overall score must be 6 or higher with no band score less than 5.5 (See International Student Admission Policy).

Candidates may be eligible for credit exemptions based on prior tertiary courses completed. For more information, please feel free to contact us.
